Overall Tips and Tricks:
    Diagnostics Debugging using FND_LOG_MESSAGES
        How to obtain and read a debug logfile for R12 E-Business Tax (EBTAX) (Doc ID 417238.1)
    SysAdmin User
        How to to Define an Application User That Has All The Privileges in User Management Responsibility options As SYSADMIN User (Doc ID 378262.1)
    Set Context in R12 for org-specific views
        BEGIN
            MO_GLOBAL.SET_POLICY_CONTEXT('S', '&org_id'); -- 'S' means single org
        END;
        BEGIN
            MO_GLOBAL.SET_ORG_ACCESS(NULL,64, ONT'); -- multiple orgs, 64 is the Security Profile, 'ONT' is the application shortname
        END;
    See Section: Mult-Org Access Control Notes on Setting Context
    End-Date or Inactivate Users Temporarily (for Production Cutover)
        How to End-Date/Delete an Applications User (Doc ID 1064798.1)
    Homepage and Menu Configuration in R12
        12.1.2: How to Modify and Enable The Configurable Home Page Delivered Via 12.1.2 (Doc ID 1061482.1)
            Also shows how to revert to the old flat homepage but requires profile settings at site level
            For 12.1.3 environments set profile FND: Disable Configurable Home Page to false
    Common Login URL
        http://<Server>:<Port>/OA_HTML/jtflogin.jsp
    Set Java Home on client for installation software that needs it
        How To Set A JAVA_HOME Environment Variable In Windows (Doc ID 913108.1)
    Force browser popups for text reports and log files from SRS
        How to Set the "New Window" Link to Open in a New Window and not a Tab in IE7 and above ? (Doc ID 1070243.1)
    Increase Memory in JVM for BI Publisher Jobs
        Set the Options field on the concurrent program definition to Xmx2048M
            http://www.lc.leidenuniv.nl/awcourse/oracle/java.920/a96656/toc.htm
            https://drdavetaylor.com/2012/05/31/bi-publisher-configuring-concurrent-programs-to-publish-large-quantities-of-data/
            Don't miss the dash before the X
    Debugging OA Framework (Self-Service) Pages
        How To Create The Bug Report Output In Self-Service Application Pages? [ID 759805.1]
            If you are not seeing the 'About this Page' then clear the java server cache - as outlined in Note:759038.1
                and if still not working review the Note:400042.1 for more details
    To fix missing responsibilities on the R12 Homepage
        https://forums.oracle.com/thread/1100073
        Patch 9656424 Responsibilities Sometimes Disappear When Navigating Back To The Homepage (Doc ID 1316974.1)
        12.1.2: How to Modify and Enable The Configurable Home Page Delivered Via 12.1.2 (Doc ID 1061482.1)
    Diagnosing Error "Responsibility" is not a valid responsibility for the current user. Please contact your System Administrator.
        References
           Diagnosing database invalidation issues with Java Cache for eBusiness Suite (Doc ID 455194.1)
    To fix missing main menus after responsibility adds/changes, run (in System Administrator):
        End-date then un-end-date the user in System Administrator Security, then run the following:
        Sync responsibility role data into the WF table
            See: During Login Responsibilities Assigned to Users do not Appear in the Navigator Page [ID 565130.1]
            See: Unable to See Responsibilities after End Date Is Removed on ATG RUP6 [ID 727638.1]
        In 11i
            Run 'Synchronize WF Local Tables'
                See: Synchronize WF Local Tables Is Obsolete And Does Not Need To Be Run [ID 1158212.1]
            Run 'Workflow Directory Services User/Role Validation'
            See: Questions On The "Workflow Directory Services User/Role Validation" Program [ID 369279.1]
            Then clear the Java Middle Tier cache used by Apache i.e.  USER_INFO_CACHE under 'Functional Administrator'
        To clear the JVM Cache (Java Middle Tier cache)
            Use the Caching Framework administration page to clear the cache as required by first signing in as a user with access to the Functional Administrator responsibility.
                Once in the responsibility, select the Core Services tab and then the Caching Framework sub tab.
                Select 'Global Configuration' from the side navigation menu to navigate to the Global Cache Configuration page.
                Under the Cache Policy region, select the Clear All Cache button and answer the prompt that follows to completely flush the cache.
            References
                http://layman-is-oracleappsdba.blogspot.com/2013/07/how-to-clear-cache-in-ebs-11i-and-r12.html
                How To Clear The Cache Using Functional Administrator? (Doc ID 759038.1)
    In R11i and R12 initialize environment variables for a database session as follows:
        exec fnd_global.APPS_INITIALIZE(
            user_id => <user_id>,
            resp_id => <responsibility_id>,
            resp_appl_id => <application_id>);
        this will set your responsibility and user etc
        reference: http://oracleajidba.blogspot.com/2010/06/how-to-set-applications-context.html
            http://garethroberts.blogspot.com/2006/09/setting-your-oracle-applications.html
    In R12 the following is also needed to set the organization after apps.fnd_global.apps_initialize() to set org
        mo_global.init(<application_short_name>)
        This will read the profile option values to initialize MOAC using the security profile
        For GL responsibilities, GL_SECURITY_PKG.INIT; must also be added.
    This procedure sets up global variables and profile values in a database session.
    Call this procedure to initialize the global security context for a database session.
    You can use it for routines such as Java, PL/SQL,
        or other programs that are not integrated with either the Oracle Applications concurrent processing facility
            or Oracle Forms (both of which already do a similar initialization for a database session).
    Concurrent:Report Access Level - profile option hides concurrent jobs from other users (replaced by RBAC in R12)
        R12: How To Configure Access To Request Output Of The Same Responsibility (Doc ID 804296.1)
    Example for AR ....
        select user_id from applsys.fnd_user where user_name = 'GJARMAN';
        select responsibility_id, responsibility_name, application_id from applsys.fnd_responsibility_tl where responsibility_name like 'AR Manager%';
        exec fnd_global.apps_initialize(user_id => 2445, resp_id => 50139, resp_appl_id => 222);
        commit;
        exec mo_global.init('AR');
        commit;
    Push new responsibilites to the homepage
        374309.1 Newly added responsibility is not displayed until Apache is bounced, after applying ATG RUP3
        See Metalink Notes: 417439.1, 356529.1, 356342.1 for background and diagnostics
        Tables used are part of Workflow Directory Services - see workflow notes for table information
        Run 'Synchronize WF LOCAL Tables' to synchronize menu items
        Then Run 'Workflow Directory Services User/Role Validation' using parameters: 10000, Yes, Yes, No
        Alternatively
            Run Concurrent Program: Workflow Directory Services User/Role Validation twice
                first time with the parameters 10000,Y,N,N
                second time with the parameters 10000,N,Y,N
        Then clear the apache cache -> Functional Administrator, Core Services, Caching Framework, click on 'Total Cache Components' number
            Search on USER_INFO_CACHE, select and click 'Clear Cache'
        or, in Caching Framework, click 'Global Configuration' on the left and click 'Clear All Cache'
            See MOS Doc ID  759038.1 How To Clear The Cache Using Functional Administrator.
        Potential workaround - end-date user and un-end-date user
        Also check the records in wf_local_user_roles
        Additional job to run is 'Sync responsibility role data into the WF table'
    All views are registered under the APPS schema regardless of the schema for the underlying table
    Diagnose Oracle Forms through the menu option -> Tools/Examine
        Make sure the profile option 'Hide Diagnostics Menu Entry' is set to No
            Add the function ' FND Diagnostic Menu Entry Read Only' to the menu to make it 'Read-Only'
        You will also need to set 'Utilities:Diagnostics' to 'Yes' if you don't have the APPS password
            In R12 'Function Not Available in this Form'
        choose the SYSTEM block and last query executed to see the actual last query that was run
        You can extract a query performed by a form (last query)
            Navigate to Help/Diagnostics/Examine/Block=System/Field=LastQuery
    Responsibility determines operating unit for subledger access through a profile option (MO:Operating Unit)
        You can examine a profile setting with 'select fnd_profile.value('ORG_ID')' from dual;
    Responsibility also determines set of books for GL access (GL Set of Books Name)
        (which does not have to be the SoB attached to the operating unit for the responsibility)
        You can examine a profile setting with 'select fnd_profile.value('GL_SET_OF_BKS_ID')' from dual;
    Run 'Replicate Seed Data' concurrent process for each operating unit to setup document types etc
        See MOS Note: 134385.1 How to Run the Replicate Seed Data program
        See MOS Note: 274974.1 What Effects Does Replicate Seed Data Concurrent Request Have On Oracle Applications
    The RDA (Remote Diagnostics Agent) System Snapshot is available under the System Administrator application in Oracle Diagnostics
        Also use the responsibility 'Oracle Diagnostics Tool'.
        See MOS Note 559800.1 How To Run Application Collection Tool (ACT/RDA).
        See MOS Note 732091.1 (R12 12.0.6 and above) "R12.0.6+ : All RDA Data Collection Test"
    Print configuration is set to print '0' copies by default - it should be set to '1' by default for  printing
    Default Language Settings
        There are two settings on the personalization page: Current Session Language and Default Session Language
        The Current Session Language is defaulted from the Browser default - not from the 'Default Session Language' setting
        Set the Browser Language default in 'Tools/Internet Options/General/Languages
    You can get the Org_id behind a form with tools > examine
        Change the Blockname as $PROFILE$, choose the field name as ORG_ID
        The value will show the org id in your current session.
    Do a Forms Trace (SQL Trace and Forms Tracing)
        References
            http://avdeo.com/2008/07/29/enabling-forms-tracing-oracle-e-business-suite-r12/
            https://oracle-base.com/articles/misc/sql-trace-10046-trcsess-and-tkprof
            How to Enable and Retrieve Trace and Tkprof Files (Doc ID 2100928.1)
        SQL Tracing
            In the forms menu, choose diagnostics and enable trace from the form having the issues
            Note the location of the trace file given by the pop-up window when you enable the trace
            Replicate the issue in the form then turn off trace
            Fetch the file from the file system
            Run tkprof against the file to format the timing statistics
    Forms Runtime Diagnostics (FRD)
        FRD is a runtime event-based logging system intended to aid in the debugging of Forms applications.
        FRD is enabled at runtime on a user by user basis.
        When a form is run with FRD enabled, a combination of external user-application interactions and internal Forms processing events are written in chronological order to a log on the file system.
    See Metalink Notes:
        373548.1 - How To Collect And Use Forms Trace (FRD) in Oracle
        438652.1 - R12: Forms Runtime Diagnostics (FRD), Tracing And Logging For Forms In Oracle Applications
        445166.1 - How to create a FRD (Forms Runtime Diagnostic) Log in EBusiness Suite R12 using Forms 10g
        62664.1 - Forms Server Logging and Forms Runtime Diagnostics (FRD) Explained
        745280.1 - How to run Forms Runtime Diagnostics (FRD) in 10gR2/11g Forms
        FAQ: Common Tracing Techniques in Oracle E-Business Applications 11i and R12 [ID 296559.1]
    Upgrade to Java JRE 1.6.0_33 for Windows 7 and R12 to avoid the 'n' key triggering the navigator
        See MOS Note 389422.1: Recommended Browsers for Oracle E-Business Suite Release 12
    Find file Versions
        Quick Method
            run 'Diagnostics: Apps Check' from PO or OM Super user for the application needed
                Lists all file versions
        Sample Top Directories
            $ZX_TOP
                ./rfs01/appdev/appl/zx/12.0.0/patch/115/import/US/zxcpprog.ldt
                ./rfs01/apptest/appl/zx/12.0.0/patch/115/import/US/zxcpprog.ldt
            $AP_TOP (at DMC) Application Tier
                /u01/oracle/stage/apps/apps_st/appl/ap/12.0.0 -- AP Top
                /u01/oracle/stage/apps/apps_st/appl/ar/12.0.0 -- AR Top
        Find a file
            find ./* -name <filename.ext>  2>/dev/null (use \* for wildcards in filename)
        Find Versions of a Form (example)
            cd $AP_TOP/forms/US
            strings -a APXPMTCH.fmx | grep '$Header'
            strings -a APXRMTCH.fmx | grep '$Header'
        Find Versions of an LDT file
            strings -a zxcpprog.ldt | grep '$Header'
        Table dba_source holds PL/SQL (pls) source lines
            query line 2 where the name field matches the package name to get the version of the package
        Check table ALL_SOURCE for the version of a pls package
            Search on the file system name in the text column and then pull the first few lines based on the package column value
        Tables apps.ad_files and apps.ad_file_versions contain filenames and versions also, for XML and Java files
        Find a File Version in an Installed Patch
            System Administrator > Oracle Applications Manager > Patching and Utilities > (Enter Patch Number) Go > Details > Files Copied
    Create a Java Class to build a list of files in a Directory and Use in an LOV
        References
            https://community.oracle.com/message/3935919#3933919
    Modify 'Close Other Forms' Option in Navigator
        http://itsafeature.com/2008/12/
    Analyze Patches
        System Administrator > Oracle Applications Manager > Patching and Utilities > Patch Wizard > Go
            Set Patch Wizard Preferences by clicking the Task icon
            Click 'My Oracle Support Credentials' and set Metalink user and password
        System Administrator > Oracle Applications Manager > Patching and Utilities > Patch Wizard > Go
            Initiate task for 'Recommend/Analyze Patches' and enter specific patch numbers in Analyze Specific Patches
            Click OK
        System Administrator > Oracle Applications Manager > Patching and Utilities > Patch Wizard > Go
            Results are shown in list of concurrent programs under 'Recommended Patch Results'

Overall Profile Options
    Printer
    Concurrent:Report Copies -- sets the number of copies that will print

Overall Product Grouping Structure
    Line (e.g. Oracle e-Business Suite)
    Family (e.g. Financial Management)
    Area (e.g. Financial Common Modules)
    Product (e.g. 1087 - Oracle E-Business Tax)
Overall Document Format Rules
    Capital Letters are RESPONSIBILITIES or TABLE NAMES
    Standard Sections and order of appearance are:
        <Application Name> (<Schema Abbrev> Schema) Notes on Additional Documentation

Overall History
    Walker Financials
    October 1987: Oracle Applications Release 1 (written in UK)
    Sometime in August 1988 they released there first ERP application called accounting system that has only general Ledger functionality enabled.
        This is one of the reason of having General ledger application_id is 101.
    November 1988: Release 3
    January 1989: Release 4
    May 1989: Release 5
    October 1989: Release 6
    May 1990: Release 7
    November 1990: Release 8
    June 1992: Release 9
    1995: Release 10
    April 1998: Release 11
    July 16, 1998: First combined production installation of Oracle Applications Release 10.7 NCA at Leeson Electric Corporation.
    May 2000: Release 11i
    Feb 2006: 11.5.10.2
    31 Jan 2007: R12
    Apr 2014: R12.2
    Aut 2016: R12.2.6

Overall Navigation Notes:
    Record history is accessed for any transaction via Help/Record History to show values for CREATED_BY, CREATION_DATE, LAST_UPDATED_BY, and LAST_UPDATE_ON
    Display multiple Oracle forms at one time - in the navigator, choose Options/Multiple Windows (disable)
    You can export rows from Oracle forms from the File/Export menu - make sure 'Download' is enabled in the security options on the browser
    Use Ctrl-L to find entries in a forms menu without expanding the menu hierarchy to search for them

Overall Navigation Keyboard Help
    Autocomplete                Tab (after entering initial string segment)
    Block Menu                  Ctrl+B
    Clear Block                 F7

    Display Error               Shift+Ctrl+E

Overall Definitions:
    Taxonomy - structure of a catalog

Overall Catalog Classification Scheme
    UNSPSC - United Nations Standard Product and Service Codes (codes are Segment, Family, Class, Commodity, Business Function - total of 8 digits)
    UCC/EAN - Uniform Code Council/European Article Number
    CPV - Common Procurement Vocabulary
    GTIN - Global Trade Item Number
    HTS - Harmonized Tariff System
    NIGP - National Institute of Government Purchasing
    SIC/NAICS - Standard Industrial Classification/North American Industrial Classification System

Overall Acronyms:
    ABC   - A Class, B Class, C Class or value/criteria based inventory physical cycle counting.
                A class items have the highest priority and count frequency
    ABM   - Activity based Management
    ACH   - Automated Clearing House
    AD    - Applications DBA
    ADS   - Application Data Stores (data gathered by ASCP from each instance to run a plan)
    AFF   - Accounting Flex Field (establishes the structure of the chart of accounts)
    AIM   - Applications Implementation Methodology
    AME   - Approvals Management Engine (part of OAM)
    AMG   - Activity Management Gateway
    AOL   - Application Object Library application (generally objects prefixed FND and owned by the APPLSYS schema)
                AOL also includes application and forms server file system objects (forms, reports etc)
    APICS - American Production and Inventory Control Society
    APPLCSF - Application Common Support/Script Files - home for output and log files from concurrent manager
    APC   - Advanced Product Catalog
    ASN   - Advance Shipping Notification
    ASBN  - Advance Shipping and Billing Notification
    ATG   - Applications Technology Group (also the "Applications Technology" family of applications)
    ATO   - Assemble to Order
            (manufacture and ship at order time based on the incoming order and a manufacturing BOM and most often a discrete workorder)
    ATP   - Available to Promise
    ATR   - Available to Reserve (in Warehouse Management)
    ATS   - Application Technology Stack
    ATT   - Available to Transact (in Warehouse Management)
    ASL   - Approved Supplier List (includes supplier capacity constraint options)
    AWT   - Automatic Withholding Tax
    BACS  - Bank Automated Clearing System
    BAFO  - Best and Final Offer - solicitation from suppliers without going through an RFQ/RFP process
    BAI   - Bank Administration Institute
    BES   - Business Events System (in Oracle Workflow)
    BOD   - Bill of Distribution (a collection of local sourcing rules)
    BOR   - Bill of Resources (list of all resources and amounts to manufacture an item, calculated from the default routing)
    BIS   - Business Intelligence System (Part of the GL)
    CBO   - Cost Based Optimization
    CIP   - Construction in Progress (fixed assets classification)
    CRM   - Customer Relationship Management
    CRP   - Capacity Requirements Planning
    CPO   - Contract Purchasing Agreement
                (requires a subsequent RFQ for specific items and subsequent PO referencing the CPO and Quotation)
    CS    - Service
    CST   - Cost Management (tables are included in the BOM schema)
    CTO   - Configure to Order (allow the customer to configure the item at order time)
    CTP   - Capable to Promise (ATP plus capacity)
    CRM   - Customer Relationshop Management (Marketing, Sales and Service)
    DTD   - Document Type Definitions (for XML)
    DFI   - Data Field Identifiers - identify the codes that are embedded in a barcode
                (eg a barcode DFI for an item number is 1+).
                They allow scanning data in an arbitrary sequence
    DPIS  - Date Placed In Service (for Assets)
    DRP   - Distribution Requirements Planning
    E&O   - Excess and Obsolete
    EAD   - Express Application Database
    EBS   - E-Business Suite
    EC    - Electronic Commerce
    ECB   - European Central Bank
    ECCMA - Electronic Code and Commerce Management Association
    EC    - e-Commerce Gateway
    ECN   - Engineering Change Notice
    ECO   - Engineering Change Order
    EDIFACT - Electronic Data Interchange for Administration Commerce and Transport
    EDW   - Enterprise Data Warehouse
    EFT   - Electronic Funds Transfer
    EMU   - European Monetary Union
    EOQ   - Economic Order Quantity
    ERP   - Enterprise Resource Planning
    ERS   - Evaluated Receipts Settlement
    ETL   - Extract, Transform, Load - to update data warehouses with the most current data in the ERP database.
                Used in BIS applications.
    EUL   - End User Layer, in Discoverer. A view defined by metadata to provide access to underlying ERP data
    FAH   - Financial Accounting Hub
    FCA   - Financial Consolidation Hub
    FGI   - Finished Goods Inventory
    FII   - Financial Intelligence
    FND   - Foundation
    FNDFS - FND File Server and Report Reviewer Agent - used to retrieve reports from the Concurrent Manager server
    FSN   - Fast Moving, Slow Moving, and Non-Moving Inventory
                (used as a criteria for ABC cycle counts of physical inventory in OWM)
    FSG   - Financial Statement Generator
    FUN   - Financials Common Modules Schema
    FWK   - OA Framework or Application Framework
    GAAP  - Generally Accepted Accounting Principals
    GEMMS - Global Enterprise Manufacturing Management
                (Datalogix product for process manufacturing migrated to Oracle)
    GHR   - Government Human Resources
    GRE   - Government Reporting Entity
    GRC   - Governance, Risk and Compliance (includes OAC Oracle Application Controls)
    HCM   - Human Capital Management
    ICM   - Internal Concurrent Manager
    ICX   - Internet Commerce Exchange
                a schema within the Oracle applications for catalog management and exchange
    ICX   - Intercartridge Exchange - a feature introduced with Oracle WebServer 3.0
    IPV   - Invoice price variance account
                liability account charged with the difference between the purchased price and the invoiced price
                a liability account
    JIT   - Just in Time
    KPI   - Key Performance Indicator
    LCM   - Landed Cost Management
    LPN   - Licence Plate Number (assigned to a container of packed items in shipping)
                It identifies a container of items received into WMS
                It eliminates scanning individual items and quantites in containers
                It represents a 'handling unit' within a warehouse
    LSL   - Lower Specification Limit (see also USL)
    MDS   - Master Demand Schedule
    MDS   - Meta Data Services - for OA Framework page personalizations
    MMP   - Min/Max Planning
    MPN   - Manufacturer Part Number
    MPS   - Master Production Schedule (a production plan or production forecast) - at a higher level than MRP.
                MPS identifies the finished items to make, rather than the components needed (done by MRP)
    MRB   - Material Review Board (for receiving inspections)
    MRC   - Multiple Reporting Currencies
    MRP   - Material Resource or Requirements Planning (Little MRP - materials only)
    MRP2  - Manufacturing and Resource Planning (materials and capacity)
    MSCA  - Mobile Supply Chain Applications
    MTO   - Make to Order (similar to ATO but components are stocked at a more disassembled level)
    MTS   - Make to Stock
    NAICS - North American Industry Classification System
    NLS   - National Language Support
    NRA   - Net Resource Availability
    NSJ   - Non Standard Job (in WIP, such as a prototype or rework job or maintenance)
    OAF   - Oracle Applications Frameword
    OAG   - Open Applications Group
    OAG   - Oracle XML Gateway
    OAUG  - Oracle Applications User Group
    OFSAA - Oracle Financial Services Analytical Applications
    OHS   - Oracle HTTP Server (Apache)
    OLAP  - Online Analytical Processing
    OLTP  - Online Transaction Processing
    OSP   - Outside Processing (or subcontracting)
    OTM   - Oracle Transportation Management
    OUM   - Oracle Unified Method
    OWA   - Oracle Web Agent - an extension to the Apache listener
                that handles requests between Apache and the database (aka Web Request Broker Cartridge)
    PAC   - Periodic Average Costing - part of the BOM schema
    PHP   - Personal Home Page
    PIP   - Partner Interface Process
    PLM   - Product Lifecycle Management (part of the APC schema - Advanced Product Catalog)
    PMF   - Performance Management Framework
    PMP   - Proactive Maintenance Plan (aka Preventive Maintenance Patch or Periodic Maintenance Plan - Maintenance Plan for patches)
          - Oracle On Demand quotes it as "Periodic Maintenance Plan"
    PMV   - Performance Management Viewer
    PPV   - Purchase Price Variance Account
                Charge account for variance between PO and standard cost
                The standard cost is on the corresponding WIP resource (for OSP jobs).
                Also used if inventory is purchased at standard cost when purchases are received
    PSI   - Project Status Inquiry
                drilldown inquiry screen for projects
                based on accumulator tables populated from a concurrent manager process
    PTO   - Pick to Order
                assemble multiple items to fulfill a single order at order time
                such as a computer system: computer, monitor, keyboard, mouse
    PWB   - Planner Workbench (in MRP)
    RCCP  - Rough Cut Capacity Planning (rough version of CRP)
    RCD   - Release Content Document - contains descriptions of new features in new releases
    RICE  - Reports, Interfaces, Conversions and Extensions (and RICEW adds Workflows)
    RMA   - Return Merchanise Authority
    ROP   - Reorder Point Planning
    RDA   - Remote Diagnostics Agent
    RRA   - Report Review Agent
                default text viewer for Oracle applications - referred to by the executable FNDFS
    SCM   - Supply Chain Management
    SID   - Site Identifier (use "select INSTANCE from v$thread" to retrieve it)
                SID is used to name the SGA by hashing with the Oracle Home (DB name) to define an SGA key
                Find the Oracle DB Name or Home using "select name from v$database)
    SKU   - Stock Keeping Unit
    SMTP  - Simple Mail Transfer Protocol
    SOAP  - Simple Object Applications Protocol
    SRS   - Standard Request Submission (Window) or Standard Report Submission (Window)
            This is the standard Oracle form to submit a request and define parameters
    SRW   - SQL Report Writer
    SSO   - Single Sign On
    SWIFT - Wire Transfer Standard for interbank funds transfer (International Wires)
    TCA   - Trading Community Architecture
    TCF   - Thin Client Framework
    TOI   - Transfer of Information (training document)
    TQM   - Total Quality Management
    TPCT  - Total Product Cycle Time
    UNSPSC - United Nations Standard Products and Services Codes (developed in conjuction with Dunn and Bradstreet) - merged with ECCMA
    USL   - Upper Specification Limit (see also LSL)
    WBS   - Work Breakdown Structure
    WMS   - Warehouse Management System
    WRB   - Web Request Broker (Cartridge)
    WSRP  - Web Services in Remote Portlets
    XSS   - XML Style Sheets

Table Suffixes
    The simple rule of tables you would want to query:
    No suffix (similar to a base table)
    _B
        Base table. This is the primary table containing the base data - in theory language agnostic. An associated _TL table will have the translated display value (what will be displayed on the applications front end) for a specific code in the base table. If multi language has not been enabled there will be a one to one relationship between base and translation table. (see additional info below)
    _ALL
        If Oracle apps has been configured for multi org then these tables will have the combined data of all operating units.
    _V
        Views, in a lot of cases you may prefer to use the views which are a standardised of viewing data from more than one table
    _VL
        View with language information
    _FVL
        View with resolved lookups instead of only showing the codes
        In some cases you might want to use these tables:
    _A
        Audit tables
    _AVN, _AVC
        Audit view of what was changed, when it was changed and by who
    _F
        Tracked tables, each record associated with the same entity has a start and end date that won't overlap. Used in HR and Payroll.
        In most cases you will ignore unless there is a specfic requirements:
    _TL
        Table with language, is associated with a base or unsuffixed tabled. Contains translations of terms (multi language) relating to the base table. One record in a base table could have many translations.
    _GT
        Global temporary; data only visible by session owner. Will likely be populated when a process on the apps front end has been run, so most of the time you won't see any data in these tables.
    _T
        Seems to be interface tables, that is, it will be populate with records that are to be processed into base and other tables. Not sure if it is consistent
    _ACS
        Analytical criteria sources; assuming if you have analytics enabled this ties the data to the associated analytic tables, otherwise they are not populated.
    _H
        History table; updated only when data from the related tables has been exported (via concurrent job I am assuming), you can trace back exactly what version / state the data was in at the time of export. Useful for analytics perhaps, when the data is being exported to populate a dimension for reporting.
    _INT
        Interim table?? or interface table.
    Multi-language tables and views:
        _TL and _VL extend their associated tables with language information (Multi Language Support) if it is being used by Oracle Apps. For example the TL table contain one or more language indicators for a code so that when it is viewed on the front end it uses the associated values according to the correct language that Oracle Applications has been configured for.
        A simple example would be names of months, January could be code '1' and if language code = 'US' display value = 'January'; 'FR' display value = 'Janvier'; 'SP' display value = 'Enero etc

Overall CRM Applications:
    Marketing - campaign registration, management and response analysis, lead tracking against specific opportunities, and call notes
    Marketing Intelligence - BIS component for Marketing
    iMarketing - dynamic promotions and recommendations for an internet storefront
    Marketing Encyclopedia - content publishing to customers and targets through channel classifications and matching content attributes to channel attributes
    Sales Online - installed base and contact data for existing customers, and quoting and configuration and pricing with Order Management interface to book orders
    Telesales - telemarketing scripting and order entry for outbound and inbound telemarketing
    Field Sales - mobile computing interface to hand-held devices
    iStore - internet storefront with interface to Order Management
    Sales Compensation - commission calculator for incentive-based sales organizations
    Sales Intelligence - BIS component for sales force activities
    Service - installed base tracking, as-built configuration in the field, warranty and service agreement authorization and workflow service escalation
    Customer Care (CSC) - Contact tracking and service request initiation via Contact Center
        12.1.3+ Contact Center Profile Option Reference (Doc ID 1383999.1)
        How to Hide Tabs in Service Request and Contact Center forms (Doc ID 263028.1)
    Support - service request tracking, product defect notices, integrated with customer care to execute service request work
    Contracts - articles text, and rule base to codify contract articles and trigger billings based on contract terms
    Field Service - field dispatch of service providers for escalated service requests
    Mobile Field Service - mobile/wireless interface for service
    Scheduler (for Field Service) - personel scheduler to optimize response to service calls
    Customer Intelligence - BIS component reporting new customers, retention, satisfaction and loyalty
    iSupport - self service support for customers to access a support knowledgebase

    Multi-Org Access Control
        Can be maintained though the form function 'FNDMOPREFS' (Username 'User Preferences')
        See Metalink Note: 397362.1 'Multi-Org Access Control in Oracle Purchasing'
    The process 'Replicate Seed Data' does not run automatically for each OPU - run manually
    Internal banks are maintained in Cash Management instead of in each individual application where they are needed (e.g. AP, AR)
    External bank accounts are maintained in Payments (IBY) and TCA instead of the applications where they are needed (e.g. AP, AR)

Overall System Architecture Notes
    References
        https://www.facebook.com/groups/EBS.Sysadmin
    Architecture consists of servers (software service components), nodes (hardware), and tiers (groups of services)
        Database Tier: database, concurrent managers
            For the database, a multiple-node implementation may be achieved
                by implementing Oracle Real Application Clusters (RAC).
            Additional information for implementing Oracle RAC is in MetaLink Note 312731.1.
        Concurrent Manager (batch processing) can be implemented on the database tier
            It can also be implemented on a separate node
            Information on Parallel Concurrent Processing (multinode) is in MetaLink Note 185489.1.
        Application Tier: contains forms server (for .fmb and .fmx files), web server (for java and html files),
            The Oracle Application Server is also called iAS, AS, Oracle HTTP Server (OHS), or simply Apache.
                Superceded by WebLogic (WLS), Glassfish and Apache Tomcat
            The iAS listens for incoming requests on a specific port.
            The iAS also runs the JServs that are used to service Java requests.
            For Oracle Applications, the iAS may also be configured to run Forms servlets.
                If this is the case, then the iAS will also service Forms sessions.
                If Forms servlets are not configured for the iAS, then Forms sessions are serviced
            Much like the iAS, the Forms Server listens for incoming requests on a specific port.
                The Forms Node is the nodethat runs the Forms Server.
        Desktop Tier: contains HTML, browser tier
    Overall performance may be significantly improved if Oracle Web Cache
        Additional details on Web Cache is in MetaLink Note 306653.1.

Overall Performance Tuning
    References
        https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bcVbR_FPWKk -- intro how to read execution/explain plans - skillbuilder
        http://www.skillbuilders.com/oracle/Oracle-Consulting-Training.cfm?category=oracle-database-training&tab=free-tutorials -- Skillbuilder Oracle Free training
        Tuning performance on eBusiness suite (Doc ID 744143.1)
    A Holistic Approach to Performance Tuning Oracle Applications Systems (Doc ID 69565.1)
        Includes 'Clever Queries' using bind variables
    Execution Steps
        Parse
            Soft - check syntax, semantics and permissions
                Search the library cache for existing parsed statement
            Hard - parse lock referenced objects
                Evaluate different execution plans (up to 2000)
                Select lowest cost plan
                Store lowest cost plan in library cache
        Bind
            Fetch variable values in statements 
        Execute
            I/O from disk and copy blocks of data to buffer cache
            Shared locks on tables, exclusive locks on rows
        Fetch
            Select rows
            Join and Aggregate
            Project columns (choose specific columns)
            Sort
    Optimization Concepts
        Lowest DB Time
            Working time, waiting time (for locks), I/O
        Rule vs Cost Based Optimization (rule-based optimizer is deprecated)
            Rule based optimizer uses 15 access rules in order of preference
            Cost based optimizer uses a cost value of all components
                Rewrites queries to more optimal structures
    Exectuion Plans show how a query is executed
        Explain Plan - shows expected execution plan and not actual execution used
        SQL*Plus Autotrace - shows actual execution used
        SQL Trace - shows disk and memory I/O activity (additional)
    Automated Workload Repository (AWR) report (awrrpt.sql),

Overall Bugs and Bug Status Tracking
    My Oracle Support by following these steps:
        1. Note the "Search All Sources" field in the upper right corner of your My Oracle Support window.
        2. Immediately to the left of this field is a dropdown menu containing alternate database source options. Click this dropdown and choose Bug Number.
        3. Enter the Bug/ER Number you wish to track, and click Find (i.e., the magnifying glass icon).
        4. When the Bug/ER is opened for view, click on the Star icon at top right to add as a Favorite.
        5. In the "Favorites" drop down menu ("Star" LOV at upper right) under the "Bugs" category, this Bug/ER is now listed.
        6. Note that you may also click the "Customize Page" link at top right, then click the "+Add Content" button, to add a "Bug Tracker" region/window to your My Oracle Support dashboard. 
            This new region can be dragged/dropped to any portion of the dashboard you wish. Mark bugs as favorites to populate the region and easily monitor your bugs, regardless of status or service identifier.
    Bug status: 
        10 - Description Phase: Development is requesting more information.
        11 - Code Bug (Response/Resolution).  Bug is being worked by Development. 
        15 - Enhancement Request (ER).  Behavior is the result of an unsupported feature, and the bug has been moved to the ER workflow. (See column at right) 
        16 - Support bug screening: Bug is being reviewed by our Bug Diagnostics group. 
        30 - Additional Information Requested. Development requires information from Support and/or customer.  
        31 - Could Not Reproduce. To Filer.  Development cannot reproduce bug. More information requested from Support. 
        32 - Not a Bug. To Filer.  Correct behavior, to be closed by Support. 
        36 - Duplicate Bug.  Bug is a duplicate and should be linked to parent bug in the "Base Bug Number" field. 
        37 - To Filer for Review/Merge Required: Bug has been fixed but the patch will be merged into the next patchset. 
        74 - Closed, Code fix resolution verified.  Bug is verified by QA as fixed in the release indicated in the "Fixed in Product Version" field. 
        80 - Development to QA.  Bug is being regression tested for future release. 
        84 - Closed, Not Feasible To Fix.  Bug is recognized, but closed as correct behavior or architectural/environmental limitation. 
        90 - Closed, Verified by Filer.  Bug is closed and was verified as fixed by Support engineer. 
        91 - Closed, Could Not Reproduce.  Bug is closed as not reproducible. 
        92 - Closed, Not a Bug.  Not a defect; explanation should be provided in bug report. 
        93 - Closed, Not Verified by Filer.  Bug has been fixed and is closed (indicates no internal reproduction case is available, so no verification of issue). 
        95 - Closed, Vendor OS Problem.  Bug is closed as an operating system problem and not fixable by Development. 
        96 - Closed, Duplicate Bug.  Bug is closed; defect has already been reported (link to existing bug should be included).

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Troubleshooting, Tips and Tricks
    You must open periods in order to enter invoices - check open periods in the instance before entering transactions
        Check and open accounting periods -> AP Supervisor -> Accounting -> Control Payable Periods.... and change the period to 'open'
    Enforce batch entry of invoices through the profile option AP: Use Invoice Batch Controls
    If you cannot enter an invoice, batch controls may be enabled so enter a batch first
        If batch entry is enforced, direct invoice entry will throw up a 'find' form and prevent direct entry - enter a batch first
    To do online invoice validation (in Invoice Workbench or on the Batch Summary form)
        You must have the Payables Option (invoice option) 'Allow Online Validation' set on.
        See Payables Options, Invoice, Allow Online Validation
        Note: this is not a profile option so it cannot be enabled at different levels
    Bank Accounts are hard to query - you need the Bank and Branch information first (via the Bank definition form)
        Run a Bank Listing (Bank Account Order) to obtain a list of all account and their corresponding bank names
    You cannot change distribution accounts on a PO matched invoice - see 'Adjusting Invoice Distributions' in Payables user guide
    A generic report can be installed to detect all data corruption issues in notes 1360390.1 and  1361255.1
    Accounting status can be 'Partial' on an invoice if a pre-payment is applied - since the invoice is not fully paid by the prepayment
        Partial Accounting Status indicates there are accounting events referenced by the transaction that are not accounted

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Profile Options
    Note: the option to allow online invoice validation is not a Profile Option
        See the AP Invoice Option 'Allow Online Validation'
    AP: Use AP Batch Controls - set at the site level to enable batch entry of invoices and access to the invoice workbench
        Prevents an invoice from being entered without a batch and greys out the Invoice Entry form if a batch is not already created
    AP: Use Automatic Tax Calculation - to enable Accounts Payable to calculate taxes
    AP: Enforce Tax from Purchase Order - preempts the tax calculated in AP with the Purchase Order taxes

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on General Functionality
    For multi-org, vendors are accessible globally across all organizations, but vendor sites are specific to an Operating Unit
        Because of this, default accounting is only at the Site level - there is no default accounting setup at the Supplier level
    Many processes in AP can be automated by implementing purchasing and putting the terms and conditions on the purchase order
    Payables can be installed without Purchasing or Cash Management but many of the features in Payables cannot be used
    Expense report entry and payment for employees are within the scope of Accounts Payable functions
    Attachments to invoices support scanned or other electronic documents
        This feature is most useful for recording a paper-based account coding processes
    Three methods of accounting are supported (setup on the Payables Options form):
        Cash (no liability is recorded, just the cash payment credit and the asset, clearing or expense debit),
        Accrual (the liability is accrued and subsequently cleared by the cash payment) and
        Both (two Sets of Books and both accounting methods are employed)
    Encumbrances are created when a PO is issued, and convert to an accrued payables liability on receipt of goods.
    The accrued liability coverts to a payable liability on receipt or generation of the supplier invoice.
        The liability is eliminated when payment is made
    Some companies recognize the liability on receipt of the invoice and not on receipt of the goods
        This is common if the company does not have an automated purchasing system
        The dates used to accrue and recognize a liability is a commercial decision
    Payment Terms at the Supplier level and Site level can be renegotiated and over-ridden at the purchase order level
    Back-logged invoices (received but not coded for charges or entered) should be summed prior to month-end and accrued manually
        The manual liability accrual can be a summary liability journal direct to the GL (as a reversing journal)
    Manual accruals are also common for monthly expenses not invoiced (e.g. electric bills, phone bills, rent and pCard statements)
    Prepayments can be advance payments or deposits/partial payments sent with a purchase order. They are treated as assets until the supplier invoice is received
    Prepayments are treated as early invoices
        they credit the supplier liability account (defaulted from the supplier site) and
        debit the prepayment account (again, defaulted from the supplier site or over-ridden on invoice entry).
        Actual remittance of the prepayment offsets the supplier liability and reduces cash.
            The prepayment asset remains (as a net shift from cash to prepayment assets).
            When the final invoice payment is made, both cash and the prepayment are credited off.
    Invoices for assets are identified by the 'Track as Asset' checkbox on the Invoice workbench in the distributions line or invoice lines
    The concurrent program 'Create Mass Additions' must be run to send the item to Fixed Assets.
        The debit account charged to the invoice line for an asset purchase is normally an asset clearing account
            which will be cleared to the correct debit account when the asset is created.
    Exercise: Set Aging Periods for Invoice Aging Report -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Setup/Invoice/Calendar/Aging Periods and set periods around due dates
    Exercise: Set Payables Options and Defaults -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Setup/Options/Payables
