Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Integration With Other Systems
    Fixed Assets (creating assest Mass Additions)
    Cash Management (account reconciliation)
    Property Management
        Sends lease payments as draft invoices for payment
    EDI (eCommerce) Gateway
        Sends EDI inbound invoices
        Receives EDI outbound application advises
        Receives EDI outbound remittance advises
    Fixed Assets
        Receives invoice lines for capital goods purchases (through the Mass Additions process)
    Human Resources
        Provides employee validation and approval routing on expense reports
    General Ledger
        Receives journal entries for invoice liabilities and subsequent payments
        Receives reversals of invoice accruals posted by purchasing
            The invoice relieves purchasing accrued liabilities and posts payables liabilities
        Receives MRC journal entries for reporting Sets of Books.
        Receives drillback detail from Accounts Payable (via the GL_IMPORT_REFERENCES table references)
    Inventory
        Inventory provides Intrastat item codes to record Intrastat movements when entering invoices using the 'Special' menu
    Project Accounting
        Project Accounting provides project, task and expenditure types to capture on project related invoices
        Accounts Payable provides invoice and payment information to Project Accounting (as previously accounted)
    Purchasing
        Sends Purchase Orders for 2 Way Invoice Matching
        Sends Receiving Transactions for 3 Way Invoice Matching
        Sends Inspection Transactions for 4 Way Invoice Matching to match quantity accepted (not just received)
    Oracle Web Employees
        Web Expenses receives pCard charges on receipt of the pCard invoice
        Expense reports are routed for approval once the pCard charges are accepted by the employee
    Oracle Workflow - provides seeded workflow for employee expense routings and approvals

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Accounting Event
    Journals for Payables transactions are recorded in Accounts Payable by running 'Payables Accounting Process'
        This is the consolidated process to Create Accounting, Transfer to GL and Post in GL
        Journal Categories are defined according to the accounting event raised
            Purchase Invoices (invoice accounting events in the invoice document class)
            Payments (payment accounting events excluding reconciliation events in the Payment Document Class)
            Reconciled Payments (payment reconciliation accounting events in the payment document class)
                Payment reconciliation events are raised when reconciling bank statements
    Journals are sent to the General Ledger through a concurrent process 'Transfer to GL'
        They are imported if the 'Submit Journal Import' option is chose in the 'Payables Transfer to GL' process
    Accounting Events are raised in Accounts Payable to create Journal Entries
        They are raised by different actions or processes and include:
            Invoices (when 'Create Accounting' is run)
            Invoice Adjustments
            Invoice Cancellation
            Prepayment Application (prepayment)
            Prepayment Unapplication
            Payments
            Payment Maturity
            Payment Adjustment
            Payment Cancellation
            Payment Clearing/Unclearing
    There are three tables in Accounts Payable that store accounting transactions for all accounting events
        AP_ACCOUNTING_EVENTS_ALL - one line for each event for all Sets of Books (e.g. for MRC there are multiple Sets of Books)
           linked back to the source by a SOURCE_TABLE and SOURCE_ID such as an invoice or payment)
        AP_AE_HEADERS_ALL - one line for each accounting event for each Set of Books
        AP_AE_LINES_ALL - one line for each debit and credit under an accounting event header
            linked back to a source table such as AP_INVOICES for liabilities or AP_INVOICE_DISTRIBUTIONS for charges
    Journal transactions for new invoices are created in AP using the 'Create Accounting' concurrent program
        This program creates an Accounting Event 'Invoices' for each invoice it processes
            It can be submitted directly for a single invoice from the Invoice Actions Form in Accounts Payable
            It also creates accounting for payments if the 'All' Journal Category parameter is chosen
            Accounting transactions created by this process must be 'Transfered to GL' separately.
        'Create Accounting' builds the liability account and creates accounting records for liabilities and charges
            'Create Accounting' does not build the charge for each invoice line
            The expense or asset charge account is entered with the invoice or extracted from the matching purchase order
            Journals are posted to the GL using the 'Payables Transfer to General Ledger' concurrent process.
            Reference: Accounts Payable User Guide 11.5.10.2 pp 8.24 'Payables Transfer to GL Program'
        This program also has an option to transfer MRC book entries
            If MRC entries exist, they are separate AP_AE_HEADERS_ALL lines for a single line in AP_ACCOUNTING_EVENTS_ALL
        This covers both payments and invoices (journal category = 'All' in the concurrent manager parameters)
    The 'Payables Accounting Process' is a concurrent program that processes several child processes
        Create Accounting - to create the journal entries locally in the Accounting Entries table
        Payables Transfer to General Ledger
        GL Journal Import
        Journal Posting
    AP Liability Balances are maintained on a table AP_LIABILITY_BALANCES
        At the time of invoice approval and payment confirmation a line in ap_accounting_events_all gets populated with an event_status of CREATED.
        The corresponding accounting_event_id gets populated and the posted_flag remains N in the base table of ap_invoice_distributions or ap_invoice_payments_all.
        Run the concurrent process Payables Create Accounting, the posted_flag switches to Y and the event status in ap_accounting_events_all table changes to ACCCOUNTED or ACCOUNTED WITH ERROR.  Then the ap_ae_headers_all and ap_ae_lines_all get created.
        When the data gets transferred to the GL the transfer_flag = Y and the transfer_run_id gets populated in ap_ae_headers_all.  The detail data in ap_ae_lines_all gets tranferred to the GL and the gl_sl_link_id in ap_ae_lines_all gets populated.
        A permanent table ap_liability_balance was introduced.  Each time the transfer to GL is process the Liability data from ap_ae_lines_all gets populated in ap_liability_
    Exercise: View accounting entries transfered to General Ledger -> Payables Manager/Accounting/View Accounting Lines
        This provides a view of accounting entries and allows editing of accounting lines.
        Also view the accounting entries in T-account format at the individual entry level.
    Exercise: Create accounting entries for invoices and payments -> Payables Manager/Other/Concurrent Requests
        Submit 'Payables Accounting Process'.
        Choose 'Transfer to GL' and 'Submit Journal Import' options as 'Yes' to push unposted journals into the GL

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on General Setups
    Note: Many setups in AP are lookup codes (either Purchasing or Payables) all implemented in fnd_lookup_types striped by application
    Open AP Accounting Periods to allow invoice entry
    System Administrator Setups - Security, User Names, System Printers, Responsibilities, Menu Exclusions, Check Printer
    Other Module Flexfields - Accounting (GL), Human Resources (Job, Position, Grade, People), Inventory (Item Catalog, Item Category, System Items)
    Organizations - for Operating Units
    Accounting Calendars - for open and closed periods.
        All modules in a Set of Books share the Set of Books calendar but they maintain different Open/Closed period statuses
    Workday Calendar (if using with manufacturing applications, defined in Inventory) including non-working days through exception templates
    Currencies - for any multi-currency features (through the General Ledger forms)
    Conversion Rates - for daily rates, period rates and historical rates (done through the General Ledger)
    Set of Books - at least one set of books is required.
        Responsibilities must be assigned to a Set of Books to limit the Responsibility's access to data
    Opening GL Accounting Periods to allow posting to the general ledger
    Tax Names or Codes - to define a specific tax rate and tax account.
        Tax Names must be setup for each Operating Unit
    Suppliers - for Suppliers, Supplier Sites and Supplier Contacts
    Banks, Accounts and Payment Documents
        You must set up a disbursement bank and bank account (one per currency) and documents within each account
        Tip -> Run a Bank Account Listing to see existing banks and accounts
    Paygroups
        Paygroups are a purchasing lookup code set (Navigation: Lookups -> Purchasing)

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Taxes and Tax Codes in 11i (same as Tax Names)
    Taxes on invoices from suppliers can be calculated automatically and GL distributions created
        the tax calculation is done in Accounts Payable but not in Purchasing
            i.e. there are no estimated taxes
    Taxes are defaulted in one of several ways:
        from Purchase Orders,
        defaulted from the AP Tax Hierarchy
        Entered manually as Tax Codes during invoice entry
    Tax defaulting from Purchase Orders or the Tax Hiearchy can be turned off
        Tax codes can still be entered with invoices if calculated outside Oracle
    Any tax rules and defaults setup in the Tax Hierarchy are overwritten on a manual purchase order
        This is done by the purchase order preferences setups for a user.
    Each tax code is one of four predefined or 'seeded' lookup code tax types:
        sales
        use
        offset
        withholding
    Tax Codes (ie Tax Names) have a tax rate and charge account.
        The tax rate is assigned to each Tax Code in the tax codes window.
    AP validates the Tax Name and the Tax Account distribution against the set up for the Tax Name
        This is done during invoice approval to ensure the account is correct for any Tax lines imported from external sources
    You enable automatic tax calculation by setting the profile option "Use Automatic Tax Calculation" in Accounts Payable
        If you don't do this in 11i then the Tax Engine in R12 will be set to not calculate taxes automatically
    AP will not do tax calculations if auto tax calculation is turned off
        However it will accept tax lines through invoice entry if the tax code and tax amount are entered
    Tax Codes defined in AP assign the GL charge account for taxes, the tax type and the tax rate associated with the code.
    Tax Codes can be individual rates or groups of rates defined in Tax Groups
    Tax Groups allow you to assign a group of tax codes to a single line
        Each Tax Code in the Tax Group is calculated as a distribution on the invoice
    Sales and Use Taxes
        Sales Taxes are levied by the supplier, paid to the origin tax jurisdiction and included on the supplier invoice
        Use Taxes are paid to the destination jurisdiction and must be withheld and reported by the purchaser
        Use Taxes make up for sales taxes not collected by giving a jurisdiction income on goods used
        Use tax is paid to make up for sales tax not collected
            e.g. for imported goods where the supplier in the origin state is subject to a lower tax rate
                Note that some states do not collect sales tax if the goods are used in another state
        It is the buyers responsibility to declare and pay use tax and not the seller's responsibility to collect
            This is because the seller is normally outside the taxing jurisdiction
    Tax defaults at the supplier site level include:
        tax code (as part of the tax hierarchy),
        calculation level (invoice or line or tax code),
        rounding rule etc.
    AP defaults tax codes on invoice lines based on the tax hierarchy in AP or purchasing
        Members of the tax hierarchy are:
            Financial Options
            Ship-To (destination location)
            Item
            Supplier
            Supplier Site (ie Ship-From)
    The profile option 'AP: Enforce Tax from Purchase Order' overrides the assignment of taxes in Accounts Payable
        It enforces the PO tax value instead of defaulting the tax from the hierarchy
    Taxes can be charged to the distribution on the shipment line or to the distribution recorded against the tax code
    The charge method depends on the tax calculation method used when entering invoices:
        manual - enter taxes manually
        prorate - allocate total tax down to the lines based on amounts
        auto -
        Manual requires entering an invoice tax line manually
            it uses the tax account distribution on the tax code definition to build the charge account
        Prorate requires tagging each invoice line and entering a total tax amount to spread
            it uses the charge account on each invoice line (ie adds the tax to the line amount)
            Each prorated tax amount creates a separate distribution line
        Auto requires entering the tax code/name on each line and clicking 'Calculate Tax'
            Oracle will calculate a new tax line for each distribution line with a tax code and use the ledger charge account recorded with the code
            An automatically calculated tax line references it's parent item, freight or miscellaneous charge line on the invoice
            The description field on the auto calculated tax line is not populated and a manual description must be entered
                Normally the description is the tax name concatenated with the description from the corresponding parent taxable shipment line
    Recalculation of automatic taxes is triggered by:
        calculate tax button,
        invoice validation
        when using the View and Update Tax Summary window
    Profile Option 'AP: Enforce Tax from Purchase Order' - enforces the tax code on the purchase order regardless of the tax hierarchy result
    Exercise: Enable Automatic Tax Calculation ->
        Accounts Payable Super User/Setup/Options/Payables/Invoice Tax/.....
        and enable automatic tax calculation, set the level (header or line) and override flags
    Exercise: Override Automatic Tax Calculation at Supplier Site Level ->
        Accounts Payable Super User/Suppliers/Supplier Sites/Invoice Tax/.....and modify the tax code, calculation level and rounding rule
    Exercise: Set Tax Defaults and Tax Hierarchy in Payables ->
        Accounts Payable Super User/Setup/Options/Payables/Tax Defaults and Rules
    Exercise: Set Tax Hierarchy in Purchasing ->
        Purchasing Super User/Setup/Organizations/Purchasing Options/Tax Defaults
            to establish the order for the tax hierarchy
    Exercise: Create tax codes ->
        Payables Manager/Setup/Tax/Tax Codes
    Exercise: Create tax groups of codes ->
        Payables Manager/Setup/Tax/Tax Groups
    Exercise: Turn on automatic AP tax calculation ->
        Payables Manager/...../Payables Options/Invoice Tax
    Exercise: Set payable tax hierarchy -> PAYABLES MANAGER/...../Payables Options/Tax Defaults and Rules
    Exercise: Assign tax codes to items -> PSU/Items/Master Items (or Org Items)/... and query item/Purchasing tab, flip taxable flag to 'Yes'
    Exercise: Assign tax code to financial options -> PSU/Setup/Organizations/Financial Options/Tax Tab/Default Tax Code
    Exercise: Assign tax code to locations -> PSU/Setup/Organizations/Locations/ and query a Location/Other Details/Tax Code
    Exercise: Set tax code on a requistition -> PSU/Requisitions/Requisitions/... and add a tax code to the requisition line

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Account Distributions, Adjustments and Distribution Sets
    Account distributions are created at the time of invoice entry (into Invoice Gateway or Workbench), automatically from Distribution Sets assigned to supplier sites, or by matching to purchase orders
    Accounting distributions are attached to suppliers at the supplier site level and apply to all invoices posted to the site (if a distribution is not entered on the invoice line)
    Account distrubution sets can be attached to supplier sites separately for liabilities, prepayments and future dated payments (ie liability accounts or the credit side of the invoice - not the debit side which is coded at the time of invoice entry)
    Based on the accounts in the distribution set, liability account code combinations are subsequently stamped/carried at the supplier site level in AP_INVOICES. The asset or expense account distribution is carried at the invoice line level in AP_INVOICE_DISTRIBUTIONS
    A distribution set is a set of liability accounts that can be associated with multiple supplier sites if the accounting is the same for multiple suppliers.
    A full distribution set identifies the accounts to charge and the percentage allocation of amounts for each account
    A skeleton distribution set identifies the accounts to charge but does not specify percentages - the actual values for each account are entered at the time of invoice entry
    Account aliases can be entered when setting up a distribution set to use a shortcut to enter the account value in the set.
    Exercise: Create a distributions set -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Setup/Invoices/Distribution Sets, and enter account distributions and charge percentages
    eBS Payables: How To Adjust Invoice Distributions [ID 215019.1]

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Automatic Offsets (Segment Balancing)
    Used to split up the liability line into subtotals based on the balancing segment in the charge lines
    Set in the Accounting tab of the Payables Options form in Payables
        None - no offsets are made
        Balancing - offsets are by balancing segment
        Account - offsets are by all segments except the the account

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Document Sequences for Invoices and Payments
    Document sequences can be assigned to invoices and payments as voucher numbers to provide sequential numbering of documents
    The purpose of voucher numbers is to ensure all documents are processed and any gaps in documents are identified and resolved.
    Document sequences can be manually provided through direct entry, through the interface API, fully automatic, or disabled
    Document types must be defined and then sequence rules assigned to those types to show manual or automatic assignment
    Exercise: Create document sequence for invoices: GL Superuser -> Setup -> Financials -> Sequences -> Define
    Profile Option: Sequential Numbering - has several settings that define how vouchers are assigned (see AP Users Guide)

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Supplier Setup:
    Suppliers are identified by an alphanumberic Supplier Number which is automatically assigned at setup,
        Suppliers have sites for purchasing, RFQ, and payment (where payments are remitted).
        Invoices cannot be entered for Suppliers without a paysite
    A supplier site carries accounting information specific to an operating unit's legal entity and set of books
        Suppliers are global and do not carry any accounting information (except default values)
    A Supplier Site can be one or multiple types of sites (eg Purchasing + Payment + pCard)
    Defaults for setting up suppliers are held in the Payables Options
    The Supplier Account is an inception to date history of all supplier transactions and unpaid amounts.
        Click the 'Calculate Balance Owed' button on the 'Find Invoices' button to retrieve the total owed
    Supplier information is shared with Purchasing and suppliers can be maintained in Purchasing or Payables systems equally.
        This is the PO_VENDORS and PO_VENDOR_SITES tables
        This is moved to the AP schema in R12 as AP_SUPPLIERS and AP_SUPPLIER_SITES
    Suppliers can be merged by moving sites or combining sites. Duplicate vendors can be discovered on the Supplier Audit Report
    Employees must be setup as suppliers (type 'Employee') in order to submit expense reports
    Access to setting up suppliers should be secured to a responsibility so that it is difficult for fraudulent supplier setups to occur
    Exercise: Enter a new supplier -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Suppliers/Entry, to enter a supplier and suppier site details
    Exercise: Merge suppliers -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Suppliers/Supplier Merge, to merge two dupicate suppliers, transfer invoices and purchase orders, and inactivate one of the supplier records.

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Banks and Bank Accounts
    In 11i
        All internal (disbursement) and external (direct deposit) banks and accounts are setup in AP
    In R12
        All internal banks are setup in Cash Management (roles can be granted to allow setup in Payables responsibilities)
        All external banks are setup in Supplier Setup and stored in the Payments Schema
            Create the bank at the supplier level and assign it to the site level.
            Reference: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wdu7iXrEa0Q&list=PLT1gXLhlHxY07CwOwwRxOKHpMigZjFM5T -- setup an R12 Bank Account for a Supplier

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Invoices and Approvals:
    Troubleshooting - if you cannot enter an invoice, batch controls may be enabled so enter a batch first
        With batch control turned on, direct invoice entry will only allow a 'find' action, and display a find form
    The Invoice Workbench is a series of forms that start by accessing invoice batches or invoices.
        Most forms link off the invoices form (distributions, holds, actions, payment, etc)
    The number on the Actions button on the Invoice workbench represents the number of invoices selected on the form that the actions will apply toward
    The details accessible in the invoice workbench depend on the invoice type:
        standard,
        credit memo (notice from supplier of adjustment they made),
        debit memo (notice to supplier of adjustment you are making),
        expense report,
        PO default (match to PO),
        Quickmatch (automatch to PO),
        Mixed (positive or negative amt) or
        Prepay (to make advance payments prior to receipt)
    Credit and debit memos have the same effect.
        They reduce the amount of liability to a supplier (ie reduce the invoice amount).
        The only difference is 'who' issues the memo. Suppliers issue credits and buyers issue debits
    Invoice matching can be two way, three way and four way (with PO, Receipts and Accepted Receipts/Inspections)
                Invoice matching is done at the shipment line level or the distribution line level on the purchase order, not at the PO line level.
    Invoice Gateway provides for high volume invoice entry into the Payables Open Interface Table for subsequent import and validation
    A standard invoice batch name convention should be established - eg initials and date and batch number (ie GGJ-05252003-001)
    Approvals for invoices can be made as the invoices are entered or separately through the 'Payables Approval' concurrent process. Invoices can be entered in batches, individually, in ranges or selectively
    Most invoices are intended for automatic approval without manual intervention - the approvals concurrent process can be scheduled to run frequently to approve new invoices and retest the conditions of invoices put on hold by an earlier run
    The approval process runs multiple validations: PO matching, tax, period status, exchange rates and account distributions
    Invoices cannot be entered unless the invoice period is open, via the Control Payables Periods form
    Invoices must be validated and approved before they are paid and invoices the fail validation are put on system hold
        Validation can be done online through invoice actions on the invoice workbench
            It can also be done via the AP Batch form, or through the approval concurrent process (Invoice Approval Workflow)
        To do online invoice validation, you must have the AP Option (invoice option) 'Allow Online Validation' set on
            See Payables Options, Invoice, Allow Online Validation
    Approval holds are put on invoices during validation if they fail certain tests, like line/header total balances, incorrect tax amount, unbalanced accounting distributions etc.
    Holds are put on invoices by the approval processing or by a user manually
    Accounting treatment for expense invoices is DR Expense, DR Tax Expense, CR Supplier Liability Accout (ie Payables) (unless the liability is already accrued from earlier receipt of goods)
    Accounting treatment for credit and debit memos is the reverse of invoices so it will CR Expense (or asset), CR Tax Expense, and DR Liability (ie Payables)
    Invoices can be matched to purchase orders, and the accounting for the debit entry will be taken from the matched PO lines
    Exercise: Enter invoices in non-batch mode -> PM/Invoices/Entry/Invoices
    Exercise: Enter invoices in batch mode -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Invoices/Entry/Invoice Batches, and specify a batch name to enter invoices
    Exercise: Enter invoice and default/match PO terms -> PAYABLES ENTRY/Invoices/Entry/Invoices, and set the Type to 'PO Default'.  Enter the invoice and click on 'Match' to find the PO and enter the actual matching details between the PO and invoice.

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Adjustments, Credit Notes and Debit Notes:
    An invoice can be adjusted if it has not been accounted
        This can be done even if it is paid
        If an invoice is accounted, individual lines can be reversed and reentered but not modified
    An invoice can have distributions changed after it is paid if the option is enabled
        Reference: R12.1: Invoice and Invoice Distribution Adjustment Charts - Explains what Fields can be Adjusted on an Invoice and when the System Prevents Update [ID 1300685.1]
        Set the Payables Option (Invoice tab) 'Allow Adjustments to Paid Invoices' to 'Yes'
        This does not apply to prepayment invoices that are applied to other invoices
    A credit memo is an adjustment to an invoice or an account credit from the supplier
        It can be an adjustment for damage, pricing or billing errors
        It credits the customer's AR account by reducing the receivable booked by the supplier
        A credit note can also be raised locally by a customer to correct an invoice entry error
            In this case the supplier would not have any record of the credit
    A debit memo is an adjustment to an invoice or an account credit raised by the customer
        It is sent to the supplier
        It can be for damaged goods or returned goods or an invoicing error
        It debits the customer's payable liability to reduce it
    The debit memo in Accounts Payable is different to a debit memo defined in Accounts Receivable
        A debit memo in Accounts Receivable is a charge to the customer's account for an underbilling
        A debit memo in Accounts Receivable is sent to the customer, just as a Credit Note is sent
    An AP Credit Note can be entered directly into AP or matched to an existing invoice.
        The matching process allows the distributions from the original invoice to be copied over
        Matching does not close out (pay) the invoice - both the invoice and credit note must be included in a pay run
    You can match credit/debit memos to invoices in the Invoice Workbench
        Quick Invoices window does not allow you to do that.
        You can two options available in R12 to perform the match. 
        Using Quick Credit functionality:
            1: Create a credit memo in the Invoice WorkBench. Enter a Negative amount.
            2: Navigate to the Quick Credit checkbox. Check this box.
            3: In the Next field enter the Invoice Number of the invoice you want to match this memo to.
            4: Save your work. CTRL+S
            Regardless of the actual amount on the credit memo, invoice lines and distributions will be created from the original invoice's lines and distributions.
        Using Correction Functionality:
            This is how matching was done in 11i. 
            In Release 12 an invoice match is considered a correction and is done using the Correction button.
            Do not use the Match button. That is for performing the matching with POs.
            1: Enter a Credit/Debit Memo in the Invoice Workbench. Enter a negative amount. Do not manually enter the distributions. 
            2: In the Match Action field scroll to Match Action field. Using drop down select Invoice. 
            3: Click on the Correction button.
            4: Enter search criteria for the invoice, in the Find Documents for Correction window. Click on the Find button. 
            Payables navigates to the Invoice Corrections window.
            To see more information about an invoice, you can select it and click on the Invoice Overview button.
            5: Select the invoice and enter a negative/Credit Amount.
            You can do the line level matching by clicking on Select Lines button. 
            Select each invoice line you want to match to and enter a Credit Amount.
            6: Choose the Correct button to correct the invoice.
            To review the new invoice lines, choose the lines tab from the Invoices window.

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Invoice Import Gateway (Open Interface Invoice Import)
    The open interface invoice import uses overlay account logic to build account charge distributions for invoices, starting with a distribution set tied to the supplier site level and overlaid by account, balancing segment and cost center segment values loaded in the interface table with the invoices.

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Invoice Entry And Adjustments with PO Matching:
    Three types of invoices can be PO matched through the invoice workbench: Standard, PO Default and Mixed
    If you enter PO Default at the invoice type, payables defaults the supplier, supplier number and currency from the purchase order
    The GL date is the date on the invoice accounting transaction for the liability and the charge accounts, and defaults from other dates on the transaction based on a ruleset
    Click on the Match checkbox to allow a line to be editable on the 'Match to Purchase Orders' window.
    Exercise: Match invoice to purchase order -> PAYABLES MANAGER/....../Match to Purchase Orders
    Matching to a Purchase Order places limitations on invoice adjustments
        You cannot change distributions on PO matched invoices in R12 (possible in 11i)
        You can change tax determining attributes but these will not adjust tax distributions from matched purchase order lines

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Invoice Holds and Validation
    References
        Where Is The Invoice Validation Status Stored? How Is The Invoice Validation Status Determined? [ID 301806.1]
        R12: Holds Categories: Which Holds Are Included in Them? [ID 1479566.1]
        Troubleshooting Assistant: Oracle Payables (AP) Invoice Validation (Doc ID 1616563.2).
        R12: New Functionality Invoice Validation Parallel Processing (Doc ID 1917614.1)
    Profile Options
        AP:Maximum Invoice Validation Child Requests
    Validation checks the matching, tax, accounting period status, exchange rate and distribution information.
    Holds are applied with hold reasons if exceptions are identified.
    Invoice holds can be released through the holds window in the invoice workbench without resolving the hold reason in some cases
    Invoice validation status is stored at the distribution level - not the header level
        Statuses are:
            A - Validated (previously called 'Approved')
            N - Never validated
            T - Tested but not validated
            S - Stopped

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Invoice Approval Workflow:
    References
        APINV - How Do I Setup AP to Use Invoice Approval Workflow? (Doc ID 315269.1)
    Invoice approval workflow routes invoices to designated individuals for approval based on approval rules in Oracle Approvals Manager (AME)
    Several invoice types are excluded from invoice approval workflow
        expense reports (already approved in self service),
        recurring invoices (which are approved in advance), and
        pre-existing invoices (before approvals are activated)
    The Invoice Approval Workflow can exempt certain invoices from approval based on rules
    Approvals are activated by changing the Approval Status field in the Invoices form to 'Required'
    The invoice approval workflow can be submitted  from the Submit Requests form or
        from the Invoice Actions form or through concurrent manager
    Exercise: Submit Invoice Approvals Workflow from Concurrent Manager
        -> from Concurrent Manager - select 'Invoice Approval Workflow Program'
            and choose params: Supplier, Invoice, Date To/From

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Prepayments:
    Prepayments are a type of invoice you entere to make an advance payment to a supplier
        You can have these advance payments or deposits/partial payments sent with a purchase order.
        They are treated as assets similar to cash until the supplier invoice is received
        They are later applied to the final invoice as a form of payment or partial payment
    Examples can include expense advances for employees and deposits on leases
    Prepayments are implemented as early invoices
        They credit the supplier liability account (defaulted from the supplier site)
        They debit the prepayment account (again, defaulted from the supplier site or over-ridden on invoice entry).
        Actual remittance of the prepayment offsets the supplier liability and reduces cash.
        The prepayment asset remains (as a net shift from cash to prepayment assets).
        When the final invoice payment is made the prepayment are credited off.
            The original prepayment created the expense or asset debit/charge which remains
    Prepayments are entered as new invoices (since issuing the prepayment is a separate step), with invoice type = 'Prepayment'.
        They also require a settlement date - the date after which the prepayment can be applied to the invoice
        They also require a subtype - Temporary or Permanent.
            Only temporary prepayments can be applied to invoices
            Permanent prepayments can eventually be refunded but cannot be applied to invoices (e.g. Lease Deposits)
    The GL liability account will default to the prepayment account from the supplier site.
    Prepayments are applied to the final invoice by entering the final invoice, then choosing invoice actions to apply prepayments
        Available prepayments will be displayed for a single supplier and can be applied individually
        If the prepayment invoice is not fully paid itself (i.e. it is unpaid or partially paid), it will not show as available for matching to an invoice
    Conditions that apply to prepayments include:
        They can be matched to purchase orders
        They can be put on hold
        Prepayments are paid like any other invoice but they cannot be partially paid - they must be paid in full.
    Payables notifies you in the invoice workbench when a prepayment is available to apply to a supplier invoice
    Prepayments can be applied in: Invoice Workbench, Quick Invoices, Expense Reports and Internet Expenses
    The default prepayment account is set at the supplier site, supplier and Financial Options
    Profile Options
        Build Prepay Account When Matching Payables - to automatically create a PO match for a prepayment matched to a purchase order

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Recurring Invoices:
    Recurring invoices require a special calendar before they can be defined
    Lease payments can be setup as recurring invoices
    Exercise: Setup a special calendar for a recurring invoice -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Setup/Calendar/Special Calendar, and choose recurring invoice as the type.
    Exercise: Setup a recurring invoice definition -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Invoice/Entry/Recurring Invoice, and associate a calendar and a distribution set for accounts
    Exercise: Generate a recurring invoice from its definition -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Invoice/Entry/Recurring Invoice, and query the definition, specify the number of invoices to generate and click on 'Generate..'

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Cancelling Invoices
    Reference: Accounts Payable User Guide
    You can cancel only unpaid invoices, unpaid invoices already selected for payment and invoices that are not on hold
    Unvalidated invoices can also be cancelled.
    Cancelling an invoice does the following:
        Sets the invoice amount to zero
        Sets all scheduled payments to zero
        Reverses all distributions
        Unmatches any PO matched amounts
        Submits invoice validation
        Updates the status of the invoice to 'Cancelled'

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Quick, Manual and Batch Payments:
    Manual Payments are payments made outside Oracle and recorded after the fact
        To enter a manual payment and have a valid value for Bank in the Bank LOV:
        You must have a Bank Account with a Payment Document that has either 'Recorded' or 'Combined' Payment Document Disbursement Type
        The Payment Document must also be assigned a Payment Format that has a Payment Method of 'Clearing' or 'Check'
        If all Payment Documents have a Payment Method of 'Electronic' there will be no allowable values for 'Bank' when entering a manual payment
            Navigation: Banks -> (Query Bank) -> Accounts -> Payables Documents -> Disbursement Type
    Quick Payments are entered via the Payments Workbench or they can be initiated from the Invoice Workbench
        To enter a quick payment you must know a Supplier and Site with an unpaid or partially paid invoice first
        Run an 'Invoice Aging Report' to get a list of all unpaid or partially paid invoices (set 'Include Invoice Detail = Yes')
        Run an 'Accounts Payable Trial Balance' to get a list of all unpaid or partially paid invoices posted to GL
    Navigation: Payments -> Entry -> Payments
        Type = 'Quick' (defaulted)
        A new document (check number) is reserved automatically once the Document Type is specified
        The Payment Date is defaulted to the System Date
        Payment Batches
            Navigation: Payments -> Entry -> Batches
    Payment methods are manual check, system-generated check, EFT, wire transfer, pCard (followed up by payment to the pCard vendor)
    Payment runs are scheduled to run periodically and pay all pending and approved invoices to a single supplier in a single check
    Pay Alone is an option on an invoice to ensure a separate payment is made for the invoice and other invoices are not combined into the payment
    Payments are initiated through the payment workbench in batches which select all due invoices within a specified pay group
    Manual payments are made outside the system and recorded afterwards with the appropriate accounting distributions
    Quickpays are single payments to a vendor made within the system, but not using batch payment controls.
        They can be issued from the invoice workbench directly, or from the payment workbench after selecting the invoice
    Accounting treatment of payables is DR Payables Liability Account, CR Cash or Cash Clearing Account (cash clearing is used if the extra step of reconciling cash accounts is taken, to CR cash and DR cash clearing)
    There is no tax expense entry generated by a payment transaction - tax expense is part of the original liability posting from the invoice.
    Exercise: Initiate payments in batch mode -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Payments/Entry/Payment Batches, to pay all due invoices in a paygroup
    Exercise: Make a quickpayment or record a manual payment -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Payments/Entry/Payments, and specify the payment type as Quick, or Manual. Enter the payment and reserve the check number, then click Enter/Adjust Invoices to tag the invoice being paid

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Multicurrency Payments
    You can make payments in different currencies from a bank account if it is defined as a functional currency account
        If the bank account currency is not the functional currency it can only make payments in the currency of the account
    Implementing a multi-currency payment account requires the following steps
        Set the 'Multiple Currency Payments' flag on the Payables Options of the Bank Account
            You can only set this flag if it is also set in Payables Options for the Operating Unit
        Set the Payment format as 'Multiple Currency'

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Payment Batches
    Enter a Payment Batch by Creating a Batch Name and Pay Date (defaults to System Date)
        Navigation: Payments -> Entry -> Payment Batches
        Enter criteria to limit the invoices that are paid, including Paygroup and Supplier
    Payment Batch Statuses
        New - a batch has been entered but no payments created (these batches can be deleted rather than cancelled0
        Selecting (in progress) - a process is running to build payments
        Built - invoices have been selected and proposed payments built but payment numbers have not been assigned.
        Preliminary Payment Register - can be run at any time after a batch is built to review payments
        Cancelled - you can cancel a batch before it is formatted for payment and confirmed (marked as 'Paid')
        Rebuilding - payments have been modified and 'Rebuild' selected
        Formatting (in progress) - a payment batch is having it's payments formatted and printed
        Formatted - a payment batch has been formatted and payment numbers are assigned
        Confirmed - sets the invoice payment status to 'Paid' and automatically prints a 'Final Payment Register'
            Associates the payment number with the invoice
            Updates payment history
        Accounting Created
    Batches can be modified or cancelled after they are built and before they are paid
        Cancel a batch by choosing actions, unchecking 'Format Payments' and checking 'Cancel Payment Batch'
        You can cancel a batch that has had payments formatted by unchecking 'Confirm Payments' and checking 'Cancel Payment Batch'
        You can also cancel a batch after payments have been confirmed
    Modifying a Payment Batch
        Modify a batch by choosing Actions, unchecking 'Format Payments' and checking 'Modify Payment Batch ...'
            This displays the 'Modify Payment Batch' form
            Exclude a supplier from the batch by setting the 'Pay' field to 'No'
            Force payment on an invoice by choosing 'Force'
            Change the amount paid for each invoice by setting the 'Payment Amount Maximum' to the limit amount
            Further reduce the amount paid on an invoice by increasing the 'Discount Amount' on each invoice
            Insert new invoices by creating new payment records and choosing eligible invoices
    Format a Payment Batch to Create a Payment File or Print Payments as Checks and Remittances
        Query the batch and choose Actions - and make sure 'Format Payments' is checked
    Confirm a Payment Batch (set Invoice Status to 'Paid')
        Query a payment batch which has had it's payments formatted
        Choose 'Actions' and check 'Confirm Payment Batch' and click 'OK'
            The 'Confirm Payment Batch' form will display
            Edit the document ranges (create new lines) and set the status to: Printed, Setup, Skipped or Spoiled
                A 'Setup' is to set the printer alignment - choose 'Setup' if the document is a setup check only
            If 'Skipped' or 'Spoiled' is chosen, Oracle will leave the status of the invoice as unpaid
        The status of individual payments within a confirmed payment batch is set to 'Negotiable'
    Create Accounting
        Choose a Confirmed Payment Batch, choose 'Actions' and check 'Create Accounting'

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Discounts Taken
    References
        How To Disable Capitalization Of Discounts Taken For Assets Related Payables Invoice In R12? (Doc ID 1316769.1)
        What are the Discount Distribution Method options (Doc ID 76321.1)

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Refunds
    Refunds can be applied to invoices and credit memos, and employee expense reports
    Accounting for refunds it the opposite of accounting for payments: CR the liability (which will be reduced by a lower corrected invoice) and DR cash

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on EDI:
    X12 is the US ANSI standard (810, 820, 824 and 857 txns) and EDIFACT is the United Nations standard used primarily in Europe
    All EDI transactios are extracted by the Oracle eCommerce Gateway (previously Oracle EDI Gateway) and sent to an EDI translator
    Inbound Invoice (810, INVOIC)
    Outbound Remittance Advice (820/REMADV)
    Outbound Invoice Confirmation (824, APERAK)
    Inbound Shipping Notice (857)

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Expense Reports:
    References: Expense Reports and Credit Cards - Accounts Payable Users Guide
    Expense reports can be entered directly into payables or can be populated from approved Internet (Self Service) Expense report submissions
    Expense reports can be created in several ways:
        Entry directly into Accounts Payable
        Entry into Internet Expenses
        Entry into Oracle Projects (and then transfered from Projects to Payables)
    Run the job 'Expense Report Export' after entering expense reports to create invoices in Accounts Payable
    Expense report templates can be setup and defaulted to each employee
        Templates and template lines are defined in:
            AP_EXPENSE_REPORTS_ALL for the template headers
            AP_EXPENSE_REPORT_PARAMS_ALL for the lines
        Employee defaults specify the types of expenses that can be charged, and the dollar limit for receipts required
    Advances can be applied against expense reports in the expense report entry form
        If the tolerance limit has not been established, the advances will not appear
    Exercise: Enter an expense report -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Invoices/Entry/Expense Reports, and enter expenses as accounting lines
    Exercise: Setup an expense template -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Setup/Invoice/Expense Report Templates
        Specify items, receipt required amount, and expense account distributions
    Exercise: Setup signing limits -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Setup/Employees/Signing Limits
        Specify the document (AP expense report), cost center and approval limit.
        Create additional lines for additional cost centers

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Forms:
    Invoice Actions: Invoice Entry/Find Invoices/Invoices/Actions - button on the Invoices summary screen
    Invoice Approval History: Invoice Overview/Menu:Options:Invoice Approval History
    Aging Periods: AP Superuser/Setup/Calendar/Aging Periods
    Invoice Gateway -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Invoices/Entry/Invoice Gateway - and specify a batch for the invoices to enter, then run invoice import
    Control Payables Periods -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Accounting/Control Payables Periods, to open multiple periods for payables invoice entry
    Expense Reports -> PAYABLES MANAGER/Invoices/Entry/Expense Reports
    Match to Purchase Orders -> PAYABLES MANAGER/...../Match to Purchase Orders

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Concurrent Processes
    Invoice Approval Workflow - is used to validate and approve invoices for payment
        It can also be used to reassess all invoices with approval holds for reprocessing
    Payables Accounting Process - creates accounting transactions to send to GL for subsequent import
        Runs multiple sub processes to create accounting, transfer to GL and post in GL
    Payables Transfer to GL (APPPST) - posts journals to the General Ledger for invoices and payments (including MRC entries)

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Month-End Close (Period-End Close)

    Review and Complete Current Period Transactions
        Navigation:
        Run the Invoice Validation request and correct all errors, then rerun
        Confirm or Cancel All Incomplete Batches
        Run the Create Accounting request and correct all errors, then rerun
        Run the Missing Documents report and correct all errors, then rerun
        Run the Invoices on Hold report and correct all errors, then rerun
        Run the Expense Distribution Detail Report
    Create Accounting and Transfer to General Ledger
    Run the Subledger Close Exceptions Report (new in R12) to identify any incomplete or unaccounted transactions
    Close the current Payables Period and open the next Payables Period
        Navigation: AP Superuser > Accounting > Control Payables Periods
        Change the period status to 'Closed' and Save
            No errors will display of there are no issues, otherwise ...
        A period cannot be closed if
            Accounted transactions have not been transferred to GL
            Future dated payments on or before today have status 'issued'
            There are unaccounted invoices
            There are unconfirmed payment batches
        Run the Unaccounted Transactions Sweep
            Navigation: Close the period and save, click 'Exceptions' when error dialog displays, click 'Sweep'
                Submits the 'Unposted Invoice and Payment Sweep Program'
        Run the Period Close Exceptions Report
            Navigation: Close the period and save, click 'Exceptions' when error dialog displays, click 'Review'
    Run the Payables "Transfer to General Ledger" program
        Navigation: Other > Requests > Run > Single Request
    Run Reports to Reconcile AP to the General Ledger
        Run the Posted Invoice Register
        Run the Posted Payment Register
        Run the Accounts Payable (AP) Trial Balance (current and prior period)
            In R12, this report is the 'Open Account Balances Listing' run in Subledger Accounting
                The report must first be defined with account ranges and compiled - see 'Reports' section in SLA
                    Search on Open Account
    Create Payables Accruals for Uninvoiced Receipts
    Reconcile AP Balances to General Ledger Balances
        Use the Accounts Payable Trial Balance to reconcile balances to the Ledger
            Navigation: AP Setup > Accounting Setups > Subledger Accounting Setups > Open Account Balances Listing Definitions
    Purge Old Payables Documents
        Navigation: AP Superuser > Purge

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Period Close at DMC
    References
        R12: Master Troubleshooting Guide (MTG) for Accounting Issues in Oracle Payables (Doc ID 1375017.1)
        White Paper  Subledger Accounting Setup for Oracle Payables (with examples) (Doc ID 1612433.1)
    Periodic Updates for Helper Scripts
        AP Period Close Helper
            R12: Period Close Helper - Diagnostic to Validate Data Before Period Close [ID 1489381.1]
            How to Register the Period Close Helper - Diagnostic as a Concurrent Program [ID 1489916.1]
        AP Data Validation Report and AP Single Transaction Data Validation Report
            R12: Master GDF Diagnostic to Validate Data Related to Invoices, Payments, Accounting, Suppliers and EBTax [VIDEO] [ID 1360390.1]
            How to Register the Master GDF Diagnostic as a Concurrent Program [ID 1361255.1]
        AP Trial Balance Analyzer
            R12: Payables Trial Balance Analyzer - Diagnostic to Validate Data for APTB issues (Doc ID 1553507.1)
            How to Register the Trial Balance Analyzer Diagnostic as a Concurrent Program (Doc ID 1558638.1)
    Liability Accounts
        052.2010.000.000.000.000
    Close Steps
        Run Invoice Validation
        Confirm or Cancel All Incomplete Batches
        Run Update Matured Future Dated Payments Status Program
        Run the Invoices on Hold Report
        Run Analysis Pre-checks on Transactions
        Master GDF Diagnostics (MGD's) - report Generic Data Fix (GDF) Signatures for current open period
            AP Data Validation Report (use to scan a range of transactions) Check for Updated Version
            AP Single Transaction Data Validation Report (use to drill into specific problem transactions) (Check for Updated Version)
        Period Close Helper (PCH) - Extends the Period Close Exceptions Report and Can be Run Ahead of Close (Check for Updated Version)
        Create Accounting and Transfer Journals to General Ledger
            Create Accounting as Draft and Review Report (Subledger Accounting Program Report
                Analyze and resolve issues
            Create Accounting as Final
            Transfer Journal Entries to GL Program (for previously accounted transactions)
            Run the Unaccounted Transactions Report and Resolve Issues
            Rerun Create Accounting, Transfer to Ledger
        Post Journals in General Ledger
        Run the AP Trial Balance Helper and Resolve Issues, and Rerun (Check for Updated Version)
        Close the Period
            Period Close Exception Report (PCER) - run by attempting to close the period
            Sweep Unaccounted Invoices - run by attempting to close the report
        Reconcile Balances
            Run Accounts Payable Trial Balance Report (XML Publisher enabled)
            Run Payables Posted Invoice Register (XML Publisher enabled)
            Run Payables Posted Payment Register (XML Publisher enabled)
            Reconcile AP Subledger
                Prior Month Ending Accounts Payable Trial Balance
                + Current Month Posted Invoice Register
                - Current Month Posted Payment Register
                = Current Month Ending Accounts Payable Trial Balance
            Reconcile Accounts Payable Trial Balance Report to General Ledger

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Period Close at Darling Ingredients Canada
    Perform pre-Close AP Cleanup and Integrity Checks
        Delete any invoices with no lines (never validated by Oracle)
            Query online all invoices never validated (invoices w/no lines)
                In the AP Invoice Workbench 'Find' Form
                    Set a Date Range
                    Set a Status 'Never Validated' and click 'Find'
                All invoices returned  in this query should be deleted or completed and validate
            Run the Invoice Register with the same criteria (never validated)
                Navigation: DII CAD AP Manager > Other > Requests > Run > Single Request > 'Invoice Register - DII'
                Parameters: Unvalidated Invoices Only = 'Yes'
                Layout: Invoice Register DII
            Review invoices never validated and delete if not needed
                There should be no unvalidated invoices
        Clean up invoices on Hold (for holds unrelated to PO holds)
            Run the 'Invoice on Hold Report'
                Navigation: DII CAD AP Manager > Other > Requests > Run > Single Request > 'Invoice On Hold Report'
                Parameters: Use defaulted parameters
                Layout: Invoice on Hold Report
            Review all invoices on hold for each hold reason and release holds if possible
                Holds such as Receiving Holds are valid but others need to cleared
            For non-PO hold reasons
                Query each invoice on hold and clear the hold or correct the cause of the hold
                Revalidate each invoice to clear the hold
            For PO hold reasons
                Review the reasons with the buyers and request action to clear the hold
                Note: holds due to goods not received cannot be cleared
                    These invoices can still be accounted and don't have to be cleared
        Identify other Potential Invoice Issues Prior to Starting the Close
            Run the 'Period Close Exceptions Report (XML)' under DII CAD AP Setup
                Note: This report needs to be added to the Request Group for 'DII CAD AP Manager' so Canada can run it
                Navigation: DII CAD AP Setup > Other > Requests > Run > Single Request > 'Period Close Exceptions Report (XML)'
                Parameters: Period Name = <Current Period to Close>
                Layout: Period Close Exception Report
                Review all listed exceptions and take action to address them
                    Suggested Corrective Actions are listed at the end of the report (in detail)
            Run the 'AP Period Close Helper' Report (which includes the 'AP Data Validation Report')
                Note: This report needs to be added to the Request Group for 'DII CAD AP Manager' so Canada can run it
                Navigation: DII CAD AP Setup > Other > Requests > Run > Single Request > 'AP Period Close Helper'
                Parameters: Ledger = 'CA LEDGER'
                    Period = <Current period to close>
                    Operating Unit = <Null>
                    Run AP Data Validation Report? = 'Yes' (this causes the 'AP Data Validation Report' to run at the same time
                    Max Rows per Validation = 100
                    Debug Mode = 'No'
                Layout: None
                These reports will end in a Warning if issues are found
                Review the reports and take corrective action
                    Note: many issues listed on the AP Data Validation Report' are historical data corruption problems not affecting the close
    Perform the AP Close Process
        Instruct all accounting staff with AP invoice entry responsibilities to stop entering invoices or making any invoice adjustments
            Accounting staff should not modify or adjust any invoices already entered
        Confirm with Irving Payment Processing that all Payments are completed and accounted
            Notify Irving Payment Processing that close is starting and no payments should be made, adjusted or voided
        Import Expense Reports from iExpense
            Submit the 'Expense Account Export' Program
                Navigation: DII CAD AP Manager > Other > Requests > Run > Single Request > 'Expense Report Export'
                Parameters: Use the defaulted parameters
                Layout: None
                Check the output report and confirm all new expense reports are successfully imported
                    Research and correct any failed exports and rerun the program
        Validate all Unvalidated Invoices and Re-validate Invoices on Hold
            Submit the 'Invoice Validation' Program
                Navigation: DII CAD AP Manager > Other > Requests > Run > Single Request > 'Invoice Validation'
                Parameters: Option = 'All'
                Layout: None
                Check the output report and confirm all expected hold releases were made
                Go online to AP Invoice Workbench and query all holds - analyze and correct all non-PO/Receiving holds
        Create Accounting Entries in Subledger Accounting and General Ledger for All Unaccounted Invoices and Payments
            Submit the Create Accounting Program
                Navigation: DII CAD AP Manager > Other > Requests > Run > Single Request > 'Create Accounting'
                Parameters: Ledger = 'CA LEDGER'
                    Process Category = <Null>
                    End-Date = <Current Date>
                    Mode = 'Final'
                    Errors Only = 'No' (if Errors Only = 'Yes', only prior errors will be reprocessed and not new transactions)
                    Report = 'Detail'
                    Transfer to GL = 'Yes'
                    Post in GL = 'Yes'
                    GL Batch Name = <Null>
                    Include User Transaction Identifiers = 'Yes'
                Layout: None
                Multiple processes will run to create accounting, transfer to GL and post in GL
                Review the report for the 'Create Accounting' process for errors and take the actions listed at the end of the report for any errors
            Submit the 'Transfer Journal Entries to GL' Program
                This program transfers all previously manually accounted entries from Subledger Accounting to the General Ledger
                Navigation: DII CAD AP Manager > Other > Requests > Run > Single Request > 'Create Accounting'
                Parameters: Ledger = 'CA LEDGER'
                    Process Category = <Null>
                    End-Date = <Current Date>
                    Post in General Ledger = 'Yes'
                    GL Batch Name = <Null>
                Layout: Subledger Transfer Program Report - Standard
            Confirm all Journal Entries are Posted in the General Ledger
                Navigation: DII CAD GL Inquiry > Journal > Status Posting = 'Unposted' > Find
                All unposted journals will be listed
                Any unposted journals with Source 'Payables' must be posted to update the GL balances for AP reconciliation
        Reconcile AP Subledger Balances to General Ledger Balances
            The AP Trial Balance is configured to report Trade AP liability balances and not Intercompany liability balances
                If intercompany balances need to be reconciled the AP Trial Balance definition needs to be modified
                    Raise a support ticket with IT if intercompany balances need to be added to the AP Trial Balance
            Submit the AP Trial Balance Analyzer and Review for Exceptions
                Note: This report needs to be added to the Request Group for 'DII CAD AP Manager' so Canada can run it
                Navigation: DII CAD AP Manager > Other > Requests > Run > Single Request > 'Create Accounting'
                Review the output for exceptions which need to be resolved before the 'Accounts Payable Trial Balance' is run
            Submit the AP Trial Balance for the period being close
                Navigation: DII CAD AP Manager > Other > Requests > Run > Single Request > 'Accounts Payable Trial Balance'
                Parameters: Operating Unit = <Null>
                    Report Definition = 'CAD Open Account Balances'
                    As of Date = <Today>
                    Include SLA Manuals/Other Sources = <Null>
                    Report Mode = 'Detail"
            Submit the 'Payables Posted Invoice Register'
            Submit the 'Payables Posted Payments Register'
            Reconcile AP Subledger
                Prior Month-End AP Trial Balance
                + Current Month Posted Invoice Register (Debits - Credits)
                - Current Month Posted Payments Register (Debits - Credits)
                = Current Month-End AP Trial Balance
            Reconcile the Total Period Activity on the Accounts Payable Trial Balance to the current period activity on the GL
                Use Account Balance Inquiry Online to fetch GL Period Balances
        Close the Period in AP before 05:00 am The Next Day
            Call Dallas and ask them to Close AP before 05:00 the next day
                Otherwise more expense reports will import overnight as unaccounted
                If Dallas does not close the Period, put the Expense Report Export on Hold
                    Put Invoice Validation on Hold - to avoid validating invoices waiting on receipts
            Confirm the AP Period is closed
                Enter an invoice with a date in the closed period and make sure the GL date is the next period
                Take the Expense Report Export off Hold
                Take Invoice Validation off Hold
            Notify accounting staff to restart entering invoices
                Ask each accountant to check as they enter new invoices that the GL period default to the next period
                    If it doesn't default to the next period, invoice activity should stop, pending further investigation
        Notify Irving Payment Processing that the close is complete and payments can be made or adjusted
    Perform Post-Close Accruals and Adjustments
        Accrue the Costs of Invoices Billed but Not Received
            Run a report showing accrued costs of invoices billed but not received
                This report can be run as a script by IT until a report is developed
            Create a WebADI journal upload debiting each cost account on the report and crediting the accrual account
            Upload the journal and submit it for approval
            Confirm the journal is posted

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Datafixes and Patches
    Recommended Patch Collection
        R12.1: Payables Recommended Patch Collection (AP RPC), August 2012 [ID 1397581.1]
    Generic Data Fix (GDF)
        Generic Data Fix Patch exists (See MOS NOte 974903.1 for the video)
        For Reference MOS Note 874903.1 has a list of all available GDF's
        MOS Note 1360390.1 has the master script and should be reviewed first for information then run
            This is the Master Diagnostics Script
        How to Register the Master GDF Diagnostic as a Concurrent Program [ID 1361255.1]
        GDF's are only created to cover data fixes already used by 30+ customers
        The GDF Diagnostic Master Evaluates all GDF's across all systems.
    Generic Data Fix Patches
        Each contains a select and an update
        The select runs HTML output to see what will be fixed
        All fixes do backups that can/87 be restored
        Support do not need to pre-approve running the datafix
    Generic Data Fix Master Diagnostic
        Note 1360390.1 has the master script and should be reviewed first for information
        Note 1361255.11 shows how to make a concurrent request
            Then is can be scheduled (recommended to run before each month end)
            The concurrent programs can be fnd_loaded using MOS Note 1361255.1
        Note 1361255.1 also shows how to load the program manually
        Both ways the program loads under seeded AP responsibilities
        To run as concurrent, read note 1361255.1
        To run as script
            Download the package and run one of two scripts
                One is a transaction specific script
                The other runs on a date range
            From SQL Plus, run the first script to create the package
            Then run the diagnostic package
    Generic Data FAQ's
        FAQ's are documented in Note 1327956.1

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Standard Reports:
    AP reports include several groups: supplier, income tax, invoice, invoice tax, payment, reconciliation, key indicators, notices
    Supplier reports include:
        Supplier mailing labels
        Supplier paid invoice history -
        Supplier payment history -
        Suppliers report - detailed information about supplier records and supplier site records
    Invoice and Payment reports include:
        Invoice Aging Report - lists all unpaid invoices regardless of whether they are posted to the General Ledger or not
            requires aging periods to be setup
        Accounts Payable Trial Balance
            lists unpaid and partially paid invoices posted to the General Ledger
            Navigation: AP Setup > Accounting Setups > Subledger Accounting Setups > Open Account Balances Listing Definitions
        Cash Requirement Report - shows invoice amounts and due dates
            Can be used to show unpaid validated invoices overlooked on previous payment runs are unable to pay due to bank setup errors
        Payment Schedule Report - shows when payments are scheduled to be made,including old unpaid schedules
    Reconciliations include:
        AP trial balance - details behind GL accounts for payables charges
        AP account analysis - invoice charges by account range to reconcile selected accounts to the GL
        AP posted invoices register - invoice lines posted the GL
        AP payments register - payment lines posted to the GL
        Unaccounted Transactions - invoices without accounting
    Key Indicators include:
        Current Activity Indicators - current period and prior period invoice volumes and values
        Current Activity with Invoice Detail Indicators
            current period and prior period invoice volumes and values by AP processor
        Key Indicators - state of the system - static view of AP size: suppliers, invoices, payments, and holds
    Notices are standard reports that include:
        Invalid PO Supplier Notice
            notification to the supplier that an invoice is missing a valid required purchase order number
                aka 'invalid PO hold'
        Matching Hold Agent Notice
             informs purchasing agents of matching holds due to PO exceptions
        Prepayment Remittance Notice
            informs suppliers of prepayments applied to invoices
        Print Invoice Notice
            notifies suppliers of invoices that have been recorded
        Receiving Hold Requestor Notice
            informs a requestor of an invoice hold due to missing receipts
        Supplier Open Balance Letter
            audit letter confirming payables due to suppliers

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Interfaces:
    The Payables Open Interface is used to import invoices and expense reports into Oracle AP
    Run 'Payables Open Interface Import' to import
    Run 'Payables Open Interface Purge Program
    The interface process loads invoices through open interface tables
        AP_INVOICES_INTERFACE - invoice headers
        AP_INVOICE_LINES_INTERFACE - invoice lines
    SQL-Loader can be used to load flat files of invoices and invoice lines into the interface tables
    Invoice Import can be used to import invoices from non-Oracle systems, large suppliers or during data conversion.
    The Payables Open Interface is also used to import invoices from other Oracle systems:
        lease payment obligations from Property Manager,
        iSupplier invoices from the iSupplier Portal,
        credit card transactions,
        Fixed Assets lease payments, etc
    The tables loaded in the interface are the AP_INVOICES_INTERFACE and AP_INVOICE_LINES_INTERFACE
        Rejections are stored in AP_INTERFACE_REJECTIONS
    Once entered through the Invoice Open Interface, the invoices can be viewed in the Invoice Workbench within Oracle AP
    Invoice Gateway can also be used to enter invoices into the interface tables
        The Invoice Gateway form is a faster way to enter invoices than using the Invoice Workbench
        There are fewer edits and validations performed on invoices when entered through the gateway


Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on 1099 Processing
    References
        Information Center: Oracle Payables 1099 Tax Reporting (Doc ID 1381863.2)
        Oracle Payables 1099 Processing Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) (Doc ID 110390.1)
        Information Center: Oracle Payables 1099 Tax Reporting (Doc ID 1381863.1)
        White Paper - Oracle Payables 1099's Explained (Doc ID 1383640.1)
        R12.0.6+ : Oracle Payables 1099 Setup Test Note:829636.1
        R12.0.6 - R12.1.x : Oracle Payables 1099 Missing Invoice Activity Test Note:829644.1
        APXTRF99 - 1099 Forms Common Alignment Issues (Doc ID 1065336.6)
        Troubleshooting Guide for 1099 Form Alignment (Doc ID 215375.1)
        Oracle Payables Plans for 2013 1099 Reporting (Doc ID 209913.1)
    1099 Deadlines and Filing Rules
        To Supplier 31-Jan each year
            If Box 8 or 14 are filled in, this deadline is 15-Feb each year
        To IRS 28-Feb each year (02-Apr if filing electronically)
        The threshhold for filing a 1099 is $600 or more in payments in a calendar year
    Supported Forms and Formats
        Only the 1099-MISC report format is supported (and corresponding electronic file)
        The 1099-S and 1099-INT reports are not supported
        See Metalink Note 110391.1 "Payable Processing 1099 FAQ's" for a list of 1099-INT types supported
    Reports
        1099 Payments Report
            Query Driver is either PAY or INV (Payment or Invoice)
            It determines if the selection is based on the Payment distribution balancing segment or Invoice Distribution Balancing Segment
            Records are selected which match the balancing segments defined for the reporting entity
                Navigation: AP Setup > Tax > Reporting Entities
    Setups
        Enable Suppliers
            Navigation: Suppliers > Find > Tax Details > Income Tax (Region)
            Reportable Flag - include supplier in reporting
            Income Tax Type - the code that will default onto invoice distributions
        Tax Reporting Entities (and Associated Balancing Segments)
            Navigation: AP Setup > Tax > Reporting Entities

Accounts Payable (AP Schema) Notes on Key Tables:
    AP_ACCOUNTING_EVENTS - includes one line for each accounting event (e.g. invoice, invoice adjustment, payment, payment adjustment etc)
    AP_AE_LINES_ALL - lists accounting entries created by AP and sent to GL
        SOURCE_ID - is the source transaction reference
        SOURCE_TABLE - is the source table where the transaction reference can be found (e.g. AP_INVOICES, AP_INVOICE_DISTRIBUTIONS_ALL etc)
    AP_AE_HEADERS_ALL - lists accounting entry header info for AP_AE_LINES_ALL - groups lines based on accounting event and SOB
        where one accounting event may impact multiple sets of books for MRC there will be multiple headers in this table for one accounting event
    AP_AGING_PERIODS -- aging periods for the Invoice Aging Report
    AP_AGING_PERIOD_LINES -- aging period lines for the Invoice Aging Report
    AP_BATCHES - invoice batch headers
    AP_EXPENSE_REPORT_HEADERS - expense report headers entered in AP Expense reports or Internet (Self Service) expenses
    AP_CHECKS - remittances such as checks, EFT's or wires. One row per payment document is recorded (at the supplier level)
    AP_EXPENSE_REPORT_LINES - lines in AP Expense reports or Internet (self service) expenses
        There can be multiple invoices distributions paid on a check - the link is via AP_INVOICE_PAYMENTS
    AP_HOLDS_ALL - lists holds on an invoice
    AP_HOLD_CODES - lists hold reasons
    AP_INVOICES_ALL - invoices carrying the standard invoice or debit/credit memo or other invoice type
        PAYMENT_STATUS_FLAG indicates if payment is made ('Y' Yes, 'N' No, 'P' Partial)
    AP_INVOICE_LINES_ALL - new in R12
    AP_INVOICE_DISTRIBUTIONS_ALL - invoice lines carrying the ID of the account code combination
    AP_INVOICE_PAYMENTS_ALL - distribution of remittances across invoice lines
        There is one payment record for each payment made on a single check for a single distribution
    AP_LIABILITY_BALANCES - the current AP liabilities posted to GL (at invoice level)
    AP_PAYMENT_SCHEDULES_ALL - is one row per scheduled invoice payment unless there is a schedule of payments, requiring multiple rows
        PAYMENT_STATUS_FLAG indicates if payment is made ('Y' Yes, 'N' No, 'P' Partial)
        HOLD_FLAG indicates if the payment is on hold
        AMOUNT_REMAINING indicates the unpaid amount on the invoice
    AP_PAYMENT_HISTORY_ALL - includes payments and future dated payments
    AP_CHECKS_ALL
    AP_BANK_ACCOUNTS_ALL -- 11i only holding all internal and external bank accounts
    AP_BANK_BRANCHES -- 11i only holds internal and external banks and branches
        Both banks and branches are maintained in this single table in 11i
    AP_CARDS_ALL
    AP_TAX_CODES_ALL - has the tax codes and tax group codes for suppliers (groups have TAX_TYPE = 'TAX_GROUP'
    AP_TRIAL_BALANCE - denormalized data about invoices and payments posted to accrual ledgers
    AP_SUPPLIERS (suppliers are in the AP schema in R12 now - replaces PO_VENDORS from 11i - mapped to HZ_PARTIES via POS_SUPPLIER_MAPPINGS)
    AP_SUPPLIER_SITES (Supplier Sites are in the AP schema in R12 now)
    AP_SYSTEM_PARAMETES_ALL - defaults and parameters for payables maintained via the Payables Options form
    GL_IMPORT_REFERENCES or GL_JOURNAL_LINES carries a reference back to AP_AE_LINES_ALL (for Drillback from GL)
    IBY_EXTERNAL_PAYEES_ALL - payment related Supplier attributes such as default payment method and email address for remittances
    PO_VENDORS - all suppliers (owned by purchasing) - replaced by a view in R12 with the same name
    PO_VENDOR_SITES - all supplier sites (owned by purchasing)
    HZ_PARTIES - R12 table for Suppliers as parties - note that supplier related attributes are stored in AP_AUPPLIERS in R12 and not HZ_PARTIES
    HZ_PARTY_USG_ASSIGNMENTS - identifies a party as a 'SUPPLIER' in the PARTY_USAGE_CODE field
    HZ_ORGANIZATION_PROFILES - has attributes for the supplier party such as credit scores
    ZX_PARTY_TAX_PROFILE - links a Party to their tax profile (e.g. tax codes) - replaces AP_TAX_CODES_ALL from 11i
