Accounts Receivable (RA and AR) Notes on Troubleshooting, Tips and Tricks
    You can search for customers using wildcards in customer setup by adding a leading space (e.g. ' %LTD%' will return all customers with 'LTD' in the name)
    You must run the 'Replicate Seeded Data' process before setting up AR
        This will create the seeded transaction types and activities you need to allow forms to open
    To create a customer from a supplier record
        Profile Option 'AR: Show Parties Without Accounts In DQM' Allows Supplier Parties to be Queried in Customer Maintenance to create Customer Accounts
        Profile Option 'HZ: Enable DQM Party Search' enables advanced search
    Open Invoices means AR invoices with a balance
        On AR_PAYMENT_SCHEDULES_ALL there is a STATUS column indicating OP or CL

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR) Notes on Best Practices
    Additional References
        http://docs.oracle.com/cd/A60725_05/html/comnls/us/ar/pttrxt02.htm
    Void Transaction Type
        Create a 'Void' transaction type to void a debit memo, credit memo, on-account credit or invoice
        If the transaction has no activity, change its transaction type to void
        Define the void transaction type with Open Receivables and Post to GL as 'No'

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Profile Options
    Additional References
        http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E18727_01/doc.121/e13510/T447343T355483.htm
        https://docs.oracle.com/cd/A60725_05/html/comnls/us/ar/profop01.htm
    Profile Options
        AR: Allow Overapplication in Lockbox -- allow receipts to overapply to invoices in lockbox
        AR: Cash  Allow Actions -- hides or shows the Chargeback and Adjustments buttons on the Applications page in Receipts workbench. As part of the cash application process, the applier has the option to create adjustments (write-offs) and chargebacks if you set this option to Yes. I recommend that you do that, you can always control the amounts they write-off using approval limits.
        AR: Create Bank Charges -- enables bank charge entry on receipts and makes the Bank Charge account required on Receipt methods
        AR: Default Exchange Rate Type (Default is 'Corporate')
        AR: Show Parties Without Accounts In DQM -- to select suppliers in Customer Maintenance
        AR: Always Default Transaction Balance for Applications - defaults the application amount to the full transaction amount in receipt application
        HZ: Enable DQM Party Search enables advanced search
        AR: Allow Transaction Batching - If you enter small volumes of manual transactions, it is not necessary to use batches for transactions. If you enter high volumes, you should use batching for transactions. You should always use batching for receipts since you get immediate feedback of what you have done and any potential problems.
        AR: Cash - Default Amount Applied - Always set so the default is the amount remaining on the receipt, not the amount remaining on the invoice. If you allow the receipt amount to default to the invoice balance, this allows you to apply more than you really have.
        AR: Change Customer Name - In reality customers change their names and this is a valuable feature but, I recommend that you set it "Yes" only after to have been live for a few weeks. This is a good way to keep novice users from overlaying good names with invalid names, until the know what they are doing.
        AR: Close Period - Run Collections Effectiveness - I recommend that you set this option to "No." Most users do not use this report and it will just slow the close process.
        AR: Update Due Date - Allow change to due date. In rare instances it is desirable to change the due date on an invoice (for example, you have negotiated this with the customer). By setting this profile option to "Yes," you have the option of doing this. What this really does is to allow you to make your aging look better. Consider whether or not this is desirable in you business situation.
        AR: Query Criteria check - disable the warning when blind querying in AR (None, Warning, Error)
        AR: Use Invoice Accounting For Credit Memo - In most cases, if you know the original invoice, it is desirable to offset the accounts that were used for the invoice when creating the related Credit Memo. This option allows you to do that.

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on System Options
    AR: Allow Payment of Unrelated Invoices -- set to Yes to allow payments to be applied to other customers transactions

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR) Notes on Procedures
    Delete an Invoice
        Delete the invoice in the Transactions window by choosing Delete Record from the Edit menu.
            This will delete the invoice and any lines.
        Void the invoice by changing the invoice's type in the Transaction window to a type with Open Receivables and Post to GL options set to No.
            This will delete the payment schedule and cancel distributions by removing the GL date.
        Reverse the distributions by creating a Credit Memo against the invoice.
        Delete the payment schedule by setting the Complete flag to No in the Transaction window.
            This will make the invoice inaccessible for payment or crediting.
    Credit an Invoice
        Enter a Credit Directly and Reference a Transaction for the Credit
            Navigation: Credit Transactions > Transactions > Credit Transactions
        Enter a Credit against by finding an Existing Transaction to Credit first
            Navigation: Receivables Manager > Transactions > Transaction Summary > Query a Transaction > Click 'Credit'
    Create an On-Account Credit
        Navigation: AR Manager > Transactions > Transactions
        Choose a transaction class of Credit Memo
        Enter the bill-to customer but not the ship-to
    Apply an On-Account Credit to an Invoice
        Navigation: AR Manager > Transactions > Transaction
        Query the existing on-account credit
        Select Actions > Applications and select the transaction to apply
    Apply a Receipt with an On-Account Credit
    Unapply Cash and Credit a Transaction
        References
            http://docs.oracle.com/cd/A60725_05/html/comnls/us/ar/credit07.htm

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR) Notes on General Functionality
    AutoLockBox processing automatically imports customer payments from bank files
    AutoCash is the set of rules to automatically apply cash to invoices or account balances
    Activities are different types of cash receipt transactions with specific accounting
    AutoAccounting generates code combinations for ledger entries
        Account code generation in AR is driven by AutoAccounting rules
    Account Generator generates code combinations but only for finance charges and currency conversion gains/losses
    AR provides functionality for Billing, Managing Open AR Balances, Cash Receipts and Collections
    AR provides three workbenches to support most activity:
        Transactions Workbench - invoice, debit, credit, on account, chargeback and adjustments
        Receipts Workbench - receipt related tasks (including adjustments)
        Collections Workbench - customer calls, dunning letters

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR) Notes on Transaction Entry and Changes (Transaction Workbench)
    Transaction Workbench
        BPA Icon to print invoices - see Bill Presentment Architecture
    The currency on transaction entry defaults from the batch currency
        If no batch currency is specified then currency defaults from the funtional currency for the associated set of books
    You cannot change an invoices (incomplete it) once it is posted to GL or has activity applied (receipts, adjustments, credits, deposits)
        Reference: Transaction Workbench: FAQ (Doc ID 220026.1)
        http://docs.oracle.com/cd/A60725_05/html/comnls/us/ar/maintn.htm#n_maint -- changes allowed to invoices
        http://oracleappsuserguide.blogspot.com/2009/02/maintaining-invoice-and-credit-memo.html#uds-search-results
    Customer Types on Transactions
        Sold-to - the customer on a quotation (quotations only require a Sold-to, not a Bill-to or Ship-to)
            Becomes the ship-to if a quotation is converted into an order
            A mandatory grouping element in auto-invoice for grouping orders onto invoices
            Sold-to appears on quotations but only ship-to and bill-to appears on standard invoices
            Also the customer on an order entered directly (ship-to or bill-to)
        Bill-to - the customer who's account is debited with the transaction
            Defaults from the Sold-to on orders unless there is a primary bill-to related customer and relationships are enabled
            Bill-to appears on the invoice
        Ship-to - the shipping address for the goods and services
            Defaults from the sold-to on orders if the sold-to is a ship-to customer
            Ship-to appears on the invoice
        Paying - defaults to bill-to customer, and used to identify the bank account for direct debit
            Can be changed after an invoice is complete
            Paying customer does not appear on the invoice

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR) Notes on Credits and Crediting a Transaction
    Types
        Credit Memos credit specific transactions
            Accounting on a credit memo copies the accounting from the transaction
        On-account Credits (do not credit a specific transaction)
            Accounting on on-account credits use auto-accounting rules and memo-line accounts
            On-account credits can be applied to an invoice in the Receipt Applications window
    Entering an On-Account Credit
        On-account credits are credits you assign to your customer's account that are not related to a specific invoice
        Additional references
            http://docs.oracle.com/cd/A60725_05/html/comnls/us/ar/credit11.htm
            Enter a transaction of class 'Credit Memo'
    Crediting a Transaction
        Navigation: Receivables Manager > Transactions > Transaction Summary > Query a Transaction > Click 'Credit'
            Update the defaults on the Credit Memo region
            Click the Credit Allocation dropdown and choose an option (e.g. Lines and Tax)
            Click 'Credit Balance' to credit the balance on the transaction
            Save ... and a Credit Memo number is assigned
            Click 'Complete' to validate the newly entered credit memo
            The balance due on the transaction is reduced to zero
    Credit Memo Approval Workflow
        Additional References
            Setting Up the AME Credit Memo Request Workflow, Oracle Receivables User Guide

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Copying Transactions
    Navigation: Receivables Manager > Transactions > Copy Transactions
    Query a transaction using F11, Ctrl-F11 then fill out the remainder
        Specify the new transaction numbers and save to generate them

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Commitments (Deposits and Guarantees)
    Additional References
        http://docs.oracle.com/cd/A60725_05/html/comnls/us/ar/transa15.htm#index-Deposit-enter-commitments--0
        http://docs.oracle.com/cd/A60725_05/html/comnls/us/ar/commits.htm#n_usecom -- using commitments
    Deposits are prepayments for goods and services provided in the future
        Deposits create an invoice which the customer pays (as a prepayment)
        Each future invoice for goods and services references the deposit invoice
        The accounting clears the receivable of the future invoice (CR) and relieves the unearned revenue of the initial deposit (DR)
    Guarantees are contractual agreements to conduct business in the future
    Use the Transactions Workbench to enter deposits and guarantees
    Commitments do not include tax or freight charges
    Related Reports
        Commitment Balances Report -- shows prepayments and value of invoices applied to them
    Configuring Deposits
        Create a Deposit Transaction Type
            Transaction Header Region
                Set Class = Deposit
                    Receivables sets Open Receivable and Post to GL to Yes, 
                    Allow Freight, Default Tax Classification, and Allow Overapplication to No
                    Creation Sign to 'Positive Sign,' and Natural Application Only to Yes. 
                    You cannot change these options
            Deposits Tab Region
                Allocation Basis
                    You can select Lines Only to apply deposits to invoice lines only. 
                    Or, you can select Lines, Tax and Freight to include tax and freight amounts on invoices when applying deposits to transactions.
                Offset Account
                    If you set the 'AR: Deposit Offset Account Source' profile option to Transaction Type, 
                    then Receivables uses the Offset Account to derive the offset account for deposits. 
                    Otherwise, Receivables uses AutoAccounting to derive the deposit's offset account.
            Profile Options
                'AR: Deposit Offset Account Source' (see Offset Account above)
                Otherwise leave blank and enter the offset account manually with the deposit (as the revenue account)
     Entering Deposits
         Enter deposits in Transaction Workbench using the previously defined Deposit transaction type
     Entering Transactions Against Deposit
         Enter the Deposit Number in the Commitment field in the Main Tab Region
     Confirm the Automatic Adjustment
         Navigation: Actions > Adjust -- so see the automatically generated adjustment
     Deposit Accounting
         Enter Deposit: DR Deposit Receivables, CR Deposit Offset Account
         Enter Invoice: DR Trade Receivables, CR Revenue
         Generate Automatic Adjustment (when invoice is completed): DR Deposit Offset Account, CR Trade Receivables

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Receipts and Remittances
    References
        Troubleshooting Assistant: Receivables Receipts Workbench (Search Helper) (Doc ID 1476669.2)
        Information Center: Overview of the Receipts Workbench in Oracle Receivables (AR) 11.5 and later (Doc ID 1362278.2)
        How To Prevent Duplicate Receipt Numbers Using Form Personalization (Doc ID 1543302.1)
    Receipts can be created in different ways
        Quickcash
        Receipts Workbench
        Automatic Receipts (which generate remittances to debit customer accounts)
        AutoLockbox
        Receipts API's
    Remittances
        Remittances are instructions to a bank to transfer funds
            They are also the act of depositing checks (which is also 'sending' instructions to the bank)
        A Remittance Account on the ledger is debited (credit the Receipt Confirmation Account) to show what has gone to the bank
            The Remittance Account is relieved when the account is reconciled to confirm the cash was posted (credit Remittance Account and Debit Cash)
    Standard Accounting
        Record Receipt in Oracle: DR Confirmation Account (e.g. AR Trade Credit Clearing), CR Receivables (Invoice is marked as closed in Oracle at this point)
        Remit Receipt to the Bank: DR Remittance Account, CR Confirmation Account
        Clear Account Statement or Individual Payment: DR Cash in Bank, CR Remittance Account
    Automatic Receipts
        References
            Automatic Receipts and Remittance: A Complete Guide for R12 Oracle Receivables Users (Doc ID 745996.1)
            Automatic Receipts are generated on transactions with an assigned Receipt Method that has an Automatic Creation Method on it's Receipt Class

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Cash Application
    Cash Application Methods (Batch Types_
        Manual-Regular
            Does not provide automatic matching
        Manual-Quick
            Application Types
                AutoCash Rule - lockbox and manual matching traditional method
                    Assigned to customers (account profile region), System Options (miscellaneous), profile classes
                Automatic Matching Rule - new feature for lockbox and manual matching
                    Assigned to customers (account profile region), System Options (miscellaneous), profile classes
                Single
                Multiple
                On-Account
                Unapplied
                Unidentified
        Automatic
            Generate remittances to customer accouts
    To Unapply a Receipt
        Query the receipt, click applications and uncheck the apply box, and save

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Receipt Write-offs
    References
        How Do You Refund An Overpayment Of A Receipt (Doc ID 169676.1)
    Write off small underpayments on receipts in cash application with 'Apply To' as 'Receipt Writeoff'
        Specify the Activity on the line to derive the accounting
    Write off small overpayments on receipts in cash application with an adjustment to the invoice

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Line Level Cash Application
    Backround
        Line level cash application is introduced in R12 with the button 'Apply in Detail' on the Applications Form in Receipts Workbench
        Mandatory steps are required to use this functionality only if using the new functionality 'Line Level Cash Applications Supported through Lockbox' see Document:782734.1
    References
        Oracle Receivables User Guide Release 12 Part No. B31211-01 pp 4-18
        You Tube - IT Convergence Line Level Cash Application
        http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLT1gXLhlHxY07CwOwwRxOKHpMigZjFM5T
        Line Level Application Gives You Cannot Apply More Than The Original Line (Doc ID 1269966.1)
        Transaction Workbench You cannot apply more than the original line,tax,frieght and charge amounts during Line level Cash Application (Doc ID 967593.1)
        Receipts Workbench: FAQ For Line Level Cash Applications Release 12 (Doc ID 393113.1)
    Navigation
        Accounts Receivable Manager > Receipts > Receipts > (Enter Receipt> Apply > Apply in Detail > Transaction/All Lines or Select All Lines

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on QuickCash
    Enter Quickcash by entering receipt batches with type 'Manual-Quick'
        Navigation: Receivables Manager > Receipt > Batches > set Batch Type 'Manual-Quick' > Receipts
    Enter the cash receipts and invoices to apply on one line entries in the QuickCash window
    Run the 'Post Quickcash' process from a button on the receipts form
        The 'Post Quickcash' process moves transactions from a temp table to the main A/R tables

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Application Rule Sets
    Application Rule Sets determine how receipts are applied to the component charges within each ar invoice
        Components can include: Line items, Freight, Charges and Overapplication (and the taxes applicable to each of these line types)
    Application Rule Sets do not determine which invoices are settled, only the order of settlement within each transaction
    Seeded Application Rule Sets are assigned to Transaction Types and to System Options (Misc) as a default for the Operating Unit
        Line First--Prorate All
        Line First--Tax After
        Prorate All

    References
        How To Define An Autocash Rule Set (Doc ID 205233.1)
    Autocash Rule Sets determine how cash is applied through AutoLockbox import or manually through QuickCash
        Both Locbox and Quickcash use the 'Post QuickCash' process which invokes AutoCash application processing
    'Automatic Matching Rules' are a new feature in R12 than can be used for both manual and lockbox receipts

    AutoCash and Balance Forward Billing
        Use the AutoCash Rule - Clear Past Due Invoices Grouped by Payment Term

    Steps

        Define a cross-currency balancing/balancing account (aka clearing account) in GL
        Assign the clearing account in AR System Options

    AutoLockBox automatically imports payment records from bank lockboxes
    The setup of AutoLockBox is justified for more than 2000-3000 customers
        Otherwise manual or QuickCash processing is more efficient
    Navigation
        Setup
            Receivables Manager > Setup > Receipts > Lockboxes -- define lockbox
            Transmission Formats  Set Up->Receipts->Lockbox Transmission -- define transmission record layouts for a lockbox definition
        Run and Edit/Correct
            Receivables Manager > Interfaces > Lockbox -- submit lockbox import
            Receivables Manager > Receipts > Lockbox > Transmission History -- view summary transmission record history
            Receivables Manager > Receipts > Lockbox > Maintain Transmission Data -- update transmission data in error
            Receivables Manager > Receipts > Lockbox > Alternate Names Match
    Setups
        define the bank, branch and bank account
        Define Receipt Class for Auto Lockbox
        Define Receipt Source
        Define Autocash Ruleset
        Define Customer - Attach the receipt method and create the customer bank account (Branch number and account number together decides the MICR number)
        Define Lockbox (Setup --> Receipts --> Lockboxes --> Lockboxes)
        Define Transmission Formats (Setup --> Receipts --> Lockboxes --> Transmission Formats)
        Modify (or create a new one) the existing control file to suit the above formats
    AutoLockbox Process Steps
        1. Import (run AutoLockbox) - loads lockbox file into AR_PAYMENTS_INTERFACE_ALL - Payments Interface
            Lockbox Execution Report generated
        2. Validation (submit Validation) - validates imported receipts and loads into quickcash tables - Interim Cash Receipts
            AR_INTERIM_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL
            AR_INTERIM_CASH_RCPT_LINES_ALL
            Correct error data and revalidate - repeat multiple times
                Error Form uses AR_PAYMENTS_INTERFACE_V (join of ar_payments_interface i, ar_transmissions t, ar_trans_record_formats f, hz_cust_accounts c, hz_parties party)
            Creates a QuickCash batch
            Query and change data in the Quickcash window
        3. Post Quickcash (submit PostQuickcash) - creates real receipts, updates customer balances and loads into AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL (receipts and applications)
            Submit Post Batch (PostBatch) concurrent program
               Generates Post QuickCash Execution Report
               Changes batch type from Manual-Quick to Manual-Regular
               Also updates 
               AR_CASH_RECEIPT_HISTORY_ALL
               AR_DISTRIBUTIONS_ALL
               AR_RECEIVABLE_APPLICATIONS_ALL
               AR_PAYMENT_SCHEDULES_ALL
               HZ_PARTIES AND IBY_EXT_BANK_ACCOUNTS -- to add MICR numbers as customer branches and accounts
        References
            ARLPLB & ARCABP Listing of Source Code Called During Lockbox Validation and Post QuickCash (Doc ID 1371557.1)
                ARLPLB - imports and validates lockbox receipts
                    Invokes AutoAssociate
                ARCABP - invokes quickcash matching from interim to receipts tables
                    Invokes Quickcash/Autocash Matching Rule
            Troubleshooting Lockbox: Known Issues and Patches (Doc ID 1366298.1)
        Overall Steps
            Preprocess Lockbox File
            Concurrent Request: AR Darling Lockbox Process (DII)
                Replaces disabled ARLPLB 'Process Lockboxes' - Import step
                Imports records to AR.AR_PAYMENTS_INTERFACE_ALL
                Generates report 'Lockbox Execution Report'
            Validation (using ARLPLB 'Process Lockboxes' - Submit Validation Option)
                Generates 'Lockbox Execution Report'
                Imports data to Quickcash tables AR_INTERIM_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL and AR_INTERIM_CASH_RCPT_LINES_ALL
                Leaves only invalid records in AR_PAYMENTS_INTERFACE_ALL for reprocessing until cleared
            Post Quick Cash (uing ARCABP) - Post Quickcash Option
                Generates 'Post Quick Cash Exection Report'
                Imports receipt lines into Receipts tables
                    AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL
                    AR_CASH_RECEIPT_HISTORY_ALL
                    AR_RECEIVABLE_APPLICATIONS_ALL with the status = 'UNAPP', 'UNID', 'APP'
                    AR_TRANSMISSIONS_ALL
            Post QuickCash (using ARCABP 'Cash Application Batch Posting')
        Lockbox Submission
            One or two or all three steps are submitted from the 'Submit Lockbox Processing' Window
            Navigation: Receivables Manager > Import > Lockbox
            The Operating Unit Organization assigned to receipts is set in this form
                This means each data file is org specific and cannot cover multiple operating units
        Run Import
            Program ARLPLB 'Process Lockboxes'
            Loads Filesystem file into AR_PAYMENTS_INTERFACE_ALL -- the lockbox interface table
                CUSTOMER_REFERENCE1 is the Customer Reference field is used for claims processsing only
                There is no purge program for this table but records can be deleted manually via the Maintain Transmission Date form
                    Receivables Manager > Receipts > Lockbox > Maintain Transmission Data
        Run Lockbox Validation
            Program ARLPLB 'Process Lockboxes'
            Loads QuickCash Tables from AR_PAYMENTS_INTERFACE_ALL table
                AR_INTERIM_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL - interim lockbox import for receipts created by validation process
                AR_INTERIM_CASH_RCPT_LINES_ALL - interim lockbox import for receipt lines created by validation process
            Updates history in AR.AR_TRANSMISSIONS_ALL with lockbox history
                There is no purge program to clear this table - it must be done manually
            View individual receipts that failed validation in the Lockbox Transmission Data window
                This data remains in the AR_PAYMENTS_INTERFACE_ALL table
                Navigation: Receipts > Lockbox > Maintain Transmission Data
            View summary lockbox import history in the Lockbox Transmission History Window
                Navigation: Receipts > Lockbox > Transmission History
                Statuses are:
                    New: This transmission has been imported into Receivables but has not yet been validated.
                    Out of Balance: One or more of the receipts in this transmission was rejected during validation.
                    Open: All of the receipts in this transmission have been successfully validated and transferred into Receivables. Post QuickCash has not yet processed these receipts. 
                    Closed: All of the receipts in this transmission have been successfully processed by Post QuickCash. You can review these receipts in the Receipts window.
        Run Post QuickCash
            Program ARCABP 'Cash Application Batch Posting'
            View and edit and update (or delete) validated lockbox receipts in the Quickcash window (optional)
                Navigation: Receivables Manager > Receipts > Batches > Set Batch Type = 'Manual - QuickCash' > Find
                    Will only find batches not posted (search on 'Manual-Regular' for imported batches)
            Creates receipt records in AR and removes records from the QuickCash tables
            Runs matching logic and AutoCash rules to apply receipts automatically to transactions
                Receipt matching logic during validation (before AutoCash) uses customer number and transaction number if provided
                    If the Customer Number is null, the MICR number is used if it is valid
                    Lockbox matches MICR using this code
                        SELECT bank_branch_id
                        FROM ap_bank_branches
                        WHERE ((bank_num = <Transit Routing Number> AND bank_number is null)
                        OR ( bank_name = <Transit Routing Number>
                        and bank_branch_name = <Transit Routing Number>));
                        bank_num = Transit Routing Number
                        bank_name = Transit Routing Number
                        bank_branch_name = Transit Routing Number
                    The association from a MICR to a customer number is stored in AP_BANK_ACCOUNT_USES
                    Uses customer billing location associations
                        Invokes Arlvbl.lpc. Validates billing location. First verifies that all specified billing locations are attached to the identified customers. 
                        If the lockbox requires a billing location and you do not pass a valid one, there must exist an active primary bill to site for the customer.
                    If no customer or transaction is provided during validation, auto-association rules is set to 'Yes' in Lockbox definition (Transactions tab)
                    Matching rules used by Auto-Association are taken from the customer site, customer or lockbox definition
                    'Match Receipts By' in the Lockbox Definition identifies what is passed in the file
                    Matching can be on transaction number, PO number, Billing Number or other rule entries
                If no match is made during validation, AutoCash rules are used to identify a match
                    Autocash matching uses the AutoCash rule set defined in the Profile Class for the Customer
                        One rule 'Match Payment with Invoice' is most often used
                        All rules are:
                            Match Payment with Invoice 
                            Clear the Account 
                            Clear Past Due Invoices 
                            Clear Past Due Invoices Grouped by Payment Term 
                            Apply to the Oldest Invoice First
                    If none is defined on the customer profile, uses the AutoCash rule set defined in AR System Options
                If there is no match, the receipt is created as 'Unidentified'
            Generates a 'Post QuickCash Execution Report'
            Debug file available with profile option setting "AR: Debug Level for Lockbox and Postbatch" = 10
                Detailed debug available by setting "AR: Debug Level for Lockbox and PostBatch" = 3
            Tranfers from Interim QuickCash Tables to AR tables:
                AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL
                AR_RECEIVABLES_APPLICATIONS_ALL
                AR_CASH_RECEIPT_HISTORY_ALL
                AR_DISTRIBUTIONS_ALL
                AR_PAYMENT_SCHEDULES_ALL
        Lockbox Field Reference
            References
                 https://docs.oracle.com/cd/A60725_05/html/comnls/us/ar/lokbox10.htm
            Bank Origination Number: The bank origination number of the bank that transmitted this lockbox file. Receivables determines the Bank Origination number from the remittance bank account you entered in the Lockboxes window. This field is in the Lockbox Control window.
            Control File: (Submit Lockbox Processing window) Receivables uses SQL *Loader to load information from your operating system files into the Receivables database.
                The control file is placed in the $AR_TOP/bin directory of the database server
                The control file is used by SQL *Loader to map the data in the bank file to tables and columns in the Oracle database. 
                You need to create a control file for each bank file that uses a different transmission format. 
                For SQL *Loader to load your bank file properly, each logical record that your bank sends to you must end with a carriage return. 
                If each record does not end with a carriage return, SQL *Loader displays an error message when you submit AutoLockbox.
                Suggestion: If you are using Receivables Multiple Organizations Support feature, we recommend that you create a different control file for each of your organizations. 
                Each control file should populate the default org_id column for that organization in the ar_payments_interface table. 
                Additionally, if your existing control files use the date format 'YY' for the year, we recommend that you change this to 'RR'. 
            Data File: The path name and the filename of the bank file you are transferring into Receivables. This is the file that contains payment data you receive from the bank. Receivables lets you store the file in any directory. This field is in the Submit Lockbox Processing window.
            Destination Account: (Lockbox Control window) The bank account into which this receipt was deposited.
            Item Number: (Lockbox Transmission Data window) The item number associated with this receipt. If you have multiple receipts in a batch, you might include this in your transmission format to order receipts in a batch.
            Lockbox Batch Count: (Lockbox Control window) The total number of bank batches associated with this lockbox.
            Lockbox Receipt Count: (Lockbox Control window) The total number of receipts associated with this lockbox. This count does not include overflow receipts, headers, or trailers.
            Overflow Sequence: (Lockbox Transmission Data window) A type of bank file record that stores additional receipt information that could not fit on the receipt record. Each Overflow record must have a receipt record as a parent. Typically, an Overflow record will store additional invoice numbers and the amount of the receipt to apply to each invoice. If there are multiple overflow records for a receipt record, each overflow record will have an overflow sequence.
            Record Count: (Lockbox Control window) The total number of records in this lockbox transmission.
            Record Identifier: (Lockbox Transmission Data window) A record identifier consists of at most two characters which Receivables uses to identify each record type. For example, Receivables can identify a receipt record in BAI bank files because this record always starts with the character '6'. You define valid record identifiers in the Transmission Formats window.
            Transmission Format: (Submit Lockbox Processing window) A transmission format defines what data your bank is sending in the bank file, and how that data is organized so Receivables can successfully import this data. You must work with your bank to determine the content of your transmission format. Your transmission format must match each bank control file that you create, so the number of control files that you use must correspond to the number of transmission formats that you define. Receivables provides two sample formats: 'CONVERT, (arconv.ctl)' and 'DEFAULT, (ardeft.ctl)'. You can modify these transmission formats or create new ones. 
        Lockbox Tables
            ar_payments_interface_all
            ar_transmissions_all
            iby_fndcpt_payer_assgn_ba_v -- lookup table for MICR association to customer (MICR = TRN + Bank Account)
            AR_INTERIM_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL - interim lockbox import for receipts created by validation process
            AR_INTERIM_CASH_RCPT_LINES_ALL - interim lockbox import for receipt lines created by validation process
            AR_PAYMENTS_INTERFACE - receipt import table for lockbox receipts
    Lockbox Payments from a Payment Service
        References: C:\Users\gjarman\Documents\Computing\Oracle\Applications\Financials\Accounts Receivable\Lockbox\Cakebread AR Lockbox.mht
            If you have multiple customers whose invoices may be paid by a central location, but you have no separate customer set up as the "parent," you may want to set up a "dummy" customer as the parent. Assign the children to the parent using the Customers: Relationships Alternate Region and create the customer MICR record for the parent (using the Customers: Bank Accounts Alternate Region). Then the "parent" can pay the "children's" invoices within Lockbox and the other cash application forms


Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Refund Processing
    Background
        Refund processing for Receivables (e.g. return of deposit) is new in R12 (in 11i it required setting up a vendor and processing an invoice)
        Refunds can be applied to receipts (send the money back to the customer) or applied to on-account credit notes
    References
        How To Invoke Refund Attributes Customer List Of Values To Display Multiple Related Customers (Doc ID 1500037.1)
        http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AnoPvO5-DxI&list=PLT1gXLhlHxY07CwOwwRxOKHpMigZjFM5T
        http://oraapps-raghuraman.blogspot.com/2009/05/how-to-make-manual-refund-to-customers.html
        Oracle Payables User's Guide Release 12 Part No. B25454-01 pp 3-159
        Non Credit Card Customer Refund Processing Using Payments Funds Disbursement Flow (Non Credit Card Receipt refund via Payments FD) (Doc ID 1536059.1)
        Non-Credit Card Automated Refunds to Customers from AR to AP: Setup and Process (Doc ID 565407.1)
            Includes the manual procedure includes applying a refund to an on-account credit memo
        Automated Receipt handling For Credits: Overview and Setup (Doc ID 283125.1)
    Overview
        A refund is entered on the receipt application screen along with other applications or in transaction workbench for a credit note (via Actions > Applications)
            A refund is its own activity type in activity setup
        A customer must be setup with a payment method on their account or saving a refund will throw an error
        Refunds create payments in AP which clear on the ledger through AP/AR clearing
            A refund credits AR Clearing as a liability
                The other side is the debit to cash for the payment received (part of the receipt is being refunded) or ...
                The other side is a debit to the receivables account for a credit note refunded
            The payables liability (mock invoice) debits AR Clearing and crebits AP Liability
            This leaves cash in the bank and an AP liability for future payment of the mock invoice
    Setup
        Create a Receivables Activity under Setup > Receipts > Activities for type 'Refund' before creating a refund in Receipts
        For automated sources (via AutoInvoice), update the Source definition 'Receipt Handling for Credits' to 'Refund'

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Consolidated Billing, Balance Forward Billing and Statement Billing
    Overview
        Balance Forward Billing (BFB) in R12 replaces Consolidated Billing in 11i
        Balance Forward Bills (BFB) include all transactions for a customer in a billing cycle plus the balance from the prior cycle
            The BFB includes all transactions, the opening balance, adjustments, posted receipts, debit and credit memos for the cycle
            In R12, bill consolidation can be at the Site level or Account Level (for a single operating unit)
                Account-level balance forward billing lets you generate one bill for each operating unit of the account, addressed to the primary bill-to site of the account. 
                Site-level balance forward billing lets you generate a balance forward bill for each bill-to site of a customer with multiple bill-to sites.
        Bills can be summarized or detail format
            Summary layout shows one line per invoice from the underlying invoice transaction
            Detail format shows one line per invoice line from the underlying invoice transaction
        Automatic receipts can be generated for BFB or manual receipts applied at the consolidated BFB level
    References
        How To Setup Consolidated Billing (Doc ID 247946.1)
        Consolidated Billing Invoices (R11i) versus Balance Forward Billing (R12) - Similarities and Differences(Doc ID 872872.1)
        Balance Forward Billing Setup and Usage Guide for Oracle Receivables Users(Doc ID 761180.1) -- key document on summary vs detail level billing (see different invoice pictures)
        FAQ : Balance Forward Billing (BFB) Common Issues and Concerns (Doc ID 1080423.1)
        http://www.oracleappshub.com/release12/r12/balance-forward-billing-in-r12

    Enhancement Requests
        Bug 8495185 : BALANCE FORWARD BILL IS GENERATED EVEN IF CORRESPONDING INVOICE IS NOT ENTERED 
    Troubleshooting
        If no invoices are selected for billing
            Run a query to see if any draft bills need to be cancelled (new ones won't generate if there are)
                select * from ar_cons_inv_all;
            Check the billing terms on the customer and invoice (terms on the customer prevail if the invoice terms were changed)
            Check the billing date on the invoice and backdate if necessary
            Ensure the invoice header flexfield billing attribute is set to 'C'
            Check the invoices are completed
    R12 vs 11i Differences: Consolidated Billing Invoices (CBI in 11i) vs. Balance Forward Billing (BFB in R12)
        11i has Consolidated Billing Invoices (CBI)
        R12 has Balance Forward Billing or BFB  (which replaces consolidated billing)
            Proxima payment terms in 11i converted to Billing Cycles and Payment Terms in R12
                There is no entity 'Billing Cycle' in 11i
                The functionality in 11i is contained in the Proxima payment terms
                The Proxima data elements (e.g. Cutoff Date) in Proxima Payment Terms migrated to Billing Cycles in R12
        Bills in R12 can consolidate at Account or Site Level, but only Site Level in 11i
        Late Charges in R12 support Balance Forward Billing
        Invoices can be excluded from BFB cycles with 'DO NOT PRINT' option chosen, but all CBI invoices are selected if the customer site is CBI
        The View Document icon shows the BFB document, but shows the single invoice for CBI
        The Billing Date is dynamically calculated on BFB invoices but does not exist on CBI's
        Concurrent Processes
            BFB: Is controlled by 3 processes:
                Generate Balance Forward Bills (draft/final) - creates a draft bill for review (can be rolled back)
                Confirm Balance Forward Bills (accept/reject) - confirms the draft bill as final or rolls it back
                BPA Balance Forward Print Program - prints the confirmed bill
            CBI in 11i: Is/was controlled by 5 processes:
                Print Draft
                Accept
                Reject
                Print New
                Reprint 
        Statement Formatting is BPA in R12 and Hard Coded in 11i
    Statements
        Consolidated Billing and Balance Forward Billing Groups invoices based on common due dates and terms
        Statement Billing groups invoices for the month for a single customer
    Consolidated Billing Identifcation/Balance Forward Billing Numbers
        The BFB/CBI numbers precede transaction numbers on transaction enty and display
        The number is based on the billing sequence AR.AR_CONS_INV_S
            Use 'select ar.AR_CONS_INV_S.nextval from dual;'
        See the Sequence Definition in Application Developer > Application > Database > Sequences
        The Balance Forward Billing Number (bill number) appears on
            Forms
                Receipts
                Transactions
                Credit Transactions
                Transaction Overview
                Applications
                Search and Apply
            Reports
                Account Status ...  
                Aged Trial Balance (Aged Trial Balance - 7 Buckets - By LOB is disabled)
                Billing and Receipt History ...
                Disputed Invoice Report ...
                Past Due Invoice ...
                Sales Journal by GL Account (Sales Journal by GL Account Report (XML))
                Transaction Detail
        References
            Where does Consolidate Billing number come from? (Doc ID 257839.1)
            Balance Forward Billing Number Sequence is Skipping (Doc ID (1546839.1)
            Transactions Form Issue: The 'Number' field Displays 2 fields even if System Options "Show Billing Number" is Unchecked (Doc ID 429000.1)
    Balance Forward Billing Cycles
        Navigation: AR Setup Responsibility > Setup >Print > Balance Forward Billing Cycles
        Determine the date when a bill is generated based on a recurring schedule
        Determines which transactions are included in each bill (based on the cycle period and billing cutoff date)
        Generates lines in AR_CONS_BILL_CYCLE_DATES with one row for each billing cycle period
    External vs Recurring Billing Cycles
        Only recurring billing cycles can be setup in Balance Forward Billing Cycles
        External is a seeded value indicating invoices will be imported into AutoInvoice with a value in RA_INTERFACE_LINES_ALL.CONS_BILLING_NUMBER
            This means the consolidated billing number was derived externally before the invoices are imported
            The billing number must not yet exist where on the AR_CONS_INV_ALL table where CONS_INV_TYPE = 'MINV'
        External cycles are imported through AutoInvoice with the Consolidated Bill already prepared
        External is a seeded billing cycle name that can be chosen in Payment Terms to reference either a recurring cycle or 'external'
            Reference: Balance Forward Billing Setup and Usage Guide for Oracle Receivables Users (Doc ID 761180.1)
    Setup Steps for Balance Forward Billing in R12
        Setup a Balance Forward Billing Cycle
            Navigation: AR Setup Responsibility > Setup > Print > Balance Forward Billing Cycles
            Choose the cut-off dates - the day(s) on which the bill will be generated (can be one or multiple days within the cycle period)
            Choose the billing frequency (can be one or mulitple periods)
            Choose a Start Date that is not 10 years prior or a current date (e.g. back date one year), see MOS Note: 1052961.1
        Setup Payment Terms that Reference the Billing Cycle
            Navigation: AR Setup Responsibility > Setup > Transactions > Payment Terms
            Associate the Balance Forward Billing Cycle with the Payment Term
            Specify a Payment Schedule one month ahead so a monthly bill prints in the following month
            Specify the day in period the payment is due (some time after the Billing Date in the Billing Cycle definition)
                You can choose the Due Days, or the Due Day of Month an Months Ahead
        Enable the Customer Account for Balance Forward Billing
            Navigation: Customers > Customers > Query > Account Details > Account Profile > Balance Forward Billing
            Enable Balance Forward Billing and set the Level (Account or Site) and Type (Detail or Summary)
            Set the Payment Terms (only Balance Forward Billing Payment Terms are listed)
            Set the Payment Terms at the Site Level if the Balance Forward Billing Level on the Account is 'Site'
                Navigation: Customers > Customers > Query > Account Details > Site Details > Profile > Balance Forward Billing
                    Note: The Bill-to must be chosen on the Site Business Purpose tab before choosing 'Profile'
                        This confirms you are setting balance forward billing terms on the bill-to site
                        Balance forward billing should only be enabled on the bill-to purpose sites
        Enable the Profile Class for Balance Forward Billing and Update Assigned Customers
            Navigation: AR Responsibility > Customers > Profile Classes > Balance Forward Billing
            Enable Balance Forward Billing, Set Bill Level, Type and Payment Terms
        Enable Receipt Matching in Lockbox by Balance Forward Billing Number (Optional)
            Navigation: Receivables Manager > Setup > Receipts > Lockboxs > Lockboxes > Receipts Tab
        Run the 'Generate Stylesheet for BPA Templates' Program to Generate Bill Presentment Architecture Stylesheets
            Responsibility: Bill Presentment Superuser
        Run Concurrent Programs for Balance Forward Billing
            Generate Balance Forward Bills
            Confirm Balance Forward Bill
            BPA Balance Forward Bill Print Program
    Key Tables for Consolidated Billing
        AR_CONS_BILL_CYCLES_B - billing cycles
        AR_CONS_BILL_CYCLES_TL - translations for billing cycles
        AR_CONS_BILL_CYCLE_DATES - billing dates (up to 10 years forward)
        AR_CONS_INV_TRX_LINES_ALL      
        AR_CONS_INV_TRX_ALL            
        AR_CONS_INV_ALL -- has both draft and final consolidated invoices
    Key Sequences
        AR.AR_CONS_INV_S -- sequence for billing number

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Functional Security

Accounts Receivable (RA and Ar Schema) Notes on General Ledger Interface
    You send accounting entries to GL using the General Ledger Tranfer Program (in 11i)
    In R12, run Submit Accounting or Create Accounting to generate GL entries
        Submit Accounting is a wrapper for Create Accounting which also runs Revenue Recognition
        Submit Accounting is an AR Application Process
        Create Accounting is an SLA Application Process which must be added to AR request groups

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Accounting Entries
    Enter a receipt as Unidentified Cash:
        DR Cash
        CR Unapplied Cash
    Post unapplied cash to an invoice
        DR Unapplied Cash
        CR Receivables
        CR Unidentified
    Apply an entered receipt to an account:
        DR Unapplied
        CR On-Account
    When your receipt includes a discount, Receivables creates the following journal entry:
        DR Cash
        CR Receivables
        DR Earned/Unearned Discount (expense)
        CR Receivables
    Receivables uses the default Cash, Unapplied, Unidentified, On-Account, Unearned,
        and Earned accounts that you specified in the Remittance Banks window for this receipt
        class.
    When you enter a receipt and combine it with an on-account credit (which increases the
        balance of the receipt), Receivables creates the following journal entry:
        DR Cash
        CR Unapplied Cash
    To close the receivable on the credit memo and increase the unapplied cash balance,
        Receivables creates the following journal entry:
        DR Receivables
        CR Unapplied Cash
    When you enter a receipt and combine it with a negative adjustment, Receivables
        creates the following journal entries:
        DR Cash
        CR Receivables (Invoice)
        DR Write-Off
        CR Receivables (Invoice)
    You set up a Write-Off account when defining your Receivables Activity.
        When you enter a receipt and combine it with a positive adjustment, Receivables creates
        the following journal entries:
        DR Cash
        CR Receivables (Invoice)
        DR Receivables (Invoice)
        CR Write-Off
    When you write off the unapplied amount on a receipt, Receivables creates the
        following journal entries:
      DR Unapplied Cash
      CR Write-off
    Receipt combined with a Chargeback
      DR Cash
      CR Receivables (Invoice)
      DR Receivables (Chargeback)
      CR Chargeback (Activity)
    You set up a Chargeback account when defining your Receivables Activity.
        To move funds between receipts, you can apply one receipt to another open receipt
        (also called netting receipts). For example, you can move funds from Receipt 1 to
        Receipt 2 by opening Receipt 2 in the Applications window, and selecting Receipt 1 in
        the Apply To field.
        See: Receipt-to-Receipt Applications, page 4-11.
    Following the example above, Receivables creates these journal entries:
        DR Unapplied Cash (Receipt 1)
        CR Netting (Receipt 1)
        DR Netting (Receipt 2)
        CR Unapplied Cash (Receipt 2)
    After this receipt-to-receipt application completes, Receipt 2 gains additional funds that
        you can then apply to a debit item.
        You set up a Netting account when defining your Receivables Activity.
        Important: When netting receipts, both receipts must be in the same
        currency.

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Month-End (Period-End) Processing (Period Close)
    References
        R12: Period-End Procedures for Oracle Financials E-Business Suite (Doc ID 961285.1)
        EBS R12 Period Close Advisor: Receivables (Doc ID 1359460.1)
        Period Close Advisor: E-Business Suite (EBS) (Doc ID 335.1)
        Oracle Receivables (AR) Receivables Month End Information Center (Doc ID 1370198.1)
        R12 Period Close Procedure for Oracle Receivables [Document 1269489.1] 
        How to Close AR Period When there are Incomplete Transactions (Doc ID 1233033.1)
        R12: How to Use the Subledger Period Close Exceptions Report for Period Close Activity? (Doc ID 793598.1)
        http://www.oracleappshub.com/release12/r12/r12-ar-month-end-close-and-reconciliation/ -- close steps in bullet format
        http://it.toolbox.com/wiki/index.php/Period-End_Processing_in_Oracle_Receivables_(Release_11i)
        AR to GL Reconciliation Report
    AR Period Statuses
        Closed
            New activity is blocked
            All items are posted (when status is set to 'Closed')
            Closed periods can be reopened
        Close Pending
            New activity is blocked
            Unposted items are allowed (when status is set to 'Close Pending'
        Future
            Transactions are enterable
            Journal posting is blocked
        Not Opened
            Never Opened and no activity created
        Open
            Transactions and posting activity allowed
    Steps
        Complete Lockbox Imports
        Complete Manual Invoices, Credit Memos and Corrections
        Run AutoInvoice to Import all Invoices
            Correct and reimport AutoInovice Rejects
        Approve all Adjustments (via the Approve Adjustments form: Receivables Manager > Control > Adjustments > Approve Adjustments)
        Delete Incomplete Transactions
        Apply All Unapplied Receipts
        Reconcile Receipts to Bank Statements
        Run Create Accounting to Transfer Journals to SLA and GL
        Run the Subledger Close Exceptions Report (new in R12) to identify any incomplete or unaccounted transactions
        Close the System to Users
            Close Pending - does not search for unposted items
        Run the Journal Entries Report
            Review for mis-posted accounts
        Run the Receipts Journal Report and Receipts Register
            Compare totals to match for the same period
        Run the Period-End Reports > Accounting
                Aged Trial Balance - 7 Buckets - By Account (pulls from SLA in R12, but AR_PAYMENT_SCHEDULES_ALL in 11i)
                Transaction Register
                Unapplied Receipts Register
                Applied Receipts Register
                Adjustments Register
                Invoice Exceptions Report
        Run Period End Reports
            Control > Accounting > Open/Close Periods
        Balance the Aged Trial Balance (internal reconcilation)
            Starting Balance (from Prior Aged Trial Balance)
            + Invoices + Debit Memos - Credit Memos +/- Chargebacks (from Transaction Register)
            - Applied Receipts - Discounts Taken (from Applied Receipts Register)
            - Unapplied Receipts (from Unapplied Receipts Register)
            +/- Adjustments
            + Invoices Not Aged (from Invoice Exceptions Report)
            = Ending Balance (should equal Current Aged Trial Balance)
        Transfer Transactions to GL
            Run the General Ledger Transfer Program ('Submit Accounting') which includes:
                Revenue Recognition
                Create Accounting
                Tranfer to GL
        Close the Current Period in AR
            Verify there are no unposted transactions
            Control > Accounting > Open/Close Periods
        Open the Next Period in AR
        Notify Users Next Period is Open
        Post Journal Entries in GL
            Run Account Analysis Report for Each Reconciling Account
            Determine subtotals by Source and Category
            Compare to the corresponding totals in AR
        Balance Key Accounts to GL

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Country Specific Requirements
    Value Added Tax is a country specific requirement in European countries

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on General Setups
    Primary Setups in AR include:
        Transaction Types: define controls and restrictions on transactions and their default accounting
            Override accounting is defined in AutoAccounting setups
                Autoaccounting can use Transaction Type as an input factor
            see separate notes in this document on Transaction Types
        Profile Classes: define defaults for customer setup and controls on customer activity
            see separate notes in this document on Profile Classes
    Setup Order in AR includes:
        Account Generator (required) - for account segment on finance charges and currency gains/losses
        Transaction Flexfield Structure (required) - on AutoInvoice lines
        Territory Flexfield Structure (required)
        Sales Tax Location Flexfield Structure (required)
        AutoCash Rules (optional)
        Receivables Lookups (optional)
        AutoInvoice Line Ordering Rules (optional)
        AutoInvoice Line Grouping Rules (optional)
        Application Rule Sets (optional)
        System Options - must be done to get customer setup forms working (or Operating Unit will not appear in customer forms)
        Flexible Address Formats (optional)
        Countries and Territories (optional) - assigns flexibile address styles to countries
        Payment Terms (required)
        Accounting Rules (optional)
        Accounting Periods in AR (required)
        AutoAccounting (required)
        Cash Basis Accounting (optional)
        Transaction Types (required)
        Collectors (required)
        Adjustment Approval Limits (required)
        Remittance Banks (required)
        Distribution Sets (optional)
        Receivables Activities (required)
        Receipt Classes (required)
        Payment Methods (required)
        Receipt Sources (required) - provide default values for receipt class, payment method and remittance bank account when creating a receipt batch
        Aging Buckets (optional)
        Statement Cycles (optional)
        Dunning Letters (optional)
        Dunning Letter Sets (optional)
        Territories (optional)
        Salespersons (required)
        Profile Options (required)
        Customer Profile Classes (required)
        Customers (required)
        Remit-to Addresses (required)
        Customer Relationships (optional)
        Lockboxes (optional)
        Transmission Format (optional)
        Receipt Programs (optional)
        Standard Memo Lines (optional)
        Cross Currency Receipts (optional)
        Tax (required)
        Tax Vendor Extension Document Sequences (optional)

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Countries and Territories
    References
        ...
    Countries and Territories assigned address style to each country for customer, bank, check and remit-to addresses
        Navigation: Receivables Manager > Setup > System > Countries
    Address Styles are defined as flexfields
        Navigation: Setup > Financials > Flexfields > Descriptive > Segments > Application = 'Receivables' and Title = 'Address'
        The seeded address style is POSTAL_ADDR_US with a validation set on the State segment only (Validation Set HZ_US_STATES)
            The validation set is a table based set against HZ_GEOGRAPHIES for geography type 'State'
        This flexfield and its related validation set are independent of the address flexfield for HR_LOCATIONS_ALL which validates Legal Entities and Internal Locations    
    Territories are defined in AR and are separate from Countries and Territories
        Define territories for invoices, salespeople, commitments and business purposes (can be entered on an invoice)
        Territories are used for recording and customized reporting on territory information on sales transactions and commitments
            Territory Flexfields are also displayed in the Transaction Detail and Customer Detail reports in Receivables
            They cannot be used in AutoAccounting to derive revenue accounts First define the Key Flexfield Second create values 
            The profile option "FND: View Object Max Fetch Size" controls how many territories display in an LOV R12
                Newly Defined Territory Does Not Appear In Territory LOV Of Customer Account Site Details Page (Doc ID 740791.1) 
            Territory defaults onto invoices and commitments based on the source of territory defined in AR System Options (Miscellaneous Tab) 
                Choices are: Bill-to, Ship-to, SalesRep and <Null> Assign one or more territories the the Salespersons in Salesperson setup 

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Remit-To Setup 
    References
        References http://madhappan.blogspot.com/2012/04/troubleshooting-remit-to-address-in.html 
        http://www.oracleerpappsguide.com/2012/01/troubleshooting-remit-to-address-in.html 
        How to Setup a Remit-To Address in Release 12 Oracle Receivables (Doc ID 1101666.1) 
        TCA Data Model: What is the link between RA_REMIT_TOS_ALL.ADDRESS_ID and the HZ tables (Doc ID 1082144.1) 
        Troubleshooting Remit To Address in Oracle Receivables (Doc ID 1101855.1) 
        http://alloracleapps.com/oracle_apps/apps_functional/apps-functional-modules/ar/remit-to-address/
    Overview
        Remit-to addresses let the customers know where to send payment for their invoices.
        Remit-To Addresses are defaulted using the Country and Zipcode in the Remit-to Address setup
            The country and zipcode is matched with the customer bill-to address on the transaction
    Enhancement Requests
        This does not support remit-to's specifically attached to each customer
        References
            AutoInvoice Issue: Need the Ability to Enter a Remit to Address for Different Business Unit in the Same Operating Unit and Location (Doc ID 1595272.1)
            Bug 17655263 : NEED ABILITY TO HAVE DIFF REMIT TO ADDRESSES FOR DIFF BU IN SAME OU & LOCATION
     Remit-to Setup
        System Options
            Setup > System > System Options
                Print Remit-To Address box controls remit-to address appearing on statements and dunning letters
        Profile Options
            AR: Customers Enter Alternate Fields is 'Yes' allows entering an alternate name in the remit-to address setup
        Setup Address
            Navigation: Receivables Manager > Setup > Print > Remit-To Address
        Flexfields in Update Remit-to Page are 'Addresss Information' flexfields in Receivables
    Remit-to on AR Invoices
        See Transaction Workbench > More Tab > Remit-to Block
    Tables and Views
        AR_REMIT_TO_ADDRESSES_V (uses FND_TERRITORIES_VL HZ_CUST_ACCT_SITES HZ_PARTY_SITES HZ_LOCATIONS)
        RA_REMIT_TOS_ALL

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR) Notes on Customer Setup
    References
        Information Center: Troubleshooting Customers Workbench in Oracle Receivables 11.5.10 and later (Doc ID 1478539.2)
        Oracle Receivables: Overview of the Customer Form in Release 12 (Doc ID 1436547.1)
        SRDC - EBS Receivables: Customer Standard Form (Doc ID 1677714.1) -- diagnostic scripts for SR support
        Customer Form, Address Issue: Unable To Create An Account Site Using An Existing Address (Doc ID 1103003.1)
    Tips
        You can create customers in Order Managment directly when entering an order
        A customer is a party which has accounts - a customer is not an account
            References
                R12 AR User Guide - Customers
        System options must be fully configured or the Operating Unit LOV will be empty in customer setup as site level
        Most customer information is under the Addresses of the customer - go there first
        Customers, Accounts and Addresses are shared across operating units but a site at an address is OU specific
        You can reuse an address when you create a new account but you cannot create multiple sites for the same address within a single account
            Reference
                Customer Form, Address Issue: Unable To Create An Account Site Using An Existing Address (Doc ID 1103003.1)
        Profile option HZ: Enable DQM Party Search enables advanced party search in customer setup
        Profile Option 'AR: Show Parties Without Accounts In DQM' Allows Supplier Parties to be Queried in Customer Maintenance to create Customer Accounts
    A Customer is a high level customer with an associated customer number
        An account is a separate entity below customer (party) to divide up customers for different commercial arrangements
            One account can be for industrial sales and another can be for consulting services
            Customer relationships (billing, contacts, aging) are managed at the account level
        A customer can have multiple accounts
        The same account can be used across multiple operating units (as can the addresses but not the sites at those addresses)
    The 'Location' on each business purpose at the site level is a shorthand word for the customer location (or account)
        Each business purpose has a different location name option
        You can enter these locations in transactions as a short hand reference to the customer address
        e.g. A ship-to location on an invoice has one shorthand word, a bill-to may have the same or another
        They tie back to the address of the site under which they are registered
    The Bill-to Location assigned to a Ship-to Location on a customer account site is restricted to a valid bill-to of the current customer or a related customer account
        References
            Customer Form, Business Purposes Error: APP-AR-96282: Error: The site use referenced by this bill_to_site_use_id must be active bill-to, belong to an active customer account site, and assigned to... (Doc ID 879564.1)
            https://docs.oracle.com/cd/A60725_05/html/comnls/us/ar/addres02.htm
                Valid Bill To locations include all Bill-To sites for this customer, and all Bill To sites of related parent customers
            Oracle AR 11i User Guide (not in R12 but valid)
                If you assigned a Ship To business purpose to this address, enter a Bill To Location. Valid Bill To locations include all BillTo sites for this customer, and all BillTo sites of related parent customers.
    Profile Classes should be decided before setting up Customers - see separate notes
    In Multi-Org customers are shared across all organizations but customer details are OPU specific
        OPU specific details include: addresses, business purposes, contacts and phones.
        Transactions with customers are also OPU specific and not visible to other OPU's
    Customers can have only one name and the name must be unique
        In Release 11i a customer can be identified as an organization or a person
            The person classification allows more specific attributes and associations (using TCA)
    Customers can have multiple accounts and customer attributes can be overridden at account level
    Customers can have multiple addresses and each address can have multiple business purposes
        One address can be used on multiple accounts with multiple purposes
    Customers comprise headers, payment methods, bank accounts, phones, addresses and relationships
    These attributes can be defined at the header level or address/site level
    Customers are setup in the RA_CUSTOMERS table
        This is now superceded by the HZ_CUST_ACCOUNTS table where the customer_id is now the cust_account_id
        HZ_CUST_ACCOUNTS has a foreign key to the HZ_PARTIES table

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR) Notes on Customer and Party Relationships
    Customer Relationships and Party Relationships are different
        Customer Relationships are stored in AR.HZ_CUST_ACCT_RELATE_ALL
        Party Relationships are stored in AR.HZ_RELATIONSHIPS
        Customer Relationships allow one customer to pay for another customers invoices
            Alternatively: set profile option "AR: Allow Payment of Unrelated Invoices" -- set to Yes to allow payments to be applied to other customers transactions
    Party Relationships
        Party Relationships are set at the Party Level and can include many different relationship types
        Navigation: Receivables Manager > Customers > Relationship Manager
        References
            Unable To Apply Receipts Between 2 Parties Even The Party Relationship Has Been Created (Doc ID 750102.1)
            R12 How To Setup a Party Paying Relationship Where One Customer Pays For Another Related Customer? (Doc ID 1331544.1)
    Customer Relationships
        Customer Relationships are set at the account level cannot be different types
            They allow one customer to order on behalf of another customer in Order Management or pay on behalf of another customer in receivables
        Reports
            Customer Relationships Listing - shows account relationships only
    Key Tables for Account Relationships
        AR.HZ_CUST_ACCT_RELATE_ALL - stores account relationships
        AR.HZ_RELATIONSHIPS - stores party relationships
    Paying Party Relationships
        Additional References
            Unable To Apply Receipts Between 2 Parties Even The Party Relationship Has Been Created (Doc ID 750102.1)
            R12 How To Setup a Party Paying Relationship Where One Customer Pays For Another Related Customer? (Doc ID 1331544.1)
        Paying Party Relationships are Party Relationships that allow one party to pay for another party's invoices (like account relationships)
        These are relationship types with attributes 'Pay within Group' and 'Pay Below Group' assigned
        They are used to populate the attribute 'Paying Customer' on the transactions window

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR) Notes on Salesreps and Salespersons
    References
        How To Define A Salesperson (Doc ID 205178.1)
        How to do a Mass Update of Salespersons in Customer Form (Doc ID 416461.1)
        Understanding and Troubleshooting SalesCredits in Transactions Workbench (Doc ID 1327396.1)
        Transactions Workbench: Field Defaulting Logic (Doc ID 1413565.1)
    Overview
        Salespersons are defaulted onto invoices in the Salesperson field on the 'More' tab for transaction entry
            Defaulting onto a transaction is in order: Bill-to, Ship-to, Customer (for Customer level, only if MOAC is not enabled)
            If system option 'Require Salesperson' is set and no sales person is assigned to the customer ship-to or bill-to
                Salesperson 'No Sales Credit' is assigned
            References
                Transactions Workbench: Field Defaulting Logic (Doc ID 1413565.1)
        The Sales Credit button on transaction entry can be used to split sales credits across multiple salespersons
        You can define generic salespersons (not employees) or employee-based salespersons (by importing resources)
            Navigation: Receivables Manager > Setup > Transactions > Salespersons
        Salespersons are setup in CRM foundation but the functions are in AR responsibilities
        Salespersons can be used in autoaccounting to derive account segment values
            This applies to revenue, freight and receivables accounts   
        They can be used to allocate sales credits on receivables transactions (invoices, debit memos and commitments)
        They can be assigned to territories in the CRM Resources Window (Receivables Tab) -- see navigation below
        They can be selected in AR aging reports
            Aging - 7 Buckets  - By Salesperson/Agent Report (XML)
            Aging - 7 Buckets  - By Salesperson/Agent Report
        Salespersons cannot be mass updated and customers cannot be queried by sales person in standard customer inquiry
             References
                 How to do a Mass Update of Salespersons in Customer Form (Doc ID 416461.1)
    System Options
        Miscellaneous system option 'Require Salesperson'
    Profile Options
        AR: Allow Update of Existing Sales Credits - controls changes to sales credit lines in Transaction Workbench
    Assigned in the Bill-To and Ship-To Customer Site Purpose Page
        Can be assigned to a customer (i.e. at the customer level) only if MOAC is not enabled
        Defaulting onto a transaction is in order: Bill-to, Ship-to, Customer (for Customer level, only if MOAC is not enabled)
    Setup
        References
            How To Define A Salesperson (Doc ID 205178.1)
        Create an employee
        Import the employee into CRM as a resource (or create a non-employee resource in CRM directly)
        Update the resource with salesperson attributes 
    Setup in the Salespersons form 
        Navigation: Receivables > Setup > Transactions > Salespersons > Search > Receivables Tab
        This navigation opens the CRM Resources page
    Salespersons are part of CRM Foundation (JTF Schema)
        See table JTF.JTF_RS_SALESREPS and JTF_RS_RESOURCE_EXTNS_
    Each Salesperson is assigned to a resource and each resource is assigned privileges (via Roles)

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on AutoAccounting Setup
    AutoAccounting derives each segment of the code combinations for AR Accounts including:
        Revenue - Income Statement account
        Receivables - Balance Sheet asset account
        Tax - Balance Sheet liability account
        AutoInvoice Clearing - Balance Sheet asset clearing account)
        Unearned Revenue
        Unbilled AR
    The primary drivers for AutoAccounting rules are:
        Transaction Types
        Sales Representatives
        Standard Memo Lines
        Tax Codes
        Customer Bill-To's
    In 11i Bill-To was added as a criteria to drive AutoAccounting
        Also in 11i Account Generator was introduced to derive the account segment for:
            foreign currency gains and losses
            interest charge calculations
        Other than these two areas, AutoAccounting derives all account code combinations
    The Transaction Flexfield uniquely identified imported invoice lines
        It is implemented as interface_line_attribute1 through ...attribute10 by Order Management

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Account Generator Setup
    Account Generator was introduced to Oracle AR in 11i
    It has a limited role generating account combinations for the following:
        Foreign currency gain/loss entries for currency conversion - balancing segment only
        Interest charge accounting - balancing segment only
    It replaces the role performed by Flexbuilder for these balancing segment values from Oracle 10
    This is a required setup even if the functions are not used
    All other accounting derivations are done by AutoAccounting in AR

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Profile Class Setup
    Profile classes create classifications of customers with similar characteristics:
        Credit worthiness
        Payment terms
        Cash receipt referencing
        Finance Charges
        Statements and Statement Cycles
        Dunning letters and rules
        Invoicing rules (actually no - these are defined on Order Types)
    Profile Classes provide defaults for customers and customer accounts
    Profile Classes can be overridden at the customer and account levels
        This may involve a lot of work if the number of customers is large

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Transaction Types
    References
        Setting Up Transaction Types In Oracle Receivables (Doc ID 1067797.1)
    Transaction Types default payment terms, accounts, taxability, freight, creation sign posting, and receivable information to transactions
    Transaction Types are stored in RA_CUST_TRX_TYPES_ALL and include some seeded values
        Credit Memo
        Debit Memo
        Invoice
        Projects Credit Memo
        Projects Invoice
    Each Transaction Type is classified as a member of a Class, including:
        Bills Receivable (e.g. promissory note)
        Chargeback
        Credit Memo
        Debit Memo
        Deposit
        Guarantee
        Invoice
    Transaction Types are Organization Specific and repeated for each organization
        Navigation: AR Superuser > Setup > Transactions > Transaction Types
    Transaction Type Definitions are:
        Chargeback - a transaction created and charged to a customer account for short-payment of an invoice
            Chargebacks are normally created during receipt application for short-paid invoices using the 'Chargeback' button on the applications form of Receipts Workbench
            A Chargeback is created with a new document number and default payment terms of immediate
            This is done via the 'Chargebacks' button when choosing transactions to apply against a receipt
    Transaction Type Options
        Allow Overapplication - can apply receipts for more than the transaction amount and drive the invoice balance negative
        Natural Application Only - receipts must reduce balance and not increase it
        Printing Option - controls whether invoices can be printed via Invoice Print

Accounts Receivable (RA and AR Schema) Notes on Transaction Sources
    Navigation: Receivables Manager > Setup > Transactions > Sources
    Transaction sources ...
        are operating unit specific (header region ... Operating Unit, Name and Type (Imported via AutoInvoice or Manual))
        control transaction and transaction batch numbering (batch source tab)
        provide autoinvoice defaults including transaction grouping (autoinvoice options tab) 
        select validation options for importing transactions.
        customer and account value import mapping (value or ID)
        control how the GL_DATE is derived in the import using the Derive Date option on the Accounting Options tab
