Payments (IBY Schema) Homepages
    Funds Disbursement Process Homepages
        Reference: Oracle Payments Users Guide, Chapter 5, Funds Capture Process Homepages
        Payments Manager Dashboard
            This homepage is used when a decentralized processing model for payment is required
            It allows for selection of invoices, entry of Payment Process Requests, subsequent creation of payments and formatting and transmission of payments
            It is typically used by each operating unit to process their invoices through final payment
        Payments Funds Disbursement Process (FDP) Homepage (or Dashboard)
            This homepage should be used when a centralized processing model for payments is required
            It does not support submission of Payment Process Requests - this must be done from the Payments Manager Dashboard
            It allows the Create Payment Instructions Process to be run across the results of multiple 'Build Payments' processes
            Concurrent Processes can be submitted from the Funds Disbursement Homepage including:
                Create Electronic Payment Instructions
                Create Printed Payment Instructions
                Create Regulatory Reporting of Payments
                Format Payment Instructions Uses XML
                Payment File Accompanying Letter
                Payment Instruction Register
                Payment Process Request Status
                Positive Payfile
                Reset Periodic Sequence Value
                Send Separate Remittance Advises
        Funds Capture Process (FCP) Homepage (or Dashboard)

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Entity Definitions
    Document - an invoice or credit memo or debit memo
    Bill of Exchange (11i) or Bill Receivable (R12) - a promisory note to pay on a given date and for a given amount (can be negotiated or sold at a discount)
        Used in place of general trade credit so it can be resold - commits the payee to a specific amount and date to pay/remit
    Payment Instruction: a single file of payments that are printed as checks or transmitted to a financial institution or third party for processing
        A single Payment Instruction can be build from the results of multiple payment process request
    Templates - saved configurations of selection critieria, payment attributes and processing rules that can be reused in multiple payment runs
        Templates can be used in scheduled payment runs also
    Payment Methods
        Payment Method is a payment attribute on the payment document (i.e. invoice)
        It indicates the medium by which payment is made
        Payment Method definitions include defaulting rules used to assign payment method to a document
        Examples are: Checks, Outsourced Checks, Wires, EFT (via ACH in the US, BACS in the UK)
        Payment methods are seeded but additional methods can be user defined
        Selection of payment method on a source document can be restricted to eliminate errors
        In Payables, the default payment method is assigned to the supplier site and can be over-ridden
            This supplier site default is allowed or disallowed in Oracle Payments by Disbursement System Option - Default Payment Method
        Defaulting Rules are assigned to Payment Methods and can be used to default payment methods onto documents in Payments processing
            Navigation: Oracle Payments Setup > Funds Disbursement Setup > Payment Methods > Payment Defaulting Rules
            If the Payments Disbursement System Option 'Default Payment Method' is set to only use defaulting rules, these rules override the defaulting on the source document
        Payment Methods are Defined in Payment setup and can include anticipated float time, and exclusion from defaulting onto payment documents
    Payment Processing Profile
        Specifies payment handling of a payment document including payment generation and payment instruction generation
        General Attributes - include:
            Active Status and End Date,
            Processing Type (printed or electronic)
            Channel (Payments or Gateway)
            When Payment is Marked Complete (e.g. when formatted)
            Manual Completion Status Restrictions (Yes or No)
            Payment Completion Point (e.g. When Payment if Formatted)
                This can be anywhere from when the payment instruction is formatted to where the instruction file is transmitted to the bank
        Usage Rules - limit where a Payment Process Profile can be used
            These rules include restrictions for: Payment Methods, First Parties, Internal Bank Accounts and Currencies
            Payment Creation Options including how scheduled payments are grouped into proposed payments
            Payment Instruction Creation Options including how proposed payments are grouped into actual payments, how payments are sorted, and additional bank instruction text
        Payment System
            For positive pay and electronic payment processing (determined by the Processing Type header attribute = 'Electronic')
                Payment Process Profiles are mapped to Payment Systems, Payment System Accounts, and Transmission Configurations.
        The Relationship between Payment Process Profiles and Payment Methods is many to many
            One Payment Process Profile can be assigned to many Payment Methods (by putting the same Payment Process Profile on many Payment Processing Requests, each with different Payment Method selection)
                In this case you can also leave the Payment Process Profile off the Payment Processing Request and assign it manually when proposed payments are generated
            One Payment Method can be assigned to many Payment Process Profiles (by putting a different Payment Process Profile on different Payment Processing Requests with the same Payment Method selection)
                In this case you will have other criteria in the Payment Processing Requests that differentiate the selected invoices
                You can also manually assign different Payment Process Profiles to proposed payments via the manual assignment option by leaving the Payment Process Profile off the Payment Processing Request
        Payment Instruction Format
            The name of the payment format
            The location where the electonic formatted file is place and how it is named
    Payment Instruction
        A single file of payments with header information, payment records and summary payment amounts
            The payment instruction can be printed (as checks) or physically transmitted to the bank to execute payment
    Transmission Protocols
        These are seeded by Oracle and determine which attributes are needed when a Transmission Configuration is created
    Transmission Configuration
        A Transmission Configuration is a delivery destination for an electronic file
        The Transmission Protocol (choose from seeded values) is defined first and this determines the attributes needed to define the configuration
        A Transmission Configuration together with a Payment System are attached to a Payment Process Profile
    Payment Systems
        A Payment System defines the allowable Payment Formats, allowable Transmission Protocols, base URL Servlet address and special transmission codes required
        It also defines the type (Gateway or Processor) and allowable transactions (credit card, account transfer, debit card)
        Together with a Transmission Protocol it is used on a Payment Process Profile to define a destination
    Disbursement System Options
        Navigation: Oracle Payments Setup > Funds Disbursement Setup > Disbursement System Options
            Allows setting two options at the Business Group and Operating Unit Level
                Default Payment Method - use defaulting rules or use method on payee, then use defaulting rules if blank on payee
                Allow Payee Bank Account Override on Proposed Payments - makes the payee bank account editable on proposed payments

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Funds Capture and Disbursement Responsibilities
    Funds Capture Setup Administrator
        Provides access to the Funds Capture Setup page (for funds capture and shared setups)
    Funds Capture Process Manager
        Provides access to the Funds Capture Process Dashboard
    Funds Disbursement Setup Administrator
        Provides access to the Funds Disbursement Setup page (for funds disbursement and shared setups)
    Funds Disbursement Process Manager
        Provides access to the Funds Disbursement Process (FDP) Dashboard

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Funds Capture Payment Methods
    The payment method is the medium or vehicle used by the payer to remit payment
        Includes: checks, electronic bank account transfers, credit cards, PINless Debit Cards, Bills Receivable Remittances, Outsourced Checks
            The payment method for PINless Debit and Credit cards is seeded.
    A payment method has an associated 'float' time and can have validations applied, just as Payment Formats have validations applied

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Funds Capture Payment Formats
    Defines the Payment Type, Data Extract,  XML Publisher Template and Validations for the layout
    Type - is one of several seeded values that limit the data extract that can be chosen
        For Example: Disbursement Payment Instruction is a 'Type'
        The Type limits the choices of pre-defined data extract choices that can be made in defining the format
    Data Extract - a predefined Oracle program that extracts the data according to a specific schema
        e.g. IBY_FD_PAYMENT_INSTRUCTION 1
    XML Publisher Template - defines the layout applied to the file to format the fixed record output
    Validations can be selected from seeded definitions or from custom (user-defined) definitions
        In general, validations can be assigned to a payment formats and to Disbursement Payment Methods
        Multiple validations can be attached to a single format

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on eText Templates
    References on Customizing Extracts to Support EText
        http://imdjkoch.wordpress.com/category/oracle/oracle-apps/payables/
        Format Customization in Oracle Payments for Oracle Applications Release 12 [ID 787467.1]
        R12: Can Users Customize XML Extract? [ID 457539.1]
        R12 Oracle Payments Processing How To documents [ID 579132.1]
        R12: How To Assign/Modify XML Publisher Payment Templates [ID 414336.1]
    You can extract the underlying XML to analyze eText templates using the 'Extract Entity' option in a Payment Format
        Reference: MOS Note 457400.1 Extract Identity
        Create a new Payment Processing Format in Funds Disbursement Setup Administrator Responsibility
        Choose Type as Disbursement Payment Instruction
        Click Create and define a name and code for the new Format
        Select the data extract to match the data extract used by the eText template
            e.g. Oracle Payments Funds Disbursement Payment Instruction Extract, Version 1 (used for ACH and check payments)
        Select the XML Publisher Template as 'Extract Identity' and apply the changes - no other changes are needed
        Attach the new format to a Payment Process Profile (you can define a new profile if needed)
        Associate the new format to the bank that it will be used to generate payments
            Navigation: Payables Manager > Setup > Payments > Bank Accounts > (Query the Bank and Select the Account) > Manage Payment Documents
            Add the format to the bank account so it is a valid payment format for the account
        Now run a payment process (enter, validate and confirm an invoice in AP first, etc) and generate the XML output

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Validations
    Reference: R12: Oracle Payments Grouping and Validations Explained [ID 1384297.1]
    Validations can be assigned to Payment Formats and to Disbursement Payment Methods - multiple validations can be assigned to each
        The assignment of seeded validations (and the creation of user-defined validations) is done in the entity definition form
            It cannot be done in the Validations viewing form
    There are seeded validations and user-defined validations
        Seeded Validations are viewable via Navigation: Payment Administrator > Payment Setup > Shared Setup > Validations
            Seeded validations can be country specific to meet the requirements of different countries, or generic
            User defined validations cannot be viewed or defined via this navigation
            User defined validations can only be viewed and defined from the Format or Method to which they are attached
            The Validation Point is the point at which the validation is applied - see 'Validation Points'
            You can see which Payment Formats and Disbursement Payment Methods a validation is assigned in the 'Assigned Entity' tab of the Validation Definition
            Validations take parameters and these parameters are viewable in the validation definition in the 'Parameters' tab alongside the 'Assigned Entity' tab
            Assignments can be removed from Payment Methods and Payment Formats unless the entity is seeded in which case they cannot be modified
        User Defined Validations
            User Defined Validations are defined in the same form as the entity is being defined that requires validations
                They cannot be defined or viewed in the standard viewing page for seeded validations
                For example a user defined validation for a Payment Format is created in the Payment Format Definition page
            User Defined Validations have implicitly defined Validation Points (based on the name of the field being validated) - see below
                The Validation Point determines where the validation is applied (document, proposed payment, payment, instruction)
            A User Defined validation comprises:
                Field Name - the name of the field being validated - this also implicitly determines the validation point
                Validtion Name - the condition name such as 'greater that' or 'less than'
                Country - if the validation is for a specific country
                Payment Method - if the validation is specific to a payment method also
     Actions to Take When Documents, Payments and Instructions Fail Validations
         Most commonly the action to take is to exclude the document from processing (i.e. remove the document or payment from the Payment Process Request)
             Secondarily action can be to correct the source problem in the such as setup or third party payeed data, then resubmit the process
        Validation Points apply to Seeded and User Defined Validations
            The Validation Point determines where the validation is applied (document, proposed payment, payment, instruction)
            For seeded validations the validation point is pre-set as one of: Document, Payment, Payment Instruction, Settlement or Settlement Batch
            For user defined validations, the validation point is decided by the Field Name you choose to validate
                For example if you choose the field name 'Document Amount' the validation is applied to a document
                If you choose the field name 'Payment Instruction Total Amount' the validation is applied to the Payment Instruction
            Validations can have one of four validation points:
                Document level in the source product (e.g. Invoice in payables) - these validations must be assigned to the Payment Method
                Document level in Payments (e.g. Invoice as a Proposed Payment) - these validations must be assigned to the Payment Format
                    They must also be Document Level validations (i.e. the Validation field must be a Document field)
                Payment level in Payments (e.g. Payment in Actual Payments) - these validations must be set on Payment fields
                Payment Instruction level in Payments - these validations must be set on Payment Instruction fields

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Funds Capture Process Profiles
    Communication profile with payment system
        Payer Verification
        Notification rules
        Acknowledgement rules
        Batch building rules
    The profile is invoked from routing rules in  payee (internal organization) setup
    Similar to Payment Process Profile for AP
    Grouping
        Reference: R12: Oracle Payments Grouping and Validations Explained [ID 1384297.1]
        Grouping criteria can be selected to determine
            How documents/proposed payments are grouped into payments and
            How payments are grouped into instructions
            These grouping criteria can be used to create separate payments or separate instructions where otherwise a single combined payment or instruction would be created
        All Grouping of proposed payments and payments are defined in the Payment Process Profile and include:
            Grouping selected documents (invoices and memos) into Proposed Payments (via Payment Process Request)
                This is done on the Payments Creation tab of a Payment Process Profile Definition
            Grouping payments into Payment Instructions
                This is done on the Payment Instruction Creation tab of a Payment Process Profile Definition
        Grouping of Documents into Payments (i.e. Document Grouping)
            This is done by IBY_PAYGROUP_PUB which groups validated documents into proposed payments
            Exception - if the payment process request selects credit memos, AP pregroups these document and grouping is not done by Payments
                When a PPR contains memos, Payables will pre-group the "Documents Payable" (the selected invoices and memos)
                    by stamping them with a payment grouping number (IBY_DOCS_PAYABLE_ALL.PAYMENT_GROUPING_NUMBER).
                When the payments Build Payments program detects that the Documents Payable are pre-grouped by Payables,
                it will ignore all the user-defined grouping rules defined in the Payment Process Profile, and apply only the pre-defined grouping rules.
        Grouping of Payments into Payment Instructions
            This is done by IBY_PAYINSTR_PUB which groups payments into payment instructions
Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Funds Capture Payment Systems
    Payment System are electronic destinations where payment files are sent
    Payment Systems define:
        The processing model (processor or gateway)
        The destination bank processor or gateway
        The communication character set
        The transmission servlet (destination) URL and status
        The supported capabilities: credit, debit, account transfer
        The payment formats supported
        The transmission protocols supported
        The attributes of the transmission including source and destination, protocol and account/passwords (transmission configuration)
        Special codes required in the file and their datatypes
        Bank Account Lead Days for Capture Processing (days delay in executing the capture)

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Wallets:
    Wallets must be defined to hold encryption certificates
        A Wallet is a file which stores a system key
    The Wallet location and password are stored in locations identified by FND profile options
        FND_DB_WALLET_DIR (Database Wallet Directory)
            e.g. /opt/oracle/product/applzmgt/11.2.0.3/appsutil/wallet
    It uses Oracle Wallet Manager to manage the contents of the wallet file
    The wallet performs two functions:
        HTTP client Authentication when connecting to an external destination servlet
        It holds the private key of the entity authorized to send transactions - allowing the sending entity to encrypt the data
    A wallet setup page is used to:
        Specify the location of the wallet file
        Define the password of the wallet file
        Specify whether to generate the system key yourself or let the system do it
    To create a wallet file
        Run owm on the Unix level on the middle tier server
        Import the private encryption key used for client authentication at the destination
        Initialize the system security key via Payments Setup > System Security Options
            This identifies the location of the wallet file to Oracle
            It allows specifying the wallet password that will be used to encrypt the contents
            It generates a private encryption key (or allows you to load a predefined key) and stores it in the wallet
    Once the wallet is defined it can be activated for payment instrument
        Navigation: Payments Setup > System Security Options > Payment Instruments (region)

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Funds Capture Payment System Accounts
    One payment system has one or more accounts
    You define the account by giving it a name in Payment System Definition
    You can define one or more accounts for a single payment system

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Funds Capture Payees
    Payees (Internal Organizations) are Created in Payments Module
    Payees are business units and legal entities and are defined to include:
        Organizations for which they process receipts
        Payment Instruction Types
        Payment System Accounts and Funds Capture Process Profiles that can be used
        Risk formulas
        Routing rules

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Funds Capture Bank Account Transfers
    Includes Business to Consumer and Business to Business models
    Transfers funds from customer bank account to payee bank account
    Performs Funds Validations in real time for fraud alerts and account validity
    Funds Capture bank account transfers are always processed offline in batches

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Funds Capture Processor vs Gateway Payment Processor Models
    Processors operate directly with the banks
    Gateways are third parties that operate indirectly (i.e. a payment gateway)
        Gateways are for low volume transactions and offer simplicity and lower authentication overhead
            All activity with gateways is online and realtime
        Direct processors are for high volume transactions and require rigorous authentication
            Processor activity is real-time for authentication and batch/offline for transactions

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Funds Capture Routing Rules
    Funds Capture Routing Rules apply to receivables and not payables
        For payables the internal bank account is determined from the payment process profile
        For receivables the Routing Rules dynamically attach the internal bank account to the processing profile
    Each payee/internal organization can have its own routing rules for funds capture
    Routing rules derive and associate: Payment System Account and Funds Capture Process Profile
    Routing rules comprise:
        Basic rule information - rule name and payment method
        Destination - the payment system and method of sending (payment system account and funds capture process profile)
        Conditions - under which the routing rule is applicable (amount, currency, bank routing number etc)
    How Routing rules work:
        The routing engine retrieves routing rules based on the payee (internal) organization and payment method in the payment request
        The routing rule with the highest priority is evaluated first for matching transaction values and conditions
            If no match, the next routing rule is evaluated
            If no routing rules match, the transaction is routed to the default Payment System
                This is the default Payment System Account and Funds Capture Process Profile

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Payment Processing Requests
    A payment processing request is an actual submission for a single organization and payment method to disburse or capture funds
        It starts by selecting eligible invoices for payment (i.e. selecting scheduled payments)
        It includes choices on how to respond to validation failures (e.g. reject only payments with errors)
        Invoices that cannot be paid due to payment validation failures are put on hold and the holds are viewable in the invoice inquiry form

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Payment Processing Business Flow
    Main Steps
        Document Selection (AP programs/code), aka 'AutoSelect'
            Selects invoice and memo documents
        (Build and) Confirm Payments (IBY programs/code)
            Assigns bank account
            Assigns payment process profile
            Performs validations
            Creates proposed payments
            Updates proposed payments if manual changes are made
        Format Payments (IBY programs/code) - the Payment Instructions Build process
            Creates and formats payment instructions (including files)
            Transmits EFT files
        Confirm Payments (AP Programs/code)
            Prints checks
            Records completed payments
            Updates invoices as paid
            Updates the payment history file
    Define a Payment Processing Request (in Payment Manager)
        Navigation: Payables Responsibility > Payments > Entry > Payments Manager (displays the Payments Manager 'Dashboard')
        Choose the Payment Processing Request tab, then click 'Submit Single Request'
        Enter a name for the Payment Processing Request
        Choose a template to default most of the settings on the Payment Processing Request, otherwise enter the values manually
            You can also choose a template then modify the values that are defaulted
        On the 'Scheduled Payments Selection Criteria' tab
            Enter Required fields: Payment Process Request Name, and Pay Through date, Payment Date (Payments tab), Payment Exchange Rate Type (Payments tab)
                The Pay Through Date applies to the Invoice Discount Date or Invoice Due Date (you have a separate option to exclude items based on Discount Date)
            Specify any optional selection criteria: Pay From Date, Payment Priorities, Supplier Type, Payee, Payment Method, Invoice Batch, Invoice Exchange Rate Type
                Since payment method is optional, you can leave it open to pay invoices with different payment methods in the same payment processing request
        On the Payment Attributes tab
            Optionally specify the Payment Process Profile, Bank Disbursement Account and Payment Document (can be done later during payment build)
        On the Process tab
            Choose to pause processing after Scheduled Payment Selection and after Proposed Payment Creation (Process tab)
            Choose 'Maximize Credits' to create a payment that draws down as much available credit memo value as possible
                Warning: if you don't choose this option and credits exceed invoice values, no invoices will be selected because no payments should be made
                If you choose this option, credits will be included in the payment build process to the extent they do not exceed invoice values
        On the Validations Failure Results Tab
            Choose how to handle validation failures
        On the Additional Information Tab
            Specify additional information if the DFF for Payments is defined
    Submit the Payment Process Request (by clicking 'Submit' from Payment Manager) to select invoices and run payment processes
        Concurrent Process 'Select Scheduled Payments' runs (AP_AUTOSELECT_PGK aka AutoSelect) - this is an AP process
            The status of the Payment Process Request is set to 'Selecting Invoices'
        A record is inserted into AP_INV_SELECTION_CRITERIA_ALL with a checkrun_name which is the same as the payment process request name.
            A Payment Process Profile and Internal Bank Account (to build payments) are not required and can be added later
        Invoices are selected based on Due Date, Discount Date, Paygroup and other criteria in the Process Payment Request
        Selected invoices are inserted into AP_SELECTED_INVOICES_ALL
        Unselected invoices are inserted into AP_UNSELECTED_INVOICES_ALL
        AP_PAYMENT_SCHEDULES_ALL.CHECK_RUN_ID is stamped on each AP_PAYMENT_SCHEDULES_ALL record for the selected documents
        Invoices are locked to prevent being selected by another payment process request
        It generates the 'Scheduled Payment Selection Report' (viewable via SRS)
        If no invoices meet the selection criteria (so no records in AP_PAYMENT_SCHEDULES_ALL are tagged) the Payment Process Request is cancelled
            The status of the PPR is set to 'Cancelled - No Invoices Selected'
        Else If 'Pause after Scheduled Payment Selection' has been chosen in the Payment Process Request
            The Payment Process Request ends in status 'Invoices Pending Review' and the IBYBUILD process ('Build Payments') is not automatically started
            Available actions are 'Cancel' and 'Modify/Proceed'
            Choose 'Start Action' for the 'Modify/Proceed' Action (from Payment Manager) to review selected invoices (on the 'Selected Scheduled Payments' page)
                Add or remove selected Invoices and modify the discounts and payment amounts
                Choose 'View Unselected' (from 'Selected Scheduled Payments' page) to review unselected invoices (on the 'Unselected Scheduled Payments' page)
            Choose 'Add Scheduled Payments' (from Payment Manager) to enter criteria to search and select additional scheduled payments
                This can include adding invoices that were excluded due to larger credit notes offsetting their value
            Make changes such as adding scheduled payments (search is by supplier) or removing them
            Then submit the changes by clicking 'Submit' from the 'Select Scheduled Payments' Region of the Scheduled Payments Review page
                This will submit the process to build proposed payments directly
            You can also Review Cash Requirements (from Payment Manager)
        Else If the Pause After Scheduled Payment Selection was not chosen, the Build program (IBYBUILD 'Build Payments') is submitted automatically to create proposed payments.
        However if documents fail validations assigned to the Payment Method and the validations apply at the document level
            The user can navigate to the Resolve Document Validation Errors page to review the validation errors and
                Dismiss individual documents payable from the payment process, if necessary, and
                Restart the Build Payments process when the errors have been resolved.
    Select action 'Initiate Payment Creation' and click 'Submit' to start the proposed payments creation process (from Payment Manager - IBYBUILD 'Build Payments')
            This process may follow on directly from the 'Submit' process above which triggered 'Calculating Special Amounts'
            This is an AP process that builds proposed payments
            This starts the proposed payment build process directly
                If the option to Calulate Special Amounts and Witholding Taxes is chosen in the Payment Process Request
                This starts the 'Apply Changes, Recalculate Amounts and Submit Request (Recalculate Payment Process Request)' process
                It calculates special amounts such as interest and taxes immediately prior to generating proposed payments
                    The status of the Payment Processing Request is set to 'Calculating Special Amounts'
                    This step is optional and driven by the 'Calculate Withholding Tax and Interest During the Scheduled Payment Selection' flag on the Payment Process Request
            The status of the Payment Process Request is set to 'Assembling Payments' and changes to 'Selected' and then 'Building'
            This program is called by AP and calls the package IBY_DISBURSE_SUBMIT_PUB_PKG
            There is no output report for this program
            It groups Scheduled Payments into proposed payments
        If the IBYBUILD ends immediately in status 'Information Required - Pending Action' then errors were found (i.e. information required to create the payments is missing)
            For example it cannot find a default internal bank and Payment Process Profile
            The display status of the Payment Processing Request is 'Information Required - Pending Action'
            Click on 'Start Action' button to review these issues (on the 'Complete Document Assignments' page)
                This opens the 'Complete Document Assignments' page to assign a bank account and Payment Process Profile
                You can assign a different payment process profile and bank account to each payment
            The user should complete the missing Assignment information and rerun the Payment Process to continue.
                This is done by choosing the action 'Run Payments Process' in the 'Complete Document Assignments' window
                Once you restart the payment process, the status returns to 'Assembling Payments'
                You can also terminate the Payment Process Request here.
            Alternatively there are payment level validations that failed
                The user can go to the Resolve Payment Validation Errors page to review the validation errors
                Actions allowed include removing documents payable or entire payments, if necessary, and
                Restart the Build Payments process when the errors have been resolved
        If Stop Process for Review After Creation of Proposed Payments is enabled in the Payment Processing Request
            The PPR status is set to Pending Proposed Payment Review.
            This status prevents further processing until user takes action.
            Click on 'Start Action' (on Payment Manager) to review proposed payments (on the 'Review Proposed Payments' page)
                Or you can click on the Payment Processing Request (from Payment Manager) to drill to the payment details
                For each payment, you can choose to drill down to the Scheduled Payments that it comprises
                You can change the Maturity Date on Bills Payable
                You can change the Payee Bank Account which is defaulted down from the Supplier Site
                     This is only allowed if the Disbursement System Option "Allow Payee Bank Account Override on Proposed Payments" is set
                     Navigation: Payments Setup > Funds Disbursement Setup > Disbursement System Options
                You can also remove payments by selecting them and removing them
                You can also remove documents from a payment
                Once completed you can choose 'Run Payment Process' to continue.
                    This will start the Formatting process - which creates the payment instructions
        Documents are validated against Payment Method validations and Payment Format validations by IBY_VALIDATIONSETS_PUB
            If all documents pass validation, they are assigned 'VALIDATED' status and the Payment Process Request status is set to 'Documents Validated'
            Documents that fail validation are handled according to the Validation Level on the Payment Process Request:
                REQUEST (reject all), DOCUMENT (reject only individual documents), PAYEE (reject all for a supplier), NONE (stop the request for review)
            Documents that fail validation are released for future pay runs
        You can click on 'Rejected and Removed Items' (from Payment Manager') to see scheduled payments that were rejected or removed
            For each rejection, you can click on the reference number to see the reason for the rejection
        Concurrent Process 'Group into Payments' runs (IBY_PAYGROUP_PUB)
            The validated documents are then grouped into proposed payments based on the grouping rules, both user defined and hard coded.
                e.g. If exclusive_payment_flag = Y on a document, its paid on a separate payment.
                Grouping is done by Payment Method and additional grouping rules defined in the Payment Process Request (e.g. payment date)
             Payments are internally numbered and validated and inserted in IBY_PAYMENTS_ALL
             IBY_DOCS_PAYABLE_ALL is updated with the payment_id and formatting_payment_id values that corresponding to the payment that pays the document.
        A record is inserted in IBY_PAY_SERVICE_REQUESTS for the Payment Process Request with CALL_APP_PAY_SERVICE_REQ_CODE = CHECKRUN_NAME
            This table has REQUIRE_PROP_PMTS_REVIEW_FLAG to determine if payments should be reviewed, and CREATE_PMT_INSTRUCTIONS_FLAG to automatically submit the Payment Instructions process
            Valid statuses for the Payment Process Request in this table are:
                DOCUMENTS_VALIDATED, INFORMATION_REQUIRED, INSERTED , PAYMENTS_CREATED, PENDING_REVIEW, TERMINATED, VALIDATION_FAILED
        Records are inserted into IBY_DOCS_PAYABLE_ALL for the payments that are built
            The link to the Payment Processing Request is through PAYMENT_SERVICE_REQUEST_ID.
            If the Payment Process Request has the internal bank account and payment profile assigned to it, these are assigned to all the documents IBY_DOCS_PAYABLE_ALL
                This is done by IBY_ASSIGN_PUB code
        If There are No Errors and Process Stop was not Requested
            The status of the Payment Processing Request is set to Payments Created.
            In this status, payment instruction can be created for the Payment Processing Request.
    Formatting Payment Instructions
        The CREATE_PMT_INSTRUCTIONS_FLAG can be a Y or N in the Payment Processing Request when it was originally defined
            Yes (Y) - Payment Instruction will be automatically created after payments are created.
                If the PPR is setup to automatically submit instruction, the payment_service_request_id will be populated in iby_payment_instructions_all
                    This is because the instruction will be specific to the PPR
                    In this case, the instruction can be linked to the PPR using PAYMENT_SERVICE_REQUEST_ID
            No (N) - Application waits for standard request submission for Payment Instruction.
                If the PPR processing is setup for the user to submit the instruction as a standard request, then
                when the instruction is submitted, it is linked to the PPR through the payments selected by the instruction.
        The setting of the flag CREATE_PMT_INSTRUCTIONS_FLAG gives two options for creating payment instructions
            Directly within a Payment Processing Request or
            Indirectly in Standard Request Submission (for multiple Payment Processing Requests)
        For a single Payment Processing Request, select the action 'Run Payment Process' in the Payment Processing Request page
            This submits the Payments Build and Formatting process (from Payment Manager)
            This is an  IBY process to Create Payments and Format Payment Documents for a single Payment Processing Request
                You cannot do this from the Payment Instruction tab - this tab is used for querying back existing payment instructions only
            It comprises restarting 'Build Payments' (IBYBUILD) with the option to kick off 'Format Payment Instructions with Text Output'
            A record is inserted into IBY_PAYMENT_INSTRUCTIONS_ALL - this stores the payment instruction information.
            Concurrent Process 'Format Payment Instructions' (IBY_PAYINSTR_PUB) runs and generates the payment instructions files.
                This process applies any grouping rules defined in the Payment Processing Request
            Formatting the Payment Instruction File includes several steps
                Numbers the payments - Check Numbering
                Creates XML Extract message
                Passes the extract to XML publisher
                Applies the format template via XML Publisher (BI publisher)
                BI publisher formats and stores the output
                The output is stored in the location defined by the 'Payment Instructions Format' setup area on the Payment Process Profile including:
                    Outbound Payment File Prefix
                    Outbound Payment File Extension
                    Outbound Payment File Directory
                Oracle Payments then updates the status of the Payment Instruction and the Payments.
                    If successful, the status of Payments and Instruction is Formatted.
                    If successful for paper checks, the status of Payments and Instructions is 'Formatted - Ready for Printing'
                        Printing can be started by choosing the 'Action' icon for this payment instruction
                        It opens the' Print Payment Documents' page
                There can be multiple payment instructions for a payment process request because multiple payment process profiles are allowed in the manual assignment step
                The payment instructions are given a Reference Number and listed below the Payment Process Request once completed
        For multiple Payment Processing Requests, run 'Create Electronic Payment Instructions' from Standard Request Submission
            This will kick off the additional job 'Format Payment Instruction with Text Output' once it is complete
            Or you can run 'Create Printed Payment Instructions' for paper checks
            Specify the 'Payment Process Profile' parameter to create a payment instruction across multiple similar payment processing requests that use the same Payment Process Profile
                Criteria can include: Payment Process Profile, Currency, Internal Bank Account, Payment Process Request and Payment Document
            Specify the 'Create Electronic Payments - Transmit Now' option to have the electronic payment file transmitted automatically
                This option is also available on a Payment Processing Profile definition for straight-through processing (on the 'Payment System' tab)
        Every payment is assigned an internal 'Payment Reference Number' which is displayed on payment pages and used in Searches
            It is not the check number (payment document number) or payment instruction number
        If the Create Payment Instructions program finds validation errors (based on validations that apply at the 'Payment Instruction' validation point)
            The Instruction creation process is stopped for review
            The Resolve Payment Instruction Validation Errors page can be used to review, resolve and over-ride validation errors
            Resolutions can include removing payments from the instruction or changing setups or third party payee data and resubmitting the instruction build and validation process
    Print Checks or Perform Electronic Transmission
        If the action was taken earlier to print payment documents, you can choose 'Print' from the 'Print Payments Document' page
        Print Checks if Payments are manual (from Payment Manager)
        Users can load stationery into the printer and print checks at this stage.
        Determine if the checks printed ok. If not reprint
    Transmit Payment Instructions if Payments are Electronic (concurrent process)
        Check on the Funds Disbursement Dashboard for all Payment Instructions in status 'Formatted - Ready to Transmit'
            Choose the 'Action' button to start the transmission process' to start the transmission and payment confirmation process
    Confirm Payments
        Code: AP_PMT_CALLOUT_PKG
        'Record Print Status' of the checks to confirm the payments. Oracle Payments calls ap_pmt_callout_pkg.payment_completed to confirm the payments.
            This is an action available from the Payment Instruction
            A page displays to show checks used, skipped, or used for overflow checkstup processing
            Review the information and click 'Continue' to get a warning - the following action cannot be reversed
                Payments will be marked as complete - undoing will require voiding the process
                This starts the concurrent process 'Record Print Status'
            Click 'Apply' to display the 'Funds Disbursement Administrator' Window
                You can monitor the request to confirm print status from this window.
                This does the following:
                Assigns sequence/values Document sequencing.
                Creates data in AP_CHECKS_ALL with appropriate data from IBY tables.
                    Checkrun_name = ppr name and checkrun_id = checkrun_id from IBY table.
                Data inserted into AP_INVOICE_PAYMENTS_ALL for the corresponding checks.
                AP_PAYMENT_SCHEDULES_ALL for the invoices are updated to indicate the payment details and status.
                The documents paid in this PPR are released by setting the checkrun_id on the payment schedules to null.
                AP_INVOICES_ALL is udpated to show payment status
                Data is deleted from the AP_SELECTED_INVOICES_ALL
                Data is deleted from AP_UNSELECTED_INVOICES_ALL
            The concurrent program 'Payment Instruction Register' shows the actual payments made
    View and Void Payment Instructions
        You can view and void existing payment instructions from the Payment Instructions Tab in Payments Manager
        You can terminate and rollback the payment instruction if the status is not 'Formatted' or 'Printed'
    View Payments
        You can view payments within payment instructions from the Payments Tab in Payments Manager
        You can search for individual payments
        You can stop a payment and release a stop (for example, if the payment/check document is found and the stop is not wanted)
        You can confirm the stop payment which means the payment has been stopped by the bank
            Once a payment stop is confirmed, the stop can not be released

Payments (IBY Schema) Notes on Payment Processing Forms and Pages
    Payment Manager - Payables > Payments Entry > Payment Manager
        Home Tab - monitor the status of recent processes, highlight processes requiring attention, prompt for appropriate actions, and take shortcuts to making adjustments
        Templates - create new templates and choose existing templates to submit new payment process requests and determine cash requirements
        Payment Process Requests Tab - submit a single payment request or schedule a recurring payment request, cancel a request or drill into the details of a request
            Subtabs include: Selection Criteria, Payment Attributes, User Rates, Processing, Validation Failures, Additonal Information
                The Processing tab allows a choice of automatically submitting the follow-on Payment Instruction Process (streamlining)
                    This gives the option of not combining a single payment processing request into others when instructions are created
                    It also gives the flexibility to 'pay alone' on a single request
                You can also choose to stop/pause payment processing after Scheduled Payment Selection and after Proposed Payment Creation
        Payment Instructions Tab -
     Payments Tab -

Payroll (PER in the HR Schema) Notes
    Payroll can calculate employee payments for salary, time based wages, commissions and awards, as well as pass through employee reimbursements
    Reciprocity rules handle agreements between taxing authorities at the employees work location vs their home location
    Vacations are accumulated as a liability to be given out, or paid out upon termination

Period-End Processing and Close
    Reference: Period Close Advisor: E-Business Suite (EBS) [ID 335.1]
        Contains period close instructions for all Subledgers and General Ledger
    Period-End Close includes closing all subledgers then closing the General Ledger
    Within each subledger, steps include:
        Moving all accounting transactions to the General Ledger
        Closing the subledger
    Once all subledgers are closed, run the 'Subledger Period Close Exception Report'
        Reference: R12: How to Use the Subledger Period Close Exceptions Report for Period Close Activity? [ID 793598.1]
        This will identify any accounting problems that need to be reviewed and resolved.
    The sequence of closing subledgers in period-end processing accounts for dependencies between applications
    The sequence for closing subledgers is:
        Close Payables - the first subledger to close
            Payables must close before Fixes Assets, Projects and Purchasing
            Payables invoices create Mass Additions in FA, Costs in Projects
            Payables invoices also reduce the purchasing accruals for goods received not invoiced
            Payables create project costs (expenses)
        Close Purchasing
            Purchasing must close after Payables and before Inventory
        Close Inventory
            Inventory must close after Purchasing and before Order Management
            Inventory close ensures no additional shipments that generate receivables and COGS
        Close Projects
            Projects must close after Payables and Inventory and before Receivables (for Project Billing)
        Close Order Management
            Order Management does not create accounting transactions
                It determines when accounting for Cost of Goods Sold and Revenue are done
                Order Management must close after Inventory and before Receivables
        Close Receivables
            Receivables must close after Projects and Order Management
                Order Management can trigger shipments from Inventory
                Order Management can trigger invoices in Accounts Receivable
        Close Fixed Assets
            Fixed Assets must close after Payables
        Close General Ledger
            General Ledger must close after Fixed Assets and Receivables
            Several processes occur in General Ledger before it is closed
                Mass Allocations
                Adjusting Entries
                Recurring Entries
                Consolidations
                Eliminations
                Revaluations (after consolidations are done)
    Close Diagnostics
        Also see: Support Diagnostics
        Reference: Diagnostic Test Catalog for 12.1.3 [ID 1083807.1] (search on Closing diagnostics for different applications)
            Many modules have diagnostics that can be run before or during the close
            Reference: 'Oracle Diagnostics Pack for R12' (search in Metalink)
            General Ledger Close Diagnostics
            Receivables Close Diagnostics
    GL Period Statuses are:
        Future Entry
        Open
        Closed
        Permanently Closed

Process Manufacturing (OPM) Notes:
    OPM is an Oracle migration of GEMMS (Global Enterprise Manufacturing Management) from Datalogix in 1996
    OPM handles the unique requirements of continuous sampling of product properties and continuous recipe adjustment to maintain specifications with changing qualities on inputs
    Primary areas of application are food, drink, pharmaceuticals and chemicals manufacturing
    OPM maintains it's own set of masterfile tables that are kept sychronized with the main Oracle apps through real-time database triggers. Depending on the data, the maintenance is done in Oracle or in OPM
    OPM includes purchasing, inventory, production management, cost management and order processing for sales

Project Costing and Billing (PA Schema) Notes on Troubleshooting, Tips and Tricks
    Project costing is often used as a budgeting tool in place of turning on budgets in GL
        Budgetary controls in GL require encumbrance accounting features to be activated with a lot of overhead
        Project accounting provides selective budgetary control over specific expenditures "charged" to projects
    Task numbers should be segmented based on level (eg 01.05.11 is a three level WBS) because many forms arrange these tasks alphanumerically in a display.
        Task names with these embedded numbers can be 20 characters long, but task descriptions can be 250 chars
    Use templates to define projects using common terminology for similar tasks
        This helps ensure meaningful analysis and reporting across projects
    Capture projects, tasks, expenditure types and expenditure organizations at the point of data entry for feeder systems
        This includes: procurement, time, expenses, to ensure consistancy of project data across systems
    Set profile option: PA: Debug Mode to 'Yes' to debug concurrent jobs

Project Costing and Billing (PA Schema) Notes on Troubleshooting, Tips and Tricks
    There is a debug profile option for troubleshooting PA requests
        PA: Debug Mode
        PA: Debug Log Directory (although the debug log is normally inserted into the concurrent manager log)
    You must use a valid Expenditure Item Ending Date on expenditure transactions
        If you don't then the error 'Invalid Ending Date' will be thrown in transaction import
        Check the correct value in Setup -> System -> Implementation Options -> Exp/. > Expenditure Cycle Start Day
        Oracle use this date to group expenditure items into expenditures

        Why are budget hours instead of currencies displayed
    What is the meaning of 'Future' in Project GL Periods
        The GL Period Statuses of 'Future' and 'Open' have the same privileges (they allow posting of transactions and interfacing of journals to the General Ledger).
        The period status 'Future' is normally used if other modules are open for a period where Projects is not yet open (e.g. Purchasing or Payables) and interfaced transactions must be accepted in Projects.
        When users transact directly into Projects the status should be changed to 'Open'. If the period statuses in other systems are kept the same as the periods in Projects, then Future is not used.
    How do you determine the Project Expenditure Item Ending Date for Expenditure Entry
        Look at the 'Expenditure Cycle Start Day' in Setup -> System -> Implementation Options -> Expnd/Costing
        This shows the start day for each expenditure period from which you can derive the end-day/dates

Project Costing and Billing (PA Schema) Notes on General Functionality
    Projects includes:
        Project Costing - for tracking project costs against budgets,
            Costing collects information about project costs
        Project Billing - for billing project based revenue,
            Billing is used to bill out projects based on completions and calculate project profitability
        Project Connect for MS Project - to exchange setups with MS Projects
        Activity Management Gateway - for uploading project setups
        Projects Analysis Collection Pack
    The fundamental form of a project is it's tasks and subtasks (aka Work Breakdown Structure or WBS)
        The number of levels in a WBS is unlimited
    Projects are owned by operating units and every project is assigned to an OPU
        The OPU is viewable on the main projects maintenance form
    Projects can be one of three separate 'type' classes:
        Capital (construction-in-process and capitalized on completion),
        Indirect (overhead expenses like Admin or Legal eventually charged out to other projects),
        Contract (billable to clients)
    Capital projects are interfaced to Fixed Assets at the time they are capitalized.
        One project can generate many assets (through grouped tasks)
    Indirect projects  are charged with overheads (like a project office or employee overheads) where each item is a specific overhead item.
        The allocations feature in 11i charges the overheads out to other projects
    Contract projects can be billed out to clients on different bases: time and expense, fixed price, cost plus.
        Funding is required for any contract project, through a customer agreement.
        One agreement can fund multiple projects (like construction and operations)
        A revenue budget is also required for a contract project
            The project must be baselined (budget fixed) before revenue can be generated.
    Projects support budgets and progress for expenditures against budget
        Budgets can be multiple types: including plan and forecast
        Expenditure organizations on projects establish budgets of what they can spend
    Projects is not a project management system used to schedule activities, assign resources and manage deliverables
        It does not support progress tracking, critical pathing, resource allocations and leveling, task dependencies and PERT analysis
        Projects is a subledger that tracks Work in Progress or Construction in Progress for accounting purposes
    Projects is a subledger to GL and posts costs and billed revenues
    Projects maintains costs from Purchasing and Payables from the earliest point of commitments and obligations
        Projects tracks commitments before invoicing occurs
        It also interface recognized revenue to the GL
    Project costs are charged and maintained within business groups
        employees in one business group cannot charge a project owned by another business group
    The business group Organization is the owner of the project burdening organization hierarchy
        So all burdening must be within the business group that owns the project.
    Revenue and expenditures are tracked to the owning organization of a project.
    Costs are tracked by Expenditure Type and Expenditure Category
        Expenditure types are cost classifications such as Direct Labor, Indirect Labor, Electricity, etc
        Expenditure Categories group expenditure types: eg. Labor, Materials, Miscellaneous, Utilities etc.
            See Project Costing Users Guide, Chapter 2 Expenditures/Overview of Expenditures/Expenditure Classifications
            Navigation: <Project Costing Superuser>/Setup/Expenditures/Expenditure Categories
            Navigation: <Project Costing Superuser>/Setup/Expenditures/Expenditure Types
    Key members (employees) assigned to a project can view and update project details.
        They are assigned based on roles which limit their privileges
        The profile option "PA: Cross Project User -- View" allows non-key members to view project details
            They can only view projects owned by their Operating Unit (based on their current responsibility)
            It will not allow them to view labor costs, which are sensitive data in many companies
        The profile option "PA: Cross Project User -- Update" allows non-key members to change project details
            They can only update projects owned by their Operating Unit (based on their current responsibility)
    The reporting hierarchies and starting points for an OPU can be viewed in Project Setups
        Navigation: Projects/Setups/System/Implementation Options (System, Project Setup, Expnd/Costing)
        These hierarchies can be viewed in Org setups
            Navigation: PSU/Resources and Organizations/HR Foundation/Work Structures/Organization/Hierarchy
    Quick entry fields are defined to assist in setting up a project quickly
    Transactions imported from other systems are assigned a transaction source.
        The source determines whether the transaction has already been accounted in the GL by setting the source to 'pre-accounted'
        Account generater will not pick up these pre-accounted transactions inside projects.
        Transaction sources for seeded setups are defaulted to 'pre-accounted'
        Only adjustments to the transactions made within Projects will require account distributions
    'PRC:Distribute Usage and Miscellaneous Costs' distributes costs based on usage and assigns accounting distributions to charge lines
        It takes the quantity of a cost transaction like machine units and calculates costs
            Costs are based on raw cost rates from non-labor resource setups
            Calculation includes burdens to arrive at total burdened costs
    The 'Generate Draft Revenues' process calculates draft revenues  from cost lines and revenue events
        It determines the distribution of revenue accounts
    Followup processes to 'Generate Draft Revenue' are to:
        run 'Interface Revenue to GL' (for unearned revenue),
        run 'Generate Draft Invoice' (for unbilled receivables) and
        run 'Interface Invoices to Receivables' processes
    'Streamline processes' in Projects group multiple interface jobs into request sets to run more efficiently
        Streamline processes are:
            PRC:Submit Interface Streamline Process, and
            PRC: Submit Project Steamline Process
    Implementation of HR will disable the HR related maintenance forms in Projects
        All maintenance must be done through the HR forms (which are more extensive)
    Inventory is issued to a project by capturing the project, task, expenditure type and expenditure org in the picking/issue transaction
        For capital projects, PA posts journals to GL for CIP costs (DR Project CIP, CR Liability) and then
            CR: Project CIP, DR Assets when placed in service date is processed and mass additions is run to create the fixed asset.
    Project expenses can be entered directly into Oracle Projects as an alternative to posting into Self Service Expenses
        PA will transfer them to AP as liabilities, and AP will post to the ledger.
    Do -> Assign reporting organization PCSU/Setup/System/Implementation Options, to inspect the current assigned reporting organization
    Do -> View project commitments, budgets and actual expenditures at a summary level PCSU/Project Status/Project Status Inquiry/...
        and query a project to get summary information.
    Do -> View key members PCSU/Projects/Find Projects/Open/Key Members/Detail and review each key member name and role on the project

    Project

        Defaulted from the Project Type (entered in Task Details)
        Service Types can be used for reporting only
        They are used to classify the type of task being performed (e.g. Research, Construction, Design, Implementation, Administration)
