    Lookup codes are categorized or grouped by lookup type and the allowable values for lookup types are the lookup codes
    Predefined lookup types include:
        1099 Supplier,
        Exception, Acceptance Type,
        FOB (free on board),
        Freight Terms,
        Minority Group,
        Pay Group,
        PO/Requisition Reason,
        Price Type,
        Quotation Approval Reason,
        Reply/Receive Via, and
        Supplier Type.
    Exercise: Enter Lookup Codes -> PSU/Setup/Purchasing/Lookup Codes
        (also via -> System Administration/Lookup Codes)

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Quality Inspection Codes:
    Quality Inspection Codes are used to specify return reasons on inspected materials for returns.
    Quality Inspection Codes have rankings between 0 and 100, where 0 represents the lowest quality.
    Quality Inspection Codes can also define specific conditions, such as 'damaged goods' or excellent condition.
    Quality Inspection Codes are otherwise referred as Quality Codes
    Quality Codes are recorded on receiving inspections of goods and on return transactions (in the Receiving Returns window in the Details alternate region)
    Exercise: Enter Quality Inspection Codes -> PSU/Setup/Purchasing/Quality Inspection Codes, and enter return reason and inspection code values and rankings

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Financial Options:
    Financial Options include accounting, budgetary, control, encumbrance, payment, personnel, purchasing, VAT and supplier options
    Financial Options must be set up for each operating unit.
    There are seven alternate regions: accounting, encumbrance, HR, supplier-payables, supplier-purchasing, supplier entry and tax.
    Accounting options include the future open period limit and default accounts used in payables and purchasing
    Encumbrance options enable encumbrances on budgets for requisitions and purchase orders, and to enter encumbrance types
    HR options identify the business group, which approval hierarchies to use, and default AP mailing of expense checks (home or office), and employee numbering
    Supplier-Payables options defaults payment terms, payment method, receipt acceptance days, discount offer.
    Supplier-Purchasing options defaults the ship-to, bill-to, inventory org, FOB, carrier, and freight terms
    Supplier-Entry options default values when entering suppliers: RFQ only sites, hold options on unmatched invoices, and supplier numbering
    Tax options allow selection of a default tax name, enabling tax recovery, tax calculation rounding rules, and VAT registration number
    Exercise: Set financial options for purchasing -> PSU/Organizations/Financial Options, to choose set of books, default accounts, and other defaults.

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Purchasing (and Requisitioning) Options:
    Purchasing options establish defaults and controls for purchasing
    Purchasing option 'Receipt Close Tolerance' can be over-ridden at the item and PO shipment line level to enable or disable receiving
    If the 'Receipt Close Tolerance' is set to 100% then PO shipment lines are automatically closed to receiving when they are created
    Purchasing option 'Invoice Close Tolerance' can be overridden at the item and PO shipment line level.
    If the 'Invoice Close Tolerance' is set to 100% then the PO shipment lines are automatically closed to invoice matching when they are created
    Purchasing option 'Invoice Matching Level' can be overridden at the Inventory Organization, Supplier, Item and PO Shipment Line level
    Purchasing options has several alternate regions: accrual, control, default, internal, numbering and tax
    Accrual options include: rules for accruing expenses and inventory charges on receipt or at period end, and the default expense accrual account
    Control options include: defaults for price tolerances, full lot quantities, receipt close point (accepted, delivered, received point), cancelling requisitions, and security hierarchy,
    Control options also include:
        displaying messages,
        notification of blanket PO's,
        allowance of item description updates,
        enforcing buyer name, and
        enforcing vendor holds
    Price tolerance is the percent tolerance allowed between a requisition and a purchase order price
    The Cancel Requisitions option sets the rules for canceling requisition lines
        when a purchase order is cancelled
        Values are:
            never, optionally and always
    Enforce Vendor Hold determines if purchase orders can be approved if a vendor is put on hold
    'Enforce Buyer Name' is on the Control Alternate Region
        It enforces the buyer name to be the user's name on the PO entry form
    Default options on the Purchasing Options Default tab include:
        requisition import group,
        minimum release amount,
        price break type,
        quote warning delay,
        receipt close tolerance percent and
        invoice close percent
    Default options also include:
        line type,
        rate type,
        taxable,
        price type,
        RFQ requested,
        invoice close percent, and
        invoice matching
    Internal options apply to internal requisitions and purchase orders and include:
        set the default the internal order type and
        set the default for internal order source
        in order entry for requisitions sourced from internal orders
    Numbering options are: manual or automatic, and numbering type (numeric or alphanumeric)
        Using these options you can automate or manually create:
            Purchase Order Numbers
            Requistions Numbers
            Quotation Numbers
            RFQ (Request for Quotation) Numbers
    Tax options set the order in which tax names are defaulted onto purchasing documents
    Exercise: Set purchasing options
        -> Purchasing Super User/Setup/Organizations/Purchasing Options
            to set purchasing and requisitioning options
    Exercise: Define line types
        -> Purchasing Super User/Setup/Purchasing/Line Types

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Receiving Options:
    Several receiving options are contained on the purchasing options forms, especially receipt close tolerances.
        See purchasing options for more information
    Most receiving options can be overridden for specific suppliers, items and purchase orders.
    Options include:
        receipt days
        over-receipt tolerance
        receipt numbering
        substitution rules
        unordered item rules
        allowing express transactions
    Additional options include:
        allow cascade receipts
        allow blind receiving
        receipt routing
        enforcing ship-to
        ASN control code
        and receipt accrual account
Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Receiving Options:
    Exercise: set receiving options -> Purchasing Superuser/Setup/Organizations/Receiving Options, to set options for receipt numbering, data ranges, overreceipt limits and misc controls

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Locations:
    Locations are setup for ship-to, bill-to, receiving and other location info for purchasing documents
        This includes "deliver-to" for iProcurement)
    Receiving locations are temporary receiving areas for intermediate storage of goods
        they are primarily for inspection before being stored or used
    Receiving locations are not used if the routing is direct receipt.
        They apply to standard receipt routing which involves inspections
    Locations have three alternate regions: address, ship-to and other.
        The Address alternate region incudes address style.
        Address style must be defined before an address can be entered
    The Shipping alternate region includes contact name, ship-to equivalent location, and allowable activities checkboxes
        The Other Details alternate region includes inventory org, EDI location, and default site tax code/name
    The tax code in the other details region is used for tax calculation if the tax hierarchy points to ship-to location for tax values
    Deliver-To locations can be entered as 'one-time' addresses in iProcurement
    Exercise: Create locations -> PSU/Setup/Organizations/Locations

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Suppliers:
    In R12, Suppliers are stored in AP.AP_SUPPLIERS
    Each supplier can have multiple sites (and each site is assigned an address and activities)
        Each site can have multiple supplier contacts
    Defaults are setup at supplier and supplier site level and can be overridden on requisitions, PO's and invoices
    Alternate regions at the supplier level are: General, Classification, Accounting, Control, Bank Accounts, EDI, Invoice Tax, Withholding Tax, Tax Reporting, Purchasing, Receiving
    Most information defaults to the supplier site alternate regions based on information at the supplier level, but can be over-ridden at the supplier site level
    The supplier tables and supplier entry forms are shared with Accounts Payable and can be setup in either place. Ownership should be established in either place
    Suppliers are automatically assigned numbers when the new supplier is first saved, if the AutoNumber option is set in Financial Options - Supplier Entry Tab
    Suppliers are shared across organizations in a multi-org environment so duplicate supplier checks should be run before entering a new supplier
    Header Region -> tax Registration Number is for supplier companies, Taxpay ID is for individuals who are suppliers
    Header Region -> the taxpayer ID for individuals and employees is always their social security number
    Header Region -> entering an 'inactive date' will end-date a supplier and stop invoices and purchase orders being assigned to the supplier after a specified date
    General Region -> Parent suppliers can receive payment for suppliers' invoices
    General Region -> holds the parent supplier, and the customer number used by the supplier to reference your company
    Classification Region -> is for reference information only, except for employee name. If the type is entered as 'Employee' an employee name can be entered
    Classification Region -> the classifications for Supplier Type and Minority code are established using Lookup Codes
    Classification Region -> employees are linked to their supplier records by entering employee after setting the Supplier Type = 'Employee'
    Classification Region -> the 'one time' check box on the Classification region is for reference only, to indicate it is not expected to do any future business with this supplier
    Accounting Region -> establishes default accounts for: expense/capital distribution, liability (ap), prepayment and future dated payment
    Accounting Region -> values are defaulted from the Financial Options - Accounting Alternate Region, for the organization
    Accounting Region -> Is not enterable (greyed out) if Multi-org is turned on. These accounts must be entered at the site level.
    Control Region -> identifies the matching method (PO 2 way or receipt 3 way), invoice amount limit, and holds for unmatched, unvalidated or all invoices, plus a hold reason
    Control Region -> the invoice amount limit is the maximum per invoice. Invoices exceeding this amount will be put on hold
    Control Region -> the matching method is defaulted from the Financials Options for the organization/operating unit
    Control Region -> 'Hold All Payments' prevents any invoices entered for a supplier or supplier site from being selected for payment processing in AP.
        All future invoices can be placed on hold by checking the 'hold all invoices' option
    Control Region -> 'Hold Unapproved Invoices' puts all invoices on hold as they are entered but allows existing approved invoices to be paid in AP
    Control Region -> 'Hold Unmatched Invoices' places a matching required hold on all unmatched invoices in AP
    Control Region -> Match holds in the control region should not be turned on for employees who are reimbursed expenses, or for direct pay suppliers who do not receive purchase orders
    Payment Terms Region -> is defaulted from the Payables Options values. These values specify payment terms and dates and payment vs invoice currency defaults
    Payment Terms Region -> apart from the standard default values, it is normal to check 'Exclude Freight from Discount'
    Payment Terms Region -> payment priority is between 1 and 99 with 99 being the lowest priority for payment
    Payment Terms Region -> paygroup is used by AP to group invoices for a single payment run. All invoices can be paid in batches by paygroup.
    Payment Terms Region -> the Pay Alone field enforces a separate payment for an invoice. The invoice is not grouped with other invoices on a single combined payment in AP
    Bank Accounts Region -> establishes the suppliers' bank account for electronic payments - bank details are setup separately in Setup/Banks and linked to the supplier
    Bank Accounts Region -> One of the bank accounts must be defined as the primary bank account for each supplier for each currency entered on the form, in order to save the bank account record
    EDI Region -> stores the electronic payment method and format, remittance method and special instructions
    EDI methods supported include: ACH (Automated Clearing House), BACS (Bank Automated Clearing System), SWT (Swift), FWT/FEW (Fed Wire Method 1 and 2).
    Invoice Tax Region -> sets the calculation level for automatic taxes on invoices, a default tax value for an invoice and an override allowed flag to override at invoice entry
    Withholding Tax Region -> turns on withholding tax for the vendor and associates a withholding tax group, such as 1099.
    Tax Reporting Region -> adds detail for 1099 reportable vendors only - along with filing classifications for the 1099 vendor
    Purchasing Region -> identifies the default ship-to and bill-to default locations, ship via, FOB and freight terms that defaults to the Supplier Sites
    Purchasing Region -> most of the region defaults are derived from the Purchasing Options and Financial Options values for the organization.
    Purchasing Region -> the Purchase Order Hold checkbox is used to put all future purchase orders on hold for this supplier, and allows a hold reason to be recorded
    Purchasing Region -> 'Create Debit Memo....' allows workflow to create a debit memo automatically for a return to supplier (RTS) entry
    Receiving Region -> records supplier level receiving options: receipt date tolerances, receipt routing, matching level and receipt amount tolerances, and allow substitute items and unordered items
    Receiving Region -> most of the values in the Receiving alternate region of supplier setup are defaulted from the 'Receiving Optons' values at the organization level and override those values if changed
    Receiving Region -> freight can be excluded from taking an early payment discount by choosing 'Exclude Freight from Discoun' in the Payments alternate region

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Supplier Sites:
    In R12 Supplier Sites are in AP_SUPPLIER_SITES
    Supplier sites are addresses where suppliers conduct their business
    Supplier sites are classified into three types based on site use: their 'site uses' can be RFQ only, purchasing (PO allowed), and pay (invoicing allowed) sites
    You can enter invoices and make payments to supplier 'pay' sites
    You can create purchase orders with supplier 'purchasing' sites
    You can create RFQ's with supplier 'RFQ' only sites but cannot create purchase orders or enter invoices referencing those sites.
        Their purpose is to solicit bids from potiential suppliers
    After accepting an RFQ from a supplier at an 'RFQ Only' site, it is possible to change the site type to allow purchase orders
    Supplier site names do not appear on purchasing documents and remain internal references to supplier locations.
        Site names must be unique in their uppercase equivalent values
    Supplier site alternate regions are similar to the supplier alternate regions except for two addtional regions:
        Site Uses (to distinguish what is allowed at the site) and Telephone and Contacts
    There is no supplier site alternate region for receiving options as their is at the supplier level
    Supplier alternate region information automatically defaults to the supplier site alternate region and can be overridden at the supplier site with new values
    The General alternate region for a supplier site records the use of the site (purchasing, payment, RFQ only) and general contact numbers
    Supplier sites must exist for 'purchasing' and 'payment' if PO's are to be issued and invoices paid for the supplier.
        Check 'Purchasing' and 'Payment' on the General alternate region of a supplier sites
    The supplier notification method (email, fax, printed document) is recorded in the General Alternate region
        Also recorded are the addresses, email addresses and fax numbers needed to send the notifications
    The Contacts alternate region for a supplier site records people and their contact and mailing information
    The Accounting alternate region for a supplier site records accounts and distribution sets for:
        expenses and inventory, liability, prepayment, and future dated payment
    The Control alternate region is the same at the supplier site level as the supplier level.
        It tracks matching level, invoice amount limit and holds for unmatched, unvalidated or all invoices
    The Payment Terms alternate region at the Supplier Site level is the same as the Supplier level.
        It tracks payment terms, discount trigger dates, payment methods and currencies
    The Bank Accounts alternate region at the Supplier Site level is the same as the Supplier level.
        It tracks bank accounts and currencies and payment methods for remittances
    The EDI alternate region is the same at the Supplier site level as the supplier level.
        It identifies the electronic payment method and format, remittance method and special instructions.
    The Invoice Tax alternate region sets the calculation level for automatic taxes on invoices
        It also has a default tax value for an invoice and an override allowed flag to override at invoice entry
    Supplier sites are enabled as income tax reporting sites for 1099 vendors if the option is set on the 'Tax Reporting' alternate region.
        This is required for 1099 vendors
    Exercise: Setup Suppliers (in AP) -> APSU/Supply Base/Suppliers/

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Supplier Merge:
    Merging suppliers allows multiple suppliers to be merged into one
        This eliminates duplicates or to consolidate suppliers after an acquisition
    You can copy an old supplier site to a new supplier, and the old site will be deactivated
    Merging suppliers automatically transfers PO's and invoices, PO's can be excluded from the invoice merge if desired
    You can choose to merge all, none or only unpaid invoices
    Supplier merge does not transfer RFQ's, supplier lists and sourcing rules.
        These must be inspected and transfered manually
    Duplicate vendors can be identified by running the Vendor Audit Report or the Vendors Report
    Exercise: Merge Suppliers (in PO) -> APSU/Supply Base/Supplier Merge

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Requests for Quotation:
    A request for quotation (RFQ) is a request for pricing and related information sent to a supplier
        The information received from the supplier is placed on the catalog as a quotation if approved
    There are four types of RFQ: bid, standard, catalog and Sourcing. RFQ Types are specified in the RFQ header
        Bid RFQ's are for specific items and delivery dates and specific quantities - they have specific shipment qtys and locations,
        Catalog RFQ's are for high volume items purchased over a period of time - they have different qty's w/price breaks.
        Standard RFQ are for specific items and specialty items that are not ordered over a period of time but may have price breaks depending on volumes actually purchased
        Sourcing RFQ's are completed in the Oracle Sourcing application
        The ability to create sourcing RFQ's is enabled by the profile option -> PO: Allow Autocreation of Oracle Sourcing Docments = "Yes"
    RFQ's can be created manually, or automatically from requisitions, including req's where the RFQ Required field is checked
    Suppliers and supplier sites must exist before creating an RFQ, either individually or as a Supplier List
    RFQ's created automatically from requisitions and can be created from selected lines on the requisition or from all lines
    You do not need a requisition to create an RFQ, but any requistion marked 'RFQ Required' must have an RFQ generated
    RFQ's can contain specifications, target prices, order quantity ranges, standard classifications, and proposed shipments
    RFQ ship-to location on the header defaults to the shipment lines but can be over-ridden for each shipment line
    RFQ statuses are: in process (initial status), Active (ready for approval or sent to suppliers), and Closed (past effective end date)
    RFQ's can only be printed if they are 'Active' status
    Catalog RFQ's allow price breaks to be requested from the supplier for quantity ranges, terms and ship-to locations.
    Price breaks are specific to an RFQ line
    RFQ's can generate catalog quotations and standard quotations by using the copy function from within the RFQ
        You must enter suppliers in order to enable the copy option from the RFQ form
    Exercise: Create RFQ manually -> PSU/RFQ's and Quotations/RFQ's
    Exercise: Create catalog quote or standard quote from RFQ -> PSU/RFQ's and Quotations/RFQ's (query for RFQ and use tools/copy function to create quotation)

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Catalog Quotations, Bid Quotations and Standard Quotations:
    A quotation is a suppliers response to an RFQ
    Catalog quotations are for large purchases with limits over fixed time periods, whereas standard quotations are for minor occasional purchases over extended time periods
    Standard quotations don't track volumes of purchases, although volume based price breaks are available
    Quotations can be entered manually or throught the 'Copy Document' function from a RFQ form (query the RFQ and use copy)
    Quotations can also be copied to a blanket purchase agreement using the copy function from the catalog quote
    For automatically copied quotes, open the RFQ and choose the menu option 'Special/Copy Document' to create the corresponding quote
    For manually entered quotes, the supplier and supplier site are used to automatically build an LOV for the RFQ number, if any exist
    Form: Catalog Quote -> catalog quotes should be named after  the suppliers who provide the quotes
    Exercise: Create a catalog quotation -> PSU/RFQ's and Quotations/Quotations
    Table: PO_HEADERS_ALL -> query with TYPE_LOOKUP_CODE = 'QUOTATION' to get quotation headers

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Quotation Analysis
    Exercise: Quotation Analysis -> Purchasing Superuser/

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on the Tax Hierarchy and Tax Calculation
    Tax codes can be defaulted from multiple places in user defined order: ship-to location, item, supplier, supplier site, financial options
    The hierarchy for checking for tax codes is established in the Purchasing Options window - tax defaults alternate region.
    You can override the defaulted tax code if the profile option 'Tax: Allow Override of Tax Codes" is set to 'Yes'
    Recoverable rates can be set for each tax code, and specify the amount of credit you can claim for a tax
    Any tax code set in the Purchase Order preferences window will override the defaulted tax code
        preferences are treated as overrides at the requisition and purchase order entry point
    In Financial Options, the tax options region allows selection of a default tax name, enabling tax recovery, tax calculation rounding rules, and VAT registration number
    Tax codes carry tax names and the default charge account for the tax
    Taxes default onto lines on requisitions, purchase orders and blanket purchase orders based on the hierarchy established in Purchasing Options
    The tax default hierarchy is a user defined ranking, that checks for a tax code in several places:
        ship-to location, item, supplier-site, supplier and financial options (financial options window)
    Exercise: Setup tax hierarchy order -> PURCHASING/..../Purchasing Options and click on the Tax Defaults tab to specify the order of the hierarchy
    Profile Option -> Tax: Allow Override of Tax Codes - allows override of defaulted tax codes on a requisition

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Budget Checking and Encumbrance Accounting
    Encumbrances work off requisitions, purchase orders and invoices and are independent of receiving.
    Requisitions create encumbrances when they are submitted, and these encumbrances are transfered to PO's when they are approved
    Requisition and PO encumbrance amounts post to the encumbrance segment in a GL account.
    The GL Date on a requisition defines the period the encumbrance is applied against the budget
    Encumbrance segments offset budget segments for funds checking
    Encumbrances are relieved automatically when invoices are received and matched to purchase orders
        Matching to PO's closes or reduces net PO amounts
    Exercise: Check budget funds before submitting a requisition
        -> Menu/Special/Check Funds (this menu item is active only if encumbrance accounting is turned on)

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Purchasing Accruals and Month-End (Period-End) Processing:
    Purchasing receipt accruals are created for goods that are received but not yet billed
        i.e. invoice not received
        It creates reversing accruals on the ledger
    Purchasing periods must be opened before accounting transactions can be created such as purchase accruals
    Purchasing accruals act independently of budgetary control since accruals are optional
        So purchasing accruals and reversals don't relieve encumbrances (PO matching does that)
    Accruals can be set separately for inventory vs expense items
        Inventory item accrual transactions are created upon receipt
        Expense item accrual transactions can be created upon receipt or at month end
            Accrual upon receipt created a heavy reconciliation load and should be avoided - use month end accruals instead
            The concurrent process 'Receipt Accrual - Period End Process' must be run at month end to create the accruals
    Exercise: Set accrual options for inventory and expense ->
        Purchasing Super User/Setup/Purchasing Options/Accrual Tab (or Receipt Accounting Section in R12)
    Exercise: Accrue uninvoiced receipts after closing PO at month end -> PSU/Concurrent Manager/Receipt Accruals - Period End

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Requisition Preferences
    Requisition preferences are used to default project, destination, sourcing, currency, acccounting, justification and requestor options on the requisition footer
    The accounting distribution on requisition preferences applies to expense destination type items only and overrides the account generator values
    Requisition preferences apply for the current session only.
    Requisition preferences can be set from the Tools menu when the requisition form is displayed, and overridden at the line level
    The GL Date on the req preferences form is only active if budget and encumbrance processing is active
    Exercise: Enter requisition preferences -> PSU/Requisitions/Requisitions, and choose Tools, Preferences from the menu.

Purchasing and Receiving (PO) Notes on Requisitions
    Requisitions are internal requests for purchase orders and can be manual or automatic
    Destination type on a requisition can be shop floor (outside processing), inventory (stock enabled) or expense (delivered to requester).
        If the destination type is Expense, the goods are delivered to the requester at the specified location
        If the destination type is 'Inventory' a subinventory delivery location can be specified.
    Requisition structures have three levels: header, line, and distribution. One line can be split to multiple distributions
    Each distribution line has multiple accounts: charge account, budget account, accrual account, and any project related information
    Manual requisitions can have a different requester and preparer and both the requester name and the preparer name are tracked on the requisition
    MRP and Inventory can generate requisitions automatically for manufacturing planning and inventory economic order quantity restocking
    Automatic requistions from MRP and Inventory are loaded through requistion import, as are non-Oracle system requisitions
    Requisition Type ('Source Type') on a requisition drives default sourcing
        inventory (internal - creates sales order) or purchase (external - creates purchase order)
    Requisition Type at the requisition header level is over-ridden by source at the line level - Source is shown in the detail for each requisition line
    Document Type drives approvals, since approval hierarchies can be different for different document types, as defined through approval groups
    Source can be Inventory or Purchase, or both and can be restricted to one or other choices by a profile option
    Internal requisitions from employees (ie for internal items inventoried or sold by the company) are routed to Order Management and the Order Import Open Interface for processing
    Internal requistions are processed as an internal sales order
    Purchasing creates one sales order for each requisition line that has a Source of inventory on the requisition.
    Internal requisitions are identified by specifying the requisition type as 'Internal Requisition' on the requisition header a Source of  'Inventory' on a requisition line
    Each line on a purchase requisition can be sourced internally or through a supplier purchase, regardless of the requisition type
    Requisition Type of internal (inventory) or supplier, can be overridden in the 'Source Type' on individual requisition lines
    The price on an internally sourced requisition line is the cost of goods on the corresponding inventory item record
    The line type on a requisition is defaulted from purchasing options
        Navigation: Purchasing Options/'default' alternate region (goods, services, outside processing are seeded values)
        Line type on a requisition dictates the available fields and method for calculating the line
            value based, item and price-based etc
    Item numbers do not need to be entered on requisitions for expense items (ie non-inventory).
    An item description is required for an expense item and defaults from the item number for an inventory item. It is a required field
    Unit of measure on a req line defaults from the item master for an inventory item
    The price on a requisition line will default from a sourcing rule if one exists,
        otherwise the price can be entered manually
    Supplier item numbers can be entered in the Sourcing alternate region of a requisition line
    The requisitioner can request sourcing on the sourcing alternate region as 'blanket' or 'quotation'
    If a buyer is not nominated on a requisition, the requisition goes to the req pool for buyer assignment before creating a PO
        The PO is subsequently created by the AutoCreate process to pick up requisitions from the requisition pool
    Exercise: Create a requisition -> PSU/Requistions/Requisitions and specify type as purchase or internal.
    Exercise: Assign a requisiton to a buyer to create a PO -> PSU/...../Assign Requisitions

Purchasing and Receiving (PO) Notes on Entering Requisitions:
    01. Open the Requistions window (Requisitions/Requisitions)
    02. Check the menu Tools/Preferences to setup requisition preferences for the session if needed
    02. Enter the description in the requisition header and tab out to default values for the first requisition line. Go to the Lines alternate region
    03. Agree or change the line type and fill out the line.
    04. Enter an item number for an inventory item or skip to the category for a non-inventory item. Use Category MISC.MISC for non inventory items
    04. Search the catalog for items if they are inventory items, using an open query to select all items for a supplier, or some other method
    04. Click on distribution and fillout the charge code (tab into the charge code field and it defaults from the expense category default or the item default)
    05. Check and accept the Destination Type (Expense or Inventory) and override the requestor name if needed.
    05. If not a sourced catalog item, enter the buyer name and site (if known) and a contact name and number - or leave for the buyer to source the item
    05. Click the Approval button and submit for approval (check the menu Tools/Funds Check if enabled to do funds checking first)
    06. Go to Requisitions Summary and query the requisition
        then check the menu inquire/action history to see the status of the requisition approval

Purchasing and Receiving (PO) Notes on Requisition Import:
    Requisition import does not use the Account Generator for purchasing, so dynamic insertion of new GL codes is not supported.

Purchasing and Receiving (PO) Notes on Setups for Internally Sourced Requisitions (Internal Sales Orders)
    Setup for internally sourced requisitions involved Order Entry, Inventory and Purchasing
    Order entry setups for internal sales orders include
        profile options
        order cycles
        order source numbers
        order import sources
        std value rule sets
        price lists
        order types
        concurrent programs
    Inventory setups for internal sales orders include
        internal items
        inter-org shipping networks
        item sourcing
        concurrent programs
    Purchasing setups for Internal Sales Orders include
        internal requisition deliver-to sites
        purchasing options
        concurrent programs
    Oracle converts requisitions with requisition line source of  'internal' into sales orders
        No PO is created
        This establishes a demand against inventory.
    Two processes are used to create orders
        Create Internal Sales Order process, and
        Order Import process
    The 'Create Internal Sales Order' process takes internally sourced requisitions
        and creates internal sales orders on the order import interface tables
    Metalink Notes on Internal Sales Orders
        210124.1 Inter-Organization Sales Orders FAQ
        Note:199281.1 Importing Sales Orders and Returns
    Tables in the Order Import API include:
        OE_LINES_IFACE_ALL
        OE_HEADERS_IFACE_ALL

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Automatically Generating PO's from Requisitions
    Purchasing documents can be auto-created from requisitions using AutoCreate fromt the purchasing menu
    They can also be autocreated without buyer intervention
    The profile option -> PO: Automatic Document Sourcing" must be set to "Yes"
        This will allow automatic generation of purchase orders from requisitions
    The Contract Agreement used for the purchase order is the blanket purchase agreement for the supplier
        Blanket Purchase Agreements in a status "Requires Reapproval" are not used or considered
        The Blanket Purchase Agreement must also not be closed, finally closed, canceled at the header or line level
        The Expiration Date on the Blanket Purchase Agreement cannot be less than the sourcing date
    ASL's and sourcing rules are not required if requisitions or purchase orders are built by selecting sourced items
        Either from the internal supplier catalog or iProcurement catalog which are already sourced
    Automatic sourcing means you don't have to reference the source document on the ASL line in the ASL line definition
        the system finds the most recent document for the supplier and item
        Set profile option :PO: Automatic Sourcing Document" to Yes to provide automatic sourcing (at the site level)
    Steps to setup automatic sourcing and generation of purchase orders:
        1. set the profile option "PO: Automatic Document Sourcing" to "Yes"
        2. In Oracle Workflow Builder, set the poxwfatc.wft attributes
            Is Automatic Creation Allowed? = 'Y'
            Is Automatic Approval Allowed? = 'Y'
            Should Contract Be Used to AutoCreate Doc? = 'Y'
            Should Non-Catalog Requests Be Autosourced from Contract = 'Y'
        3. In Oracle Workflow Builder, set the poxsfrqa.wft attributes
            Send PO Autocreation to Background = 'N'
        4. Create a Contract Purchase Agreement (i.e. blanket)
        A new standard purchase order will be created subject to the buyer's approval limits and CPA limits

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on the Supplier Item Catalog:
    The Supplier Item Catalog provides a simple method of finding items and their source information - which are catalog quotes and blanket PO's.
    Items from the Supplier Item Catalog can be added into a requisition or purchase order with sourcing information already defined
    The catalog is automatically updated when suppliers send catalog quotes in responses to RFQ's, and blanket purchase agreements
    The Purchasing Documents Open Interface is used to import:
        supplier items and prices into catalogs,
        blanket purchasing agreements,
        quotations,
        approved supplier lists and
        sourcing rules

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Requisition Templates:
    Requisition templates are lists of items to requisition and provide a shortcut to building a requisition by starting with the template or list
    Each line on a requisition template can be sourced or unsourced and reference a different supplier
    Requisition templates are imported into the unified catalog as separate priced/sourced or unpriced/unsourced catalog entries
    Requistion templates are used to streamline the requisitioning process - they can be setup once and changed at any time
    Once a requisition template is defined, it can be selected from the supplier item catalog by name and added to the requisition
    Once defined, a requisition template can be referenced in a supplier item catalog, or selected in loaded into iProcurement and selected from that catalog
    Requisitions templates limit requisitions to fewer items and sources to simplify the requisitioning process, used for commonly ordered items like office supplies
    Requisition templates include the quantity of each item to include in a requisition and purchase order
    Requisition templates are typed - they can be purchase requisition templates or inventory templates. However the line Source can override the header type
    Requisition template lines can include inventory and expense type items (ie different destination types). A description and UOM must be entered for expense destination items
    Requisition template lines can be built by copying the lines from an existing requisition or purchase order using the Copy button on the req template window
    When entering a requistion template line, choosing sourced items will default the supplier, supplier site, price and suggested buyer
        Each item on a requisition template can have a price that is different to the source price
    Choosing non-sourced items, you can enter the suggested buyer and suggested supplier/supplier site on the template
    Choosing non-sourced items, you can specify RFQ Required to force an RFQ on individual items in the template when they are added to a requisition
    Multiple base/source req's and PO's can be copied into a single requisition template - the lines add to the existing lines on the template
    Requisition templates are created from PO's and req's using a copy button on requisition template form
    Exercise: Define a requisition template -> PSU/Setup/Purchasing/Requisition Templates - click on each line to see the matching supplier detail on the bottom of the form

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Purchase Orders Preferences:
    Only employees defined as buyers can define PO preferences
    Ship to and bill to locations can be setup to default on purchase orders
    Orders can be defaulted as confirming orders by setting the confirming orders checkbox on, in the Purchasing Preferences form
    Exercise: Enter purchase order preferences -> PSU/Purchase Orders/Purchase Orders/Options/Preferences, and enter PO preferences for the session

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Building Standard Purchase Orders:
    Tip -> use auto-create to place requisitions from the requisition pool onto purchase orders (menu 'autocreate')
    Tip -> you can see a PO approval workflow from the menu option on the PO form
    Tip -> when entering a purchase order directly, be sure to enter the ship-to at the header level or the PO will not complete
    Tip -> if you specify an inventory item there is a restriction on the inventory organzations and ship-to's you can place on the order
        The inventory item must be in the inventory master for the inventory organizations for the org to appear on list of values
    Standard Purchase Orders (PO's) are one-time commitments to buy specific listed items from a supplier.
    Purchase Order structure is header (top), line (second), shipment (third), distribution (fourth).
    The Distributions alternate region carries details of how the items are distributed once they are received, including internal accounting
    One PO can have many lines, each line can have many shipments and each shipment can have many account distributions
    A single line on a requisition can have multiple lines with different suppliers on separate purchase orders
    Shipment lines define where items are to be shipped/delivered and distribution lines define the deliver-to locations and end-use accounting
    Entering a Standard Purchase Order requires specifying shipments and distribution lines based on those shipments which identify the inventory or expense account charged
    The default ship-to on a purchase order is taken from the default ship-to on the supplier site - it is only a default
        The actual ship-to location is on the shipment line
    There are several alternate regions on the PO Entry form for line detail: Items, Pricing, Reference Docs, and Shipments
    PO numbers can be automatically or manually assigned - as specified in the purchasing options form, alternate region 'numbering'
    PO statuses are: Incomplete (PO being created), Approved, Requires Reapproval (modifed after approval), and In Process (PO has been forwarded for approval)
    If you delete a PO the requisitions assigned to the PO are returned to the requisition pool for re-creation using AutoCreate
    The currency on a PO is defaulted from the functional currency on the set of books tied to the operating unit
    Currency is changed through the currency action button on the PO form, and allows a conversion/exchange rate to be entered
    Defaulted terms are modified by the terms action button on the PO form and allow changes to payment terms, freight terms, title transfer point
    Terms also allow recording of confirming order, firm order, require PO acceptance, acceptance date, supplier note and receiver note
    PO's tagged as confirming orders print a warning on the PO "This is a confirming order - do not duplicate' to prevent suppliers entering the order as a duplicate of a previous verbal order
    Service items are entered with a quantity of one and a unit price equal to the service price
    The pricing alternate region on a PO is used to enter additional pricing comparisons for analysis on the 'Savings Analysis Report' and to limit price changes on releases
    Additional prices include List Price, Market Price, and Price Type (which is a lookup code with seeded values: cost plus fee, cost plus percent, fixed, index, and variable)
    Pricing controls for releases (planned releases and blanket releases) include 'allow override' to allow a higher release price, a release price upper limit, and a flag to indicate a negotiated price on the PO
    The reference documents alternate regions shows the supplier quotation number and line number if a quotation was chosed from the supplier item catalog to create the PO line
    You can enter a contract agreement number to reference a supplier contract agreement.  The item total is added to the cumulative total for the contract agreement
    Only contract agreements for a supplier matching the PO header supplier can be added to the reference documents alternate region
    The 'more' region records the UNSPSC number, hazard class, transaction nature (lookup), and any attachments
    An item is checked as a capital item on the 'more' alternate region so it is created as an asset through the mass additions process in fixed assetsf
    The 'shipments' region allows multiple shipments for a single PO line. Click on the Shipments button on the PO to display all shipments for a single PO line
    The shipments region holds the ship-to, shipment line quantity, override promise date, need-by date (required for planned purchase orders), and over-ride tax code
    Receiving controls can be specified on the shipment lines (receiving controls button) for tolerances on quantities, dates and delivery location
    The 'distributions' region holds the account distribution and destination details (destination type, inventory and sub-inventory, deliver-to) of a shipment.
    The 'more' region within the distributions region holds requisition details
    Exercise: Enter a standard PO -> PSU/Purchase Orders/Purchase Orders, and choose Type = 'Standard PO', enter the shipment/distribution information before requesting approvals (the item drives the accounting defaults as an expense item or inventory item)

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Document Controls
    You can control PO status with different actions: Cancel, Final Close, Close for Receiving, Close for Invoicing, Delete, Freeze, Hold, Firm
    Tip -> change document status through the tools menu on the PO form (don't open the PO, just inquire/search for return results, then use Tools/Control)
    Exercise: Cancel a purchase order -> PSU/Purchase Orders/Purchase Order Summary/Find Purchase Orders.. and find the purchase order to cancel, then choose Menu/Control to cancel.

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Carriers on Purchase Orders
    Carriers can be specified on purchase orderes at the PO header level on the terms and conditions dialog
    Carrier information includes: freight terms, carrier (carrier name or carrier method such as rail) and FOB (origin or destination)
    Freight terms and FOB are defined as lookup types in the purchasing lookup types definitions
    The relationship between carriers and shipment methods can be established for each operating unit in the purchasing form 'Carrier-Ship Method Relationships'
    The default carrier, title transfer point and freight terms can be setup for suppliers using the purchasing options on the supplier definition form.
    Carriers can be defined for RFQ's at the header and line levels also, to form part of the RFQ terms and conditions

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Purchase Order Changes:
    PO revision numbers are generated if PO's are changed after they are approved and printed
    Suppliers cannot be changed on approved PO's - the PO must be cancelled and a new PO issued
    The supplier site on a PO can be changed if the profile option PO: Change Supplier Site, is set to yes
    The buyer name can be changed if the purchasing option 'enforce buyer name' is 'no' on the control region of the purchasing options form
    Units of measure on PO lines can be changed until the line is received or billed
        For almost any fields that are changed on an approved purchase order, the PO status will be changed to 'Requires Reapproval' when the changes are saved

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Purchase Order Statuses and Controls
    You can cancel an existing commitment to a supplier by cancelling a PO header, line, shipment or distribution
    By cancelling a PO or component of a PO, you cannot receive or match an invoice for payment against the cancelled component (header, line, shipment, distribution)
    Cancelling a component also cancels the components beneath that level: eg canceling a shipment line cancels all the distribution lines in the shipment.
    Documents that are cancelled at the header level can be purged. If encumbrance and budgetary accounting are used, the encumbrances for the cancelled commitments are reversed.
    Purchasing automatically closes shipments for receiving and invoice matching based on the close tolerances specified in the purchasing options window
    Once all shipments for a given purchasing line are closed, purchasing automatically closes the line
    When all lines for a given document are closed, purchasing automatically closes the document
    Purchase orders at the shipment level can be closed for invoicing, closed for receiving or closed
    You can close or reopen documents and their components for invoicing and receiving using the Control Documents window
    The Close for Invoicing status does not prevent matching an invoice to a receipt or a purchase order in the future
    Exercise: Examine and modify PO statuses at the header and line level in the Control Documents window -> PSU/Purchase Order Summary/(find)/ then menu/tools/controls - also available at the PO line level in the same form

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Purchase Order Approvals:
    The approval hierarchy can be changed in the core applications in the approval window but cannot be changed in iProcurement
                The approval dialog in core purchasing for purchase orders allows standard approval or forwarding to another person for approval
    Exercise: Select and approve existing purchase orders -> PSU/Purchase Orders/Purchasing Summary, and select purchase orders by status to submit for approval

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Building Accounts with Account Generator for Shipment Lines on Purchase Orders:
    Account Generator is used to build accounts on PO shipment lines for purchase orders, releases and requisitions
    Account Generator builds four accounts: purchasing charge, purchasing accrual, budget encumbrance and purchasing price variance.
    Account Generator uses the Destination Type of Expense, Inventory or Shop Floor to look up accounts from different default account sources
    Account Generator copies the charge account from the requisition to the purchase order if the account exists (and the PO is built on a requisition)
    Otherwise Account Generator builds the accounts for each shipment line based on destination type for each shipment
    For expense destination types, AG copies the expense account default from the item master
    If an item master does not exist, the expense account is defaulted from the requisitioner default expense account which is on the requisition
    The account generator for expenses accounting overrides segments with expense account charge rules entered through the Procure-to-Pay responsibility.
    Profile Option -> "Flexfields:Validate on Server" must be set to "No" to enable rules to be added to the expense account charge rules form
    For inventoried expense destination types, the AG copies the expense code from the subinventory default first, and looks at the item expense default second. It looks at the inventory organization parameters third
    For inventoried asset destination types, the AG copies the asset account from the subinventory default, and secondly from the org parameters asset account default.
    For shop floor destination, the AG looks at (in order): material, material overhead, resource, outside processing and overhead default accounts
    Profile Options: 'Account Generator:Run in Debug Mode' and 'PO:Set Debug Workflow On' - provides debug information on account generator issues.  Allows generation of a wfstat file for account generator.
    Account Generator has the option to allow dynamic insertion of new account codes when building account combinations

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Autocreating Standard PO's, Planned PO's, Blanket Releases and RFQ's from Requisitions:
    Buyers can use AutoCreate to generate different types of purchase orders from requisitions - by querying all requisitions where they are assigned as buyer
    Buyers can create standard purchase orders, RFQ's and Blanket Purchase Agreements through Autocreate
    Buyers can also create Sourcing RFQ's and Buyer Auctions from the Autocreate dialog
    Buyers can add to existing purchase orders, or create new purchase orders.
        If 'add-to' is chosen the system prompts for a purchase order number to extend.
    The location on the Auto-Create page defaults from the buyer definition - to pool/select requisitions for a specific ship-to
    In AutoCreate, the default category and ship to assigned to the buyer record defaults to the autocreated purchase orders
    Requisitions marked urgent can be autocreated on an expedited basis, separate from the bulk of requisitions - this is set in Requisition Preferences under the options menu
    Autocreate does not set the Terms on a purchase order to 'Acceptance Required' in the Terms form
    Edit the original requisiton when creating a PO in the "Modify Lines" dialog, by copying down the existing requisition lines onto new lines which automatically replaces the original lines
        If the profile option "PO: Restrict Requisition Line Modify to Quantity Split" enforces the same total item count on the new lines as existed on the original requisition line
    Autocreate in manual mode also allows the buyer to change the suggested supplier on the requistion - auto mode uses the suggested supplier on the requistion as the PO supplier
    Autocreate groups all requisition lines onto a PO having the same:
        item,
        item revision,
        line type,
        transaction reason and
        supplier item number
    Use Ctrl-Clk to highlight individual requistion lines to autocrate and click Auto to generate the purchase order
    Exercise: Autocreate a PO -> PSU/Autocreate, and find all requisitions that have a buyer name assigned (or blank the buyer name to retrieve all requ's)
    Exercise: Autocreate a PO from a Requisition -> PSU/Autocreate, click Find to view requisitions and check/select, then click 'Automatic' to create
    Exercise: Modify requisition lines when creating a PO: Purchasing Superuser/Autocreate/click Find using ReqNum (Clear Default Buyer), Display Req Lines/Tools/Modify and copy down requisition lines

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Blanket Purchasing Agreements:
    Purchase agreements can be blanket or contract types.
        Blanket purchasing agreements stipulate items, amounts and date ranges but not details of actual purchase order shipment
    Blanket agreements are used with individual releases and are appropriate if specific deliveries are not decided (ie may be triggered by an MRP system)
    Blanket agreements create sources for future purchase shipments by agreeing a price for items in advance.
    The supplier site can only be changed on a blanket purchase agreement if the profile option: PO: Change Supplier Site is set to Yes
    The ship-to and bill-to fields default from the supplier site, supplier and financial options default values respectively
    Blanket agreement terms specify payment and freight terms, limits on total value and minimum release values and effective date ranges
    Changing the Amount Limit on the financial terms does not update the Agreed Amount on the agreement header
    The currency window allows setting a different currency for the purchase agreement but valid exchange rates must be setup in advance
    If an item is not chosen for a blanket line, then a category is required for the typed in purchase description.
        The description must be added manually
    The price entered on the item line is a separate price to the list price and market price entered on the price reference region
    The Allow Price Override and Price Limit values on the Price Referency region allow a limit on prices where the release price exceeds the agreement price.
    In the Reference Documents region, you can't enter a contract agreeement number because this blanket agreement should be on it's own negotiated pricing
    If an item is chosen from a catalog quotation, the quotation details will display on the Reference Documents line.
        Blankets can be based on catalog quotations
    In the More region, UN numbers are exclusively for hazardous materials and don't relate to UNSPSC code values.
    The agreement section specifies the amount (volume and value) that can be released at any time and the pricing rule for price breaks
    If the pricing rule for price breaks is set to cumulative, then the pricing is based on the cumulative amount released to date and the amount of the current release
    The Price Break region specifies the discount for every quantity purchased within a quantity band. The quantity rule can apply to an individual release or cumulative releasess
    Exercise: Create a blanket purchase agreement -> PSU/Purchase Orders/Purchase Orders/.. .and choose type = 'Blanket Purchase Agreement'

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Supplier Lists
    Supplier Lists (SL's) can shorten the effort to issue RFQ's: SL's list the suppliers who will receive an RFQ if they are attached to the RFQ when it is defined
    Supplier Lists can be constructed to include competing suppliers for a single group of items purchased under the same agreement.
    Supplier Lists consist of suppliers and supplier sites, and optionally a contact name at each site for each supplier
    SL's can carry supplier and manufacturer part numbers as well as information about suppliers who are barred from supplying specific items
    Exercise: Create Supplier List: PSU/Supply Base/Supplier Lists, to create supplier lists for RFQ's
    Exercise: Attach a Supplier List to an RFQ: Purchasing Super User/RFQ's and Quotations/RFQ's.... create an RFQ "in progress" and click suppliers to attach an existing list

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Contract Purchase Agreements:
    Purchase Order Contracts and Blanket Agreements Overview (Doc ID 215784.1)
    Contract agreements give global buying authority with a supplier and do not require specific items or prices to be specified.
    Contract agreements are used with individual requisitions to create standard purchase orders
    Contract Purchase Agreements have general terms and require quotations, and subsequent PO's referencing the contract and the quote.
    Contract Purchase Agreements are used when the details of the items and prices are not known at the time of the contract
    RFQ's are issued under Contract Purchase Agreements where suppliers are prequalified and an approved and awarded quotations seals the final purchase.
    Subsequent standard purchase orders on Contract Purchase Agreements reference the quote and the contract purchase agreement
    The Create Documents workflow searches for Contract Purchase Agreements matching supplier sites on the requisition and places the requisition lines on a PO
    The PO references the Contract Purchase Agreement as the source document
    The workflow attribute CONTRACT_ID must be set to 'Yes' to enable contract purchasing agreement assignment
    Exercise: Enter contract purchase agreement -> PSU/Purchase Orders/Purchase Orders

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Blanket Purchase Agreements and Releases:
    Purchase Agreements can be Blanket Purchase Orders (term agreements for specific items with multiple releases)
    Blanket PO's are used by MRP to source requisitions
        Sourcing to a blanket PO is achieved through Sourcing Rules and Approved Supplier Lists
    Blanket Purchase Agreements define the items to buy but not the quantities or dates of delivery. They are shipped by blanket releases.
    Blanket PO's are entered without shipping information, which is required on Standard PO's. The shipping information is entered on the subsequent PO release.
    Requistions can be automatically sourced against blanket PO's (or catalog quotations)
    The supplier cannot be changed on an approved blanket purchasing agreement - the agreement must be cancelled and reentered
    The supplier site can be changed on a blanket purchasing agreement if the profile option PO: Change Supplier Site is set to Yes.
        However a revision number is incremented and reapproval is required.
    The ship-to and bill-to on a blanket PO header default from the financial options, or from the supplier values if a supplier is entered
    The buyer defaults from the user id if the user is defined as a buyer. Otherwise it remains blank
    The concurrent process Autorelease' must be run to create releases from requisitions
    Exercise: Enter a blanket PO -> PSU/Purchase Orders/Purchase Orders, and choose Type = 'Blanket PO',
        specify terms using the 'Terms' button, as well as price breaks

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Planned Purchase Orders and Scheduled Releases:
    Planned Purchase Orders are term agreements with listed items and accounting but no quantities
    Planned Purchase Orders have nominal dates for shipment but require releases to actuate.
    Planned Purchase Orders allow encumbering of budget accounts without issuing an actual purchase order - they have planned deliveries that blankets do not

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Sourcing with Approved Supplier Lists and Sourcing Rules
    Approved supplier lists are used in conjunction with sourcing rules to provide source information for an item, making sourcing a two stage process
    Sourcing rules default suppliers and supplier sites onto requisitions and PO's
        They determine the percentages of items that are sourced from different suppliers.
        They do not source the actual contract source document
            This is done through the Approved Supplier List (ASL) as a second step once the suppliers for the PO's are determined in the sourcing rules.
        Therefore sourcing rules are not considered 'approved' suppliers
         Because they do not require a source document to be set up when the sourcing rule is defined.
    Care must be taken in defining sourcing rules and ASL's to use the same org (or use 'global') as will be used on the requisitions.
    ASL's maintain lists of suppliers and items and valid source documents
        They are not used to automatically source a requisition line or purchase order
        A Sourcing Rule is required for that
    A Sourcing Rule is a named list of suppliers and supplier sites with effective dates.
        A sourcing rule is attached by an Assignment Set to a list of items
        The assignment set name must be set in the profile option MRP: Default Sourcing Assignment Set in order for it to be used for sourcing rules
            Purchasing uses only one assignment set for purchase sourcing and this is the one (planning can use multiple sets)
        The assignment set does not allow duplicate (ie overlapping or same organization, item and source type) assignment rules
    If a sourcing rule is made global (ie all orgs is checked) then it will appear on the assignment list for an item - type assignment, otherwise use item-organization as the assignment type
    The item uses the assignment set line to default the supplier and supplier site
        The Approved Supplier List finds a source purchasing document
            This is based on a matching supplier and item
    Sourcing rules allow multiple suppliers for an item
        The supplier with the highest rank is chosen as the source for a requisition line
    Create a Sourcing Rule and attach it to an item in an Assignment Set - this establishes a link between the item and a supplier
    The approved Supplier List uses the defaulted supplier and item to find a source document
        (a blanket agreement or catalog quotation)
    If 'Use Approved Supplier' is checked on the item in the requisition or purchase order ...
        an ASL entry must exist for the supplier on the sourcing rule or the supplier will not be used
    The linkage for sourcing becomes: Item -> Assignment Set -> Sourcing Rule (Supplier) -> Sourcing Rule -> Source Document (based on the item match)
    ASL's are not source documents but link quotes and blanket agreement source documents to requisition lines if an item and supplier are specified
        ASL's imported into iProcurement create a catalog item for each combination of item and approved supplier using the current quote price in core
    Sourcing rules require MRP setups and MRP uses sourcing rules to source supplier quotations or blanket PO lines to MRP requisitions
    ASL's and sourcing rules are not required if requisitions or purchase orders are built by selecting sourced items
        Either from the internal supplier catalog or iProcurement catalog which are already sourced
    You can specify a sourcing rule without specifying an ASL if you want to assign a supplier to a requisiton line.
        However you need to specify an ASL to source to the document level
    Automatic sourcing means you don't have to reference the source document on the ASL line in the ASL line definition
        the system finds the most recent document for the supplier and item
        Set profile option :PO: Automatic Sourcing Document" to Yes to provide automatic sourcing (at the site level)
    If you don't use automatic sourcing, you must specify the source document (blanket or quote) on the ASL line so Oracle can find the document
    Sourcing rules will source a requisition item to a supplier (and source document if there is an ASL setup) (catalog quotation or blanket purchase order)
    Sourcing rules actively place a source supplier and purchasing document on a requisition line or purchase order line as you enter the item
    If sourcing rules are not assigned to items, those items cannot be sourced to suppliers.
        Planned orders will not be generated for items without active sourcing rules
    Approved supplier lists will source a requisition item-and-supplier to an approved source document (such as a catalog quote or blanket PO)
    Sourcing Rules use the Sourcing Rule and SR/BOD Assignments windows to define supplier sources for items
    ASL's use the Approved Supplier List and Supplier-Item Attributes window to source items to a specific supplier and approved source document (blanket PO or quote)
    Requisitions sourced to a catalog quote become a purchase order, and requisitions sourced to a blanket PO become a release
        (unless there is a global agreement aka global blanket that will create PO's)
    Sourcing using both ASL's and Sourcing rules is first attempted at the item level, and then category level rules are checked
    Sourcing rules take precedence over Approved Supplier Lists
    Form: Sourcing Rules -> the Sourcing rule should be named the same as the commodities it is used to source.
    Form: Sourcing Rules -> 'planning active' means the total sourcing rule allocation percent totals 100% and it can be used to source planning orders
    Form: Sourcing Rules -> 'rank' on a sourcing rule lines breaks the tie between two lines with the same allocation percentage.
        The higher rank is allocated purchase orders first
    Form: Sourcing Rule Assignment -> 'Assigned To' can be 'item-organization' if the sourcing rule is defined for all organizations or the item is in the sourcing rule's organization
    Form: Approved Supplier List -> can handle supplier quotation lines for multiple items. Each new item in the top half of the form refreshes the bottom half of the form to make new blank entries
    Form: Approved Supplier List -> you can have multiple items in the top half of the form and one item in the bottom half to point multiple items to a single source quotation
    Form: Approved Supplier List -> when you enter the supplier for an item, the valid catalog quotation numbers are automatically searched and found to add as a valid source
    Exercise: Create sourcing rules -> PSU/Supply Base/Sourcing Rules/...
    Exercise: Assign sourcing rules -> PSU/Supply Base/Assign Sourcing Rules/....
    Exercise: Create approved supplier lists - PSU/Supply Base/Approved Supplier List

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Multiple Foreign Currencies:
    If 'Use Multiple Currencies' is set in the financial options for AP, multiple currencies can be entered and used in purchasing and catalogs
    Currencies must initially be defined in the General Ledger or through shared application forms in subledger applications
    Suggested foreign currencies can then be recorded on requisition lines
    The default currency on a new requisition is the functional currency specified in financial options for an AP implementation
    If a requisition sources a foreign currency blanket PO or catalog quote, the foreign currency information is defaulted onto the requisition
    Purchasing uses the functional currency to calculate the total on a requistion to validate approved spending limits
    Currency can be entered as a requisition preference in the Req Preferences window to default the currency to each line
    The actual requistion currency is entered in the currency region of the requisition either through Purchasing or through Self Service iProcurement

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Matching:
    Matching can be two way (PO/Invoice), three way (PO/Invoice/Receipt) and four way (PO/Invoice/Receipt/Inspection)
    Four way matching is available for inventory items but not expense items
    Matching is governed by tolerances which can be set by quantity or value: on the Invoice Tolerance form
    Invoices entered in AP are matched to PO's for each invoice line by entering the PO number against the invoice line on the 'Match to Purchase Orders' form

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Receiving:
    Receiving References
        FAQ - Receiving.RECEIPTS [ID 1249431.1]
        Periods - Aid To Resolving Receiving Transaction Date Error APP-PO-14376 PO_CNL_NO_PERIOD, PO_INV_NO_OPEN_PERIOD and PO_PO_ENTER_OPEN_GL_DATE Errors [ID 1317136.1]
    Tip -> use 'Receiving > Receipts' to create a receipt (this is the 'Expected Receipts' form - you cannot find existing receipts here
           use 'Receiving > Receiving Transactions Summary' to find receipts already created
    Tip -> use the menu item 'Receiving -> Receipts' to find expected receipts and create receipts
    Tip -> you must use the 'Receipts' form to create an initial receipt - don't use receipts inquiry because it will only look for receipts already made.
    Tip -> to receive on the core forms, you must click the line to receive, or it won't save and won't give a receipt number
    Tip -> receiving transactions are different to receipts, and move a receipt to it's final destination
    Tip -> direct delivery automatically creates a final delivery transaction to its final destination for a receipt
    Form -> "Receiving Transactions" is for searching for receipts that need final delivery 'transactions' to move items to their final destination.
        Don't search for receipts already delivered here.
        Use this form to enter inspection information and to move the goods to their final destination
    Form -> "Receipts" is for searching for purchase orders open for receiving. If the routing is 'Direct Delivery' it will also create a receiving transaction to it's final destination
    Receiving includes: recording the receipt, inspecting for quality and moving to it's final destination
    The receiving process can ber manual (enter all values), express (receive everything on a single PO) or cascade (spread a receipt across multiple shipments)
    Additional costs can be captured at time of receipt, including freight and taxes not on the original PO, plus miscellaneous charges and exchange rate shifts
    There are three types of receiving: standard, ,direct, and 'inspection required'
    Exchange rate variance accounts can be posted with the difference between rates at the time the PO was issued, and rates at the time of receiving
    Standard receiving involves receiving at a receiving location such as a dock and creating a separate transaction for put away or final delivery
        In Oracle, you can modify the receipt routing at the organization receiving options level, or at the item level, to Standard receipt routing
        After creating the receiving transaction using the 'Receipts' menu choice, you create the second delivery transaction using the 'Receiving Transactions' menu choice
    Direct receiving limits receipt to the final destination or one-step receiving, otherwise referred to as 'dock-to-stock'
    The final receiving destination can be the requestor, inventory or the shop-floor
    An 'inspection required' receipt is a two step receipt, involving an initial receipt and a quality inspection and final delivery
    Inspection receipts are triggered by tagging the item's receiving options. Inspections can also involve returns to supplier
    Receiving defaults are set at multiple levels: purchasing options, receiving options, supplier, supplier site, inventory organization, and purchase order
    Receiving controls can be entered on the PO line to set tolerances for substitutes, quantity variances and early/late deliveries
    Receiving controls can be set at a high level for Receiving Close Tolerance on the Purchasing Options form
    Receiving close tolerance
    Receipt transactions include: receipts, transfers, deliveries (to final destination), returns to vendors and corrections
        Returns are entered on the receiving window
        Corrections to quantities received are done in the Receiving Corrections window
        You cannot undo or delete a receipt once it is made but you can correct the quantities received and enter new receipt transactions
    Receiving starts with the Find Expected Receipts window which provides a number of criteria, including Receiving Location
    Alternate regions on the 'Find Expected Receipts' window allow you to search on item detail and data ranges
    No PO information is available in the 'Order Information' alternate region of the Receiving form for unordered receipts
    Receiving records: receipt date, shipment no, BOL, shipped date, packing slip no, way/airbill no, carrier, number of containers, receiver, source and comments
    Express receiving assumes the PO or ASN quantity is delivered, and accepts corrections to those quantities from the receiver.
    Express receiving is performed by clicking 'Express' in the Receiving Window and specifying a putaway location for all the listed receipts
    Express receiving is enabled in Purchasing Options (Receiving Options Alternate Region) with the 'Allow Express Transactions' flag
    Blind receiving ignores a quantity check against the PO when the receipt is recorded - the receiver must count every item 'blind' or without PO or ASN information.
        This method is the most time consuming
    Tolerance fences can be specified in ASL's: as percentages that capacity can be increased in a specified timeframe by a supplier
    ASN's accelerate the receiving process, by providing specific information about the receipt expected details: packing slip, carrier, barcode, date and waybill number
    Receiving data recorded includes: packing slip, date, waybill and receipt comments
    Purchase order lines are closed when the receipts are processed, and the purchase order is automatically closed when all lines on the PO are closed
    Cascade receipts applies a single 'available to receive' quantity to multiple receipt lines in displayed order from earliest promise date
    The option to cascade is set in the Purchasing Options window
    Closing old PO's with still-open lines require manual procedures or alerts to monitor and notify users to review
    Received items are sent to inventory, users or shop floor depending upon the delivery instructions on the PO lines.
    Receipt Travellers can be printed and attached to received goods to specify internal delivery instructions.
    Receiving substitute items involved choosing the LOV for items on the receiving line and picking the substitute - it must be defined as substitute to appear on the list
    Exercise: Set Purchasing Options -> PURCHASING/Setup/Organizations/Purchasing Options and set the close tolerance to 100% to autoclose all lines for receiving
    Exercise: Set Receiving Options for an Inventory Org -> PURCHASING/Organizations/Receiving Options to set miscellaneous receiving controls
    Exercise: Receive an item -> PURCHASING/Receiving/Receipts, and enter the PO number to receive against, to find the PO details.
        Change the destination type from Receiving, to Inventory, and specify the subinventory
    Exercise: Transact a receipt (route to inspection or inventory) -> PURCHASING/Receiving/Receiving Transactions
    Exercise: View corrections to receiving transactions -> PURCHASING/Receiving/Corrections (enter tran type = "CORRECT' in find dialog)
    Exercise: Return a receipt -> PURCHASING/Receiving/Returns (specify quantity of candidate returns to make)

Purchasing  and Receiving (PO) Notes on Entering a Receipt:
    01. Navigate to the Receipts window and query back a purchase order that is available for receiving.
    02. Check you are in the correct operating unit organization for receiving. The OPU abbreviation will be in the form window header. Change Organization is a navigator menu option
    02. Fill out the receiving header information and save.
    03. Choose the Lines Alternate region on the receipts window and click the checkbox for the line to receive.
    04. Enter the destination type (expense, inventory or shop floor) and fill out the remaining information - actual quantity received, and other line details
    05. Use the Details alternate region to record the packing list, supplier lot, reason code and comments.
    06. Save the work and the system will generate a receipt transaction number.

Purchasing and Receiving (PO Schema) Notes on Entering an Unordered Receipt:(see Setup > Organizations > Receiving Options)
    Unordered receipts are controlled by the receiving option 'Allow Unordered Receipts'
    Unordered receipts can be entered with no reference to a purchase order, and later tied to a PO after it is entered
